TCPDF

The Woocommerce Products Designer TCPDF class.

Defined (2)

The class is defined in the following location(s).

/includes/tcpdf/tcpdf.php  
  1. /* @class TCPDF 
  2.  * PHP class for generating PDF documents without requiring external extensions. 
  3.  * TCPDF project (http://www.tcpdf.org) has been originally derived in 2002 from the Public Domain FPDF class by Olivier Plathey (http://www.fpdf.org), but now is almost entirely rewritten.<br> 
  4.  * @package com.tecnick.tcpdf 
  5.  * @brief PHP class for generating PDF documents without requiring external extensions. 
  6.  * @version 6.0.085 
  7.  * @author Nicola Asuni - info@tecnick.com 
  8.  */ 
  9. class TCPDF { 
  10.  
  11. // Protected properties 
  12.  
  13. /** 
  14.  * Current page number. 
  15.  * @protected 
  16.  */ 
  17. protected $page; 
  18.  
  19. /** 
  20.  * Current object number. 
  21.  * @protected 
  22.  */ 
  23. protected $n;

  778. protected $currpagegroup = 0;

  784.  */ 
  785. protected $extgstates; 
  786.

  792. protected $jpeg_quality;

  799. protected $cell_height_ratio = K_CELL_HEIGHT_RATIO; 
  800.  
  801. /** 
  802.  * PDF viewer preferences. 
  803.  * @protected

  805.  */ 
  806. protected $viewer_preferences; 
  807.  
  808. /** 
  809.  * A name object specifying how the document should be displayed when opened. 
  810.  * @protected 
  811.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-06-09) 
  812.  */ 
  813. protected $PageMode; 
  814.  
  815. /** 
  816.  * Array for storing gradient information. 
  817.  * @protected 
  818.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-06-09) 
  819.  */ 
  820. protected $gradients = array(); 
  821.  
  822. /** 
  823.  * Array used to store positions inside the pages buffer (keys are the page numbers). 
  824.  * @protected 
  825.  * @since 3.2.000 (2008-06-26) 
  826.  */ 
  827. protected $intmrk = array(); 
  828.  
  829. /** 
  830.  * Array used to store positions inside the pages buffer (keys are the page numbers). 
  831.  * @protected 
  832.  * @since 5.7.000 (2010-08-03) 
  833.  */ 
  834. protected $bordermrk = array(); 
  835.  
  836. /**

  838.  * @protected 
  839.  * @since 5.8.007 (2010-08-18) 
  840.  */ 
  841. protected $emptypagemrk = array(); 
  842.  
  843. /**

  846.  * @since 4.6.021 (2009-07-20) 
  847.  */ 
  848. protected $cntmrk = array(); 
  849.

  854.  */ 
  855. protected $footerpos = array();

  861.  */ 
  862. protected $footerlen = array(); 
  863.

  866.  * @protected 
  867.  * @since 3.2.000 (2008-07-01) 
  868.  */ 
  869. protected $newline = true; 
  870.

  873.  * @protected 
  874.  * @since 3.2.000 (2008-07-01) 
  875.  */ 
  876. protected $endlinex = 0; 
  877.

  881.  * @since 3.0.006 (2008-07-16) 
  882.  */ 
  883. protected $linestyleWidth = ''; 
  884.

  887.  * @protected 
  888.  * @since 3.0.006 (2008-07-16) 
  889.  */ 
  890. protected $linestyleCap = '0 J'; 
  891.

  894.  * @protected 
  895.  * @since 3.0.006 (2008-07-16) 
  896.  */ 
  897. protected $linestyleJoin = '0 j'; 
  898.  
  899. /**

  901.  * @protected 
  902.  * @since 3.0.006 (2008-07-16) 
  903.  */ 
  904. protected $linestyleDash = '[] 0 d'; 
  905.

  1340.  
  1341. /** 
  1342.  * Text rendering mode: 0 = Fill text; 1 = Stroke text; 2 = Fill, then stroke text; 3 = Neither fill nor stroke text (invisible); 4 = Fill text and add to path for clipping; 5 = Stroke text and add to path for clipping; 6 = Fill, then stroke text and add to path for clipping; 7 = Add text to path for clipping. 
  1343.  * @protected 
  1344.  * @since 4.9.008 (2010-04-03) 
  1345.  */ 
  1346. protected $textrendermode = 0;

  1458.  
  1459. /**

  1461.  * @protected 
  1462.  * @since 5.9.097 (2011-06-23) 
  1463.  */ 
  1464. protected $n_dests; 
  1465.  
  1466. /** 
  1467.  * Embedded Files Names 
  1468.  * @protected 
  1469.  * @since 5.9.204 (2013-01-23) 
  1470.  */ 
  1471. protected $efnames = array(); 
  1472.

  1474.  * Directory used for the last SVG image. 
  1475.  * @protected 
  1476.  * @since 5.0.000 (2010-05-05) 
  1477.  */ 
  1478. protected $svgdir = ''; 
  1479.

  1481.  *  Deafult unit of measure for SVG. 
  1482.  * @protected 
  1483.  * @since 5.0.000 (2010-05-02) 
  1484.  */ 
  1485. protected $svgunit = 'px'; 
  1486.

  1491.  */ 
  1492. protected $svggradients = array();

  1498.  */ 
  1499. protected $svggradientid = 0; 
  1500.

  1502.  * Boolean value true when in SVG defs group.

  1505.  */ 
  1506. protected $svgdefsmode = false; 
  1507.

  1512.  */ 
  1513. protected $svgdefs = array();

  1520. protected $svgclipmode = false;

  1527. protected $svgclippaths = array();

  1534. protected $svgcliptm = array();

  1541. protected $svgclipid = 0;

  1548. protected $svgtext = '';

  1554.  */ 
  1555. protected $svgtextmode = array(); 
  1556.  
  1557. /** 
  1558.  * Array of SVG properties. 
  1559.  * @protected 
  1560.  * @since 5.0.000 (2010-05-02) 
  1561.  */ 
  1562. protected $svgstyles = array(array( 
  1563.     'alignment-baseline' => 'auto',  
  1564.     'baseline-shift' => 'baseline',  
  1565.     'clip' => 'auto',  
  1566.     'clip-path' => 'none',  
  1567.     'clip-rule' => 'nonzero',  
  1568.     'color' => 'black',  
  1569.     'color-interpolation' => 'sRGB',  
  1570.     'color-interpolation-filters' => 'linearRGB',  
  1571.     'color-profile' => 'auto',  
  1572.     'color-rendering' => 'auto',  
  1573.     'cursor' => 'auto',  
  1574.     'direction' => 'ltr',  
  1575.     'display' => 'inline',  
  1576.     'dominant-baseline' => 'auto',  
  1577.     'enable-background' => 'accumulate',  
  1578.     'fill' => 'black',  
  1579.     'fill-opacity' => 1,  
  1580.     'fill-rule' => 'nonzero',  
  1581.     'filter' => 'none',  
  1582.     'flood-color' => 'black',  
  1583.     'flood-opacity' => 1,  
  1584.     'font' => '',  
  1585.     'font-family' => 'helvetica',  
  1586.     'font-size' => 'medium',  
  1587.     'font-size-adjust' => 'none',  
  1588.     'font-stretch' => 'normal',  
  1589.     'font-style' => 'normal',  
  1590.     'font-variant' => 'normal',  
  1591.     'font-weight' => 'normal',  
  1592.     'glyph-orientation-horizontal' => '0deg',  
  1593.     'glyph-orientation-vertical' => 'auto',  
  1594.     'image-rendering' => 'auto',  
  1595.     'kerning' => 'auto',  
  1596.     'letter-spacing' => 'normal',  
  1597.     'lighting-color' => 'white',  
  1598.     'marker' => '',  
  1599.     'marker-end' => 'none',  
  1600.     'marker-mid' => 'none',  
  1601.     'marker-start' => 'none',  
  1602.     'mask' => 'none',  
  1603.     'opacity' => 1,  
  1604.     'overflow' => 'auto',  
  1605.     'pointer-events' => 'visiblePainted',  
  1606.     'shape-rendering' => 'auto',

  1608.     'stop-opacity' => 1,  
  1609.     'stroke' => 'none',  
  1610.     'stroke-dasharray' => 'none',  
  1611.     'stroke-dashoffset' => 0,  
  1612.     'stroke-linecap' => 'butt',  
  1613.     'stroke-linejoin' => 'miter',  
  1614.     'stroke-miterlimit' => 4,  
  1615.     'stroke-opacity' => 1,  
  1616.     'stroke-width' => 1,  
  1617.     'text-anchor' => 'start',  
  1618.     'text-decoration' => 'none',  
  1619.     'text-rendering' => 'auto',  
  1620.     'unicode-bidi' => 'normal',  
  1621.     'visibility' => 'visible',  
  1622.     'word-spacing' => 'normal',  
  1623.     'writing-mode' => 'lr-tb',  
  1624.     'text-color' => 'black',  
  1625.     'transfmatrix' => array(1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0) 
  1626.  )); 
  1627.  
  1628. /** 
  1629.  * If true force sRGB color profile for all document. 
  1630.  * @protected 
  1631.  * @since 5.9.121 (2011-09-28) 
  1632.  */ 
  1633. protected $force_srgb = false; 
  1634.

  1637.  * @protected 
  1638.  * @since 5.9.121 (2011-09-27) 
  1639.  */ 
  1640. protected $pdfa_mode = false; 
  1641.

  1646.  */ 
  1647. protected $doc_creation_timestamp;

  1653.  */ 
  1654. protected $doc_modification_timestamp; 
  1655.

  1657.  * Custom XMP data. 
  1658.  * @protected

  1660.  */ 
  1661. protected $custom_xmp = ''; 
  1662.  
  1663. /** 
  1664.  * Overprint mode array. 
  1665.  * (Check the "Entries in a Graphics State Parameter Dictionary" on PDF 32000-1:2008). 
  1666.  * @protected 
  1667.  * @since 5.9.152 (2012-03-23) 
  1668.  */ 
  1669. protected $overprint = array('OP' => false, 'op' => false, 'OPM' => 0); 
  1670.

  1672.  * Alpha mode array. 
  1673.  * (Check the "Entries in a Graphics State Parameter Dictionary" on PDF 32000-1:2008). 
  1674.  * @protected 
  1675.  * @since 5.9.152 (2012-03-23) 
  1676.  */ 
  1677. protected $alpha = array('CA' => 1, 'ca' => 1, 'BM' => '/Normal', 'AIS' => false); 
  1678.  
  1679. /** 
  1680.  * Define the page boundaries boxes to be set on document. 
  1681.  * @protected 
  1682.  * @since 5.9.152 (2012-03-23) 
  1683.  */ 
  1684. protected $page_boxes = array('MediaBox', 'CropBox', 'BleedBox', 'TrimBox', 'ArtBox'); 
  1685.  
  1686. /** 
  1687.  * If true print TCPDF meta link. 
  1688.  * @protected 
  1689.  * @since 5.9.152 (2012-03-23) 
  1690.  */ 
  1691. protected $tcpdflink = true; 
  1692.  
  1693. /** 
  1694.  * Cache array for computed GD gamma values. 
  1695.  * @protected 
  1696.  * @since 5.9.1632 (2012-06-05) 
  1697.  */ 
  1698. protected $gdgammacache = array(); 
  1699.  
  1700. //------------------------------------------------------------ 
  1701. // METHODS 
  1702. //------------------------------------------------------------ 
  1703.  
  1704. /** 
  1705.  * This is the class constructor. 
  1706.  * It allows to set up the page format, the orientation and the measure unit used in all the methods (except for the font sizes). 
  1707.  *  
  1708.  * IMPORTANT: Please note that this method sets the mb_internal_encoding to ASCII, so if you are using the mbstring module functions with TCPDF you need to correctly set/unset the mb_internal_encoding when needed. 
  1709.  *  
  1710.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>P or Portrait (default)</li><li>L or Landscape</li><li>'' (empty string) for automatic orientation</li></ul> 
  1711.  * @param $unit (string) User measure unit. Possible values are:<ul><li>pt: point</li><li>mm: millimeter (default)</li><li>cm: centimeter</li><li>in: inch</li></ul><br />A point equals 1/72 of inch, that is to say about 0.35 mm (an inch being 2.54 cm). This is a very common unit in typography; font sizes are expressed in that unit. 
  1712.  * @param $format (mixed) The format used for pages. It can be either: one of the string values specified at getPageSizeFromFormat() or an array of parameters specified at setPageFormat(). 
  1713.  * @param $unicode (boolean) TRUE means that the input text is unicode (default = true) 
  1714.  * @param $encoding (string) Charset encoding (used only when converting back html entities); default is UTF-8. 
  1715.  * @param $diskcache (boolean) If TRUE reduce the RAM memory usage by caching temporary data on filesystem (slower). 
  1716.  * @param $pdfa (boolean) If TRUE set the document to PDF/A mode. 
  1717.  * @public 
  1718.  * @see getPageSizeFromFormat(), setPageFormat() 
  1719.  */ 
  1720. public function __construct($orientation='P', $unit='mm', $format='A4', $unicode=true, $encoding='UTF-8', $diskcache=false, $pdfa=false) { 
  1721.     /** Set internal character encoding to ASCII */ 
  1722.     if (function_exists('mb_internal_encoding') AND mb_internal_encoding()) { 
  1723.         $this->internal_encoding = mb_internal_encoding(); 
  1724.         mb_internal_encoding('ASCII'); 
  1725.     } 
  1726.     $this->font_obj_ids = array(); 
  1727.     $this->page_obj_id = array(); 
  1728.     $this->form_obj_id = array(); 
  1729.     // set pdf/a mode 
  1730.     $this->pdfa_mode = $pdfa; 
  1731.     $this->force_srgb = false; 
  1732.     // set disk caching 
  1733.     $this->diskcache = $diskcache ? true : false; 
  1734.     // set language direction 
  1735.     $this->rtl = false; 
  1736.     $this->tmprtl = false; 
  1737.     // some checks 
  1738.     $this->_dochecks(); 
  1739.     // initialization of properties 
  1740.     $this->isunicode = $unicode; 
  1741.     $this->page = 0; 
  1742.     $this->transfmrk[0] = array(); 
  1743.     $this->pagedim = array(); 
  1744.     $this->n = 2; 
  1745.     $this->buffer = ''; 
  1746.     $this->pages = array(); 
  1747.     $this->state = 0; 
  1748.     $this->fonts = array(); 
  1749.     $this->FontFiles = array(); 
  1750.     $this->diffs = array(); 
  1751.     $this->images = array(); 
  1752.     $this->links = array(); 
  1753.     $this->gradients = array(); 
  1754.     $this->InFooter = false; 
  1755.     $this->lasth = 0; 
  1756.     $this->FontFamily = defined('PDF_FONT_NAME_MAIN')?PDF_FONT_NAME_MAIN:'helvetica'; 
  1757.     $this->FontStyle = ''; 
  1758.     $this->FontSizePt = 12; 
  1759.     $this->underline = false; 
  1760.     $this->overline = false; 
  1761.     $this->linethrough = false; 
  1762.     $this->DrawColor = '0 G'; 
  1763.     $this->FillColor = '0 g'; 
  1764.     $this->TextColor = '0 g'; 
  1765.     $this->ColorFlag = false; 
  1766.     $this->pdflayers = array(); 
  1767.     // encryption values 
  1768.     $this->encrypted = false; 
  1769.     $this->last_enc_key = ''; 
  1770.     // standard Unicode fonts 
  1771.     $this->CoreFonts = array( 
  1772.         'courier'=>'Courier',  
  1773.         'courierB'=>'Courier-Bold',  
  1774.         'courierI'=>'Courier-Oblique',  
  1775.         'courierBI'=>'Courier-BoldOblique',  
  1776.         'helvetica'=>'Helvetica',  
  1777.         'helveticaB'=>'Helvetica-Bold',  
  1778.         'helveticaI'=>'Helvetica-Oblique',  
  1779.         'helveticaBI'=>'Helvetica-BoldOblique',  
  1780.         'times'=>'Times-Roman',  
  1781.         'timesB'=>'Times-Bold',  
  1782.         'timesI'=>'Times-Italic',  
  1783.         'timesBI'=>'Times-BoldItalic',  
  1784.         'symbol'=>'Symbol',  
  1785.         'zapfdingbats'=>'ZapfDingbats' 
  1786.  ); 
  1787.     // set scale factor 
  1788.     $this->setPageUnit($unit); 
  1789.     // set page format and orientation 
  1790.     $this->setPageFormat($format, $orientation); 
  1791.     // page margins (1 cm) 
  1792.     $margin = 28.35 / $this->k; 
  1793.     $this->SetMargins($margin, $margin); 
  1794.     $this->clMargin = $this->lMargin; 
  1795.     $this->crMargin = $this->rMargin; 
  1796.     // internal cell padding 
  1797.     $cpadding = $margin / 10; 
  1798.     $this->setCellPaddings($cpadding, 0, $cpadding, 0); 
  1799.     // cell margins 
  1800.     $this->setCellMargins(0, 0, 0, 0); 
  1801.     // line width (0.2 mm) 
  1802.     $this->LineWidth = 0.57 / $this->k; 
  1803.     $this->linestyleWidth = sprintf('%F w', ($this->LineWidth * $this->k)); 
  1804.     $this->linestyleCap = '0 J'; 
  1805.     $this->linestyleJoin = '0 j'; 
  1806.     $this->linestyleDash = '[] 0 d'; 
  1807.     // automatic page break 
  1808.     $this->SetAutoPageBreak(true, (2 * $margin)); 
  1809.     // full width display mode 
  1810.     $this->SetDisplayMode('fullwidth'); 
  1811.     // compression 
  1812.     $this->SetCompression(); 
  1813.     // set default PDF version number 
  1814.     $this->setPDFVersion(); 
  1815.     $this->tcpdflink = true; 
  1816.     $this->encoding = $encoding; 
  1817.     $this->HREF = array(); 
  1818.     $this->getFontsList(); 
  1819.     $this->fgcolor = array('R' => 0, 'G' => 0, 'B' => 0); 
  1820.     $this->strokecolor = array('R' => 0, 'G' => 0, 'B' => 0); 
  1821.     $this->bgcolor = array('R' => 255, 'G' => 255, 'B' => 255); 
  1822.     $this->extgstates = array(); 
  1823.     $this->setTextShadow(); 
  1824.     // signature 
  1825.     $this->sign = false; 
  1826.     $this->tsa_timestamp = false; 
  1827.     $this->tsa_data = array(); 
  1828.     $this->signature_appearance = array('page' => 1, 'rect' => '0 0 0 0', 'name' => 'Signature'); 
  1829.     $this->empty_signature_appearance = array(); 
  1830.     // user's rights 
  1831.     $this->ur['enabled'] = false; 
  1832.     $this->ur['document'] = '/FullSave'; 
  1833.     $this->ur['annots'] = '/Create/Delete/Modify/Copy/Import/Export'; 
  1834.     $this->ur['form'] = '/Add/Delete/FillIn/Import/Export/SubmitStandalone/SpawnTemplate'; 
  1835.     $this->ur['signature'] = '/Modify'; 
  1836.     $this->ur['ef'] = '/Create/Delete/Modify/Import'; 
  1837.     $this->ur['formex'] = ''; 
  1838.     // set default JPEG quality 
  1839.     $this->jpeg_quality = 75; 
  1840.     // initialize some settings 
  1841.     TCPDF_FONTS::utf8Bidi(array(''), '', false, $this->isunicode, $this->CurrentFont); 
  1842.     // set default font 
  1843.     $this->SetFont($this->FontFamily, $this->FontStyle, $this->FontSizePt); 
  1844.     $this->setHeaderFont(array($this->FontFamily, $this->FontStyle, $this->FontSizePt)); 
  1845.     $this->setFooterFont(array($this->FontFamily, $this->FontStyle, $this->FontSizePt)); 
  1846.     // check if PCRE Unicode support is enabled 
  1847.     if ($this->isunicode AND (@preg_match('/\pL/u', 'a') == 1)) { 
  1848.         // PCRE unicode support is turned ON 
  1849.         // \s     : any whitespace character 
  1850.         // \p{Z}  : any separator 
  1851.         // \p{Lo} : Unicode letter or ideograph that does not have lowercase and uppercase variants. Is used to chunk chinese words. 
  1852.         // \xa0   : Unicode Character 'NO-BREAK SPACE' (U+00A0) 
  1853.         //$this->setSpacesRE('/(?!\xa0)[\s\p{Z}\p{Lo}]/u'); 
  1854.         $this->setSpacesRE('/(?!\xa0)[\s\p{Z}]/u'); 
  1855.     } else { 
  1856.         // PCRE unicode support is turned OFF 
  1857.         $this->setSpacesRE('/[^\S\xa0]/'); 
  1858.     } 
  1859.     $this->default_form_prop = array('lineWidth'=>1, 'borderStyle'=>'solid', 'fillColor'=>array(255, 255, 255), 'strokeColor'=>array(128, 128, 128)); 
  1860.     // set file ID for trailer 
  1861.     $serformat = (is_array($format) ? serialize($format) : $format); 
  1862.     $this->file_id = md5(TCPDF_STATIC::getRandomSeed('TCPDF'.$orientation.$unit.$serformat.$encoding)); 
  1863.     // set document creation and modification timestamp 
  1864.     $this->doc_creation_timestamp = time(); 
  1865.     $this->doc_modification_timestamp = $this->doc_creation_timestamp; 
  1866.     // get default graphic vars 
  1867.     $this->default_graphic_vars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  1868.     $this->header_xobj_autoreset = false; 
  1869.     $this->custom_xmp = ''; 
  1870. } 
  1871.  
  1872. /** 
  1873.  * Default destructor. 
  1874.  * @public 
  1875.  * @since 1.53.0.TC016 
  1876.  */ 
  1877. public function __destruct() { 
  1878.     // restore internal encoding 
  1879.     if (isset($this->internal_encoding) AND !empty($this->internal_encoding)) { 
  1880.         mb_internal_encoding($this->internal_encoding); 
  1881.     } 
  1882.     // unset all class variables 
  1883.     $this->_destroy(true); 
  1884. } 
  1885.  
  1886. /** 
  1887.  * Set the units of measure for the document. 
  1888.  * @param $unit (string) User measure unit. Possible values are:<ul><li>pt: point</li><li>mm: millimeter (default)</li><li>cm: centimeter</li><li>in: inch</li></ul><br />A point equals 1/72 of inch, that is to say about 0.35 mm (an inch being 2.54 cm). This is a very common unit in typography; font sizes are expressed in that unit. 
  1889.  * @public 
  1890.  * @since 3.0.015 (2008-06-06) 
  1891.  */ 
  1892. public function setPageUnit($unit) { 
  1893.     $unit = strtolower($unit); 
  1894.     //Set scale factor 
  1895.     switch ($unit) { 
  1896.         // points 
  1897.         case 'px': 
  1898.         case 'pt': { 
  1899.             $this->k = 1; 
  1900.             break; 
  1901.         } 
  1902.         // millimeters 
  1903.         case 'mm': { 
  1904.             $this->k = $this->dpi / 25.4; 
  1905.             break; 
  1906.         } 
  1907.         // centimeters 
  1908.         case 'cm': { 
  1909.             $this->k = $this->dpi / 2.54; 
  1910.             break; 
  1911.         } 
  1912.         // inches 
  1913.         case 'in': { 
  1914.             $this->k = $this->dpi; 
  1915.             break; 
  1916.         } 
  1917.         // unsupported unit 
  1918.         default : { 
  1919.             $this->Error('Incorrect unit: '.$unit); 
  1920.             break; 
  1921.         } 
  1922.     } 
  1923.     $this->pdfunit = $unit; 
  1924.     if (isset($this->CurOrientation)) { 
  1925.         $this->setPageOrientation($this->CurOrientation); 
  1926.     } 
  1927. } 
  1928.  
  1929. /** 
  1930.  * Change the format of the current page 
  1931.  * @param $format (mixed) The format used for pages. It can be either: one of the string values specified at getPageSizeFromFormat() documentation or an array of two numbers (width, height) or an array containing the following measures and options:<ul> 
  1932.  * <li>['format'] = page format name (one of the above);</li> 
  1933.  * <li>['Rotate'] : The number of degrees by which the page shall be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value shall be a multiple of 90.</li> 
  1934.  * <li>['PZ'] : The page's preferred zoom (magnification) factor.</li> 
  1935.  * <li>['MediaBox'] : the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page shall be displayed or printed:</li> 
  1936.  * <li>['MediaBox']['llx'] : lower-left x coordinate</li> 
  1937.  * <li>['MediaBox']['lly'] : lower-left y coordinate</li> 
  1938.  * <li>['MediaBox']['urx'] : upper-right x coordinate</li> 
  1939.  * <li>['MediaBox']['ury'] : upper-right y coordinate</li> 
  1940.  * <li>['CropBox'] : the visible region of default user space:</li> 
  1941.  * <li>['CropBox']['llx'] : lower-left x coordinate</li> 
  1942.  * <li>['CropBox']['lly'] : lower-left y coordinate</li> 
  1943.  * <li>['CropBox']['urx'] : upper-right x coordinate</li> 
  1944.  * <li>['CropBox']['ury'] : upper-right y coordinate</li> 
  1945.  * <li>['BleedBox'] : the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment:</li> 
  1946.  * <li>['BleedBox']['llx'] : lower-left x coordinate</li> 
  1947.  * <li>['BleedBox']['lly'] : lower-left y coordinate</li> 
  1948.  * <li>['BleedBox']['urx'] : upper-right x coordinate</li> 
  1949.  * <li>['BleedBox']['ury'] : upper-right y coordinate</li> 
  1950.  * <li>['TrimBox'] : the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming:</li> 
  1951.  * <li>['TrimBox']['llx'] : lower-left x coordinate</li> 
  1952.  * <li>['TrimBox']['lly'] : lower-left y coordinate</li> 
  1953.  * <li>['TrimBox']['urx'] : upper-right x coordinate</li> 
  1954.  * <li>['TrimBox']['ury'] : upper-right y coordinate</li> 
  1955.  * <li>['ArtBox'] : the extent of the page's meaningful content:</li> 
  1956.  * <li>['ArtBox']['llx'] : lower-left x coordinate</li> 
  1957.  * <li>['ArtBox']['lly'] : lower-left y coordinate</li> 
  1958.  * <li>['ArtBox']['urx'] : upper-right x coordinate</li> 
  1959.  * <li>['ArtBox']['ury'] : upper-right y coordinate</li> 
  1960.  * <li>['BoxColorInfo'] :specify the colours and other visual characteristics that should be used in displaying guidelines on the screen for each of the possible page boundaries other than the MediaBox:</li> 
  1961.  * <li>['BoxColorInfo'][BOXTYPE]['C'] : an array of three numbers in the range 0-255, representing the components in the DeviceRGB colour space.</li> 
  1962.  * <li>['BoxColorInfo'][BOXTYPE]['W'] : the guideline width in default user units</li> 
  1963.  * <li>['BoxColorInfo'][BOXTYPE]['S'] : the guideline style: S = Solid; D = Dashed</li> 
  1964.  * <li>['BoxColorInfo'][BOXTYPE]['D'] : dash array defining a pattern of dashes and gaps to be used in drawing dashed guidelines</li> 
  1965.  * <li>['trans'] : the style and duration of the visual transition to use when moving from another page to the given page during a presentation</li> 
  1966.  * <li>['trans']['Dur'] : The page's display duration (also called its advance timing): the maximum length of time, in seconds, that the page shall be displayed during presentations before the viewer application shall automatically advance to the next page.</li> 
  1967.  * <li>['trans']['S'] : transition style : Split, Blinds, Box, Wipe, Dissolve, Glitter, R, Fly, Push, Cover, Uncover, Fade</li> 
  1968.  * <li>['trans']['D'] : The duration of the transition effect, in seconds.</li> 
  1969.  * <li>['trans']['Dm'] : (Split and Blinds transition styles only) The dimension in which the specified transition effect shall occur: H = Horizontal, V = Vertical. Default value: H.</li> 
  1970.  * <li>['trans']['M'] : (Split, Box and Fly transition styles only) The direction of motion for the specified transition effect: I = Inward from the edges of the page, O = Outward from the center of the pageDefault value: I.</li> 
  1971.  * <li>['trans']['Di'] : (Wipe, Glitter, Fly, Cover, Uncover and Push transition styles only) The direction in which the specified transition effect shall moves, expressed in degrees counterclockwise starting from a left-to-right direction. If the value is a number, it shall be one of: 0 = Left to right, 90 = Bottom to top (Wipe only), 180 = Right to left (Wipe only), 270 = Top to bottom, 315 = Top-left to bottom-right (Glitter only). If the value is a name, it shall be None, which is relevant only for the Fly transition when the value of SS is not 1.0. Default value: 0.</li> 
  1972.  * <li>['trans']['SS'] : (Fly transition style only) The starting or ending scale at which the changes shall be drawn. If M specifies an inward transition, the scale of the changes drawn shall progress from SS to 1.0 over the course of the transition. If M specifies an outward transition, the scale of the changes drawn shall progress from 1.0 to SS over the course of the transition. Default: 1.0.</li> 
  1973.  * <li>['trans']['B'] : (Fly transition style only) If true, the area that shall be flown in is rectangular and opaque. Default: false.</li> 
  1974.  * </ul> 
  1975.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul> 
  1976.  * <li>P or Portrait (default)</li> 
  1977.  * <li>L or Landscape</li> 
  1978.  * <li>'' (empty string) for automatic orientation</li> 
  1979.  * </ul> 
  1980.  * @protected 
  1981.  * @since 3.0.015 (2008-06-06) 
  1982.  * @see getPageSizeFromFormat() 
  1983.  */ 
  1984. protected function setPageFormat($format, $orientation='P') { 
  1985.     if (!empty($format) AND isset($this->pagedim[$this->page])) { 
  1986.         // remove inherited values 
  1987.         unset($this->pagedim[$this->page]); 
  1988.     } 
  1989.     if (is_string($format)) { 
  1990.         // get page measures from format name 
  1991.         $pf = TCPDF_STATIC::getPageSizeFromFormat($format); 
  1992.         $this->fwPt = $pf[0]; 
  1993.         $this->fhPt = $pf[1]; 
  1994.     } else { 
  1995.         // the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page shall be displayed or printed 
  1996.         if (isset($format['MediaBox'])) { 
  1997.             $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'MediaBox', $format['MediaBox']['llx'], $format['MediaBox']['lly'], $format['MediaBox']['urx'], $format['MediaBox']['ury'], false, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  1998.             $this->fwPt = (($format['MediaBox']['urx'] - $format['MediaBox']['llx']) * $this->k); 
  1999.             $this->fhPt = (($format['MediaBox']['ury'] - $format['MediaBox']['lly']) * $this->k); 
  2000.         } else { 
  2001.             if (isset($format[0]) AND is_numeric($format[0]) AND isset($format[1]) AND is_numeric($format[1])) { 
  2002.                 $pf = array(($format[0] * $this->k), ($format[1] * $this->k)); 
  2003.             } else { 
  2004.                 if (!isset($format['format'])) { 
  2005.                     // default value 
  2006.                     $format['format'] = 'A4'; 
  2007.                 } 
  2008.                 $pf = TCPDF_STATIC::getPageSizeFromFormat($format['format']); 
  2009.             } 
  2010.             $this->fwPt = $pf[0]; 
  2011.             $this->fhPt = $pf[1]; 
  2012.             $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'MediaBox', 0, 0, $this->fwPt, $this->fhPt, true, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2013.         } 
  2014.         // the visible region of default user space 
  2015.         if (isset($format['CropBox'])) { 
  2016.             $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'CropBox', $format['CropBox']['llx'], $format['CropBox']['lly'], $format['CropBox']['urx'], $format['CropBox']['ury'], false, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2017.         } 
  2018.         // the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment 
  2019.         if (isset($format['BleedBox'])) { 
  2020.             $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'BleedBox', $format['BleedBox']['llx'], $format['BleedBox']['lly'], $format['BleedBox']['urx'], $format['BleedBox']['ury'], false, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2021.         } 
  2022.         // the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming 
  2023.         if (isset($format['TrimBox'])) { 
  2024.             $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'TrimBox', $format['TrimBox']['llx'], $format['TrimBox']['lly'], $format['TrimBox']['urx'], $format['TrimBox']['ury'], false, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2025.         } 
  2026.         // the page's meaningful content (including potential white space) 
  2027.         if (isset($format['ArtBox'])) { 
  2028.             $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'ArtBox', $format['ArtBox']['llx'], $format['ArtBox']['lly'], $format['ArtBox']['urx'], $format['ArtBox']['ury'], false, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2029.         } 
  2030.         // specify the colours and other visual characteristics that should be used in displaying guidelines on the screen for the various page boundaries 
  2031.         if (isset($format['BoxColorInfo'])) { 
  2032.             $this->pagedim[$this->page]['BoxColorInfo'] = $format['BoxColorInfo']; 
  2033.         } 
  2034.         if (isset($format['Rotate']) AND (($format['Rotate'] % 90) == 0)) { 
  2035.             // The number of degrees by which the page shall be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value shall be a multiple of 90. 
  2036.             $this->pagedim[$this->page]['Rotate'] = intval($format['Rotate']); 
  2037.         } 
  2038.         if (isset($format['PZ'])) { 
  2039.             // The page's preferred zoom (magnification) factor 
  2040.             $this->pagedim[$this->page]['PZ'] = floatval($format['PZ']); 
  2041.         } 
  2042.         if (isset($format['trans'])) { 
  2043.             // The style and duration of the visual transition to use when moving from another page to the given page during a presentation 
  2044.             if (isset($format['trans']['Dur'])) { 
  2045.                 // The page's display duration 
  2046.                 $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Dur'] = floatval($format['trans']['Dur']); 
  2047.             } 
  2048.             $stansition_styles = array('Split', 'Blinds', 'Box', 'Wipe', 'Dissolve', 'Glitter', 'R', 'Fly', 'Push', 'Cover', 'Uncover', 'Fade'); 
  2049.             if (isset($format['trans']['S']) AND in_array($format['trans']['S'], $stansition_styles)) { 
  2050.                 // The transition style that shall be used when moving to this page from another during a presentation 
  2051.                 $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['S'] = $format['trans']['S']; 
  2052.                 $valid_effect = array('Split', 'Blinds'); 
  2053.                 $valid_vals = array('H', 'V'); 
  2054.                 if (isset($format['trans']['Dm']) AND in_array($format['trans']['S'], $valid_effect) AND in_array($format['trans']['Dm'], $valid_vals)) { 
  2055.                     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Dm'] = $format['trans']['Dm']; 
  2056.                 } 
  2057.                 $valid_effect = array('Split', 'Box', 'Fly'); 
  2058.                 $valid_vals = array('I', 'O'); 
  2059.                 if (isset($format['trans']['M']) AND in_array($format['trans']['S'], $valid_effect) AND in_array($format['trans']['M'], $valid_vals)) { 
  2060.                     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['M'] = $format['trans']['M']; 
  2061.                 } 
  2062.                 $valid_effect = array('Wipe', 'Glitter', 'Fly', 'Cover', 'Uncover', 'Push'); 
  2063.                 if (isset($format['trans']['Di']) AND in_array($format['trans']['S'], $valid_effect)) { 
  2064.                     if (((($format['trans']['Di'] == 90) OR ($format['trans']['Di'] == 180)) AND ($format['trans']['S'] == 'Wipe')) 
  2065.                         OR (($format['trans']['Di'] == 315) AND ($format['trans']['S'] == 'Glitter')) 
  2066.                         OR (($format['trans']['Di'] == 0) OR ($format['trans']['Di'] == 270))) { 
  2067.                         $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Di'] = intval($format['trans']['Di']); 
  2068.                     } 
  2069.                 } 
  2070.                 if (isset($format['trans']['SS']) AND ($format['trans']['S'] == 'Fly')) { 
  2071.                     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['SS'] = floatval($format['trans']['SS']); 
  2072.                 } 
  2073.                 if (isset($format['trans']['B']) AND ($format['trans']['B'] === true) AND ($format['trans']['S'] == 'Fly')) { 
  2074.                     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['B'] = 'true'; 
  2075.                 } 
  2076.             } else { 
  2077.                 $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['S'] = 'R'; 
  2078.             } 
  2079.             if (isset($format['trans']['D'])) { 
  2080.                 // The duration of the transition effect, in seconds 
  2081.                 $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['D'] = floatval($format['trans']['D']); 
  2082.             } else { 
  2083.                 $this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['D'] = 1; 
  2084.             } 
  2085.         } 
  2086.     } 
  2087.     $this->setPageOrientation($orientation); 
  2088. } 
  2089.  
  2090. /** 
  2091.  * Set page orientation. 
  2092.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>P or Portrait (default)</li><li>L or Landscape</li><li>'' (empty string) for automatic orientation</li></ul> 
  2093.  * @param $autopagebreak (boolean) Boolean indicating if auto-page-break mode should be on or off. 
  2094.  * @param $bottommargin (float) bottom margin of the page. 
  2095.  * @public 
  2096.  * @since 3.0.015 (2008-06-06) 
  2097.  */ 
  2098. public function setPageOrientation($orientation, $autopagebreak='', $bottommargin='') { 
  2099.     if (!isset($this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox'])) { 
  2100.         // the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page shall be displayed or printed 
  2101.         $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'MediaBox', 0, 0, $this->fwPt, $this->fhPt, true, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2102.     } 
  2103.     if (!isset($this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox'])) { 
  2104.         // the visible region of default user space 
  2105.         $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'CropBox', $this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['llx'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['lly'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['urx'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['ury'], true, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2106.     } 
  2107.     if (!isset($this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox'])) { 
  2108.         // the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment 
  2109.         $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'BleedBox', $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['llx'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['lly'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['urx'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['ury'], true, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2110.     } 
  2111.     if (!isset($this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox'])) { 
  2112.         // the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming 
  2113.         $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'TrimBox', $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['llx'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['lly'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['urx'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['ury'], true, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2114.     } 
  2115.     if (!isset($this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox'])) { 
  2116.         // the page's meaningful content (including potential white space) 
  2117.         $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::setPageBoxes($this->page, 'ArtBox', $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['llx'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['lly'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['urx'], $this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['ury'], true, $this->k, $this->pagedim); 
  2118.     } 
  2119.     if (!isset($this->pagedim[$this->page]['Rotate'])) { 
  2120.         // The number of degrees by which the page shall be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value shall be a multiple of 90. 
  2121.         $this->pagedim[$this->page]['Rotate'] = 0; 
  2122.     } 
  2123.     if (!isset($this->pagedim[$this->page]['PZ'])) { 
  2124.         // The page's preferred zoom (magnification) factor 
  2125.         $this->pagedim[$this->page]['PZ'] = 1; 
  2126.     } 
  2127.     if ($this->fwPt > $this->fhPt) { 
  2128.         // landscape 
  2129.         $default_orientation = 'L'; 
  2130.     } else { 
  2131.         // portrait 
  2132.         $default_orientation = 'P'; 
  2133.     } 
  2134.     $valid_orientations = array('P', 'L'); 
  2135.     if (empty($orientation)) { 
  2136.         $orientation = $default_orientation; 
  2137.     } else { 
  2138.         $orientation = strtoupper($orientation[0]); 
  2139.     } 
  2140.     if (in_array($orientation, $valid_orientations) AND ($orientation != $default_orientation)) { 
  2141.         $this->CurOrientation = $orientation; 
  2142.         $this->wPt = $this->fhPt; 
  2143.         $this->hPt = $this->fwPt; 
  2144.     } else { 
  2145.         $this->CurOrientation = $default_orientation; 
  2146.         $this->wPt = $this->fwPt; 
  2147.         $this->hPt = $this->fhPt; 
  2148.     } 
  2149.     if ((abs($this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['urx'] - $this->hPt) < $this->feps) AND (abs($this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['ury'] - $this->wPt) < $this->feps)) { 
  2150.         // swap X and Y coordinates (change page orientation) 
  2151.         $this->pagedim = TCPDF_STATIC::swapPageBoxCoordinates($this->page, $this->pagedim); 
  2152.     } 
  2153.     $this->w = ($this->wPt / $this->k); 
  2154.     $this->h = ($this->hPt / $this->k); 
  2155.     if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($autopagebreak)) { 
  2156.         if (isset($this->AutoPageBreak)) { 
  2157.             $autopagebreak = $this->AutoPageBreak; 
  2158.         } else { 
  2159.             $autopagebreak = true; 
  2160.         } 
  2161.     } 
  2162.     if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($bottommargin)) { 
  2163.         if (isset($this->bMargin)) { 
  2164.             $bottommargin = $this->bMargin; 
  2165.         } else { 
  2166.             // default value = 2 cm 
  2167.             $bottommargin = 2 * 28.35 / $this->k; 
  2168.         } 
  2169.     } 
  2170.     $this->SetAutoPageBreak($autopagebreak, $bottommargin); 
  2171.     // store page dimensions 
  2172.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['w'] = $this->wPt; 
  2173.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['h'] = $this->hPt; 
  2174.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['wk'] = $this->w; 
  2175.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['hk'] = $this->h; 
  2176.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm'] = $this->tMargin; 
  2177.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['bm'] = $bottommargin; 
  2178.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['lm'] = $this->lMargin; 
  2179.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['rm'] = $this->rMargin; 
  2180.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['pb'] = $autopagebreak; 
  2181.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['or'] = $this->CurOrientation; 
  2182.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] = $this->original_lMargin; 
  2183.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm'] = $this->original_rMargin; 
  2184. } 
  2185.  
  2186. /** 
  2187.  * Set regular expression to detect withespaces or word separators. 
  2188.  * The pattern delimiter must be the forward-slash character "/". 
  2189.  * Some example patterns are: 
  2190.  * <pre> 
  2191.  * Non-Unicode or missing PCRE unicode support: "/[^\S\xa0]/" 
  2192.  * Unicode and PCRE unicode support: "/(?!\xa0)[\s\p{Z}]/u" 
  2193.  * Unicode and PCRE unicode support in Chinese mode: "/(?!\xa0)[\s\p{Z}\p{Lo}]/u" 
  2194.  * if PCRE unicode support is turned ON ("\P" is the negate class of "\p"): 
  2195.  *      \s     : any whitespace character 
  2196.  *      \p{Z}  : any separator 
  2197.  *      \p{Lo} : Unicode letter or ideograph that does not have lowercase and uppercase variants. Is used to chunk chinese words. 
  2198.  *      \xa0   : Unicode Character 'NO-BREAK SPACE' (U+00A0) 
  2199.  * </pre> 
  2200.  * @param $re (string) regular expression (leave empty for default). 
  2201.  * @public 
  2202.  * @since 4.6.016 (2009-06-15) 
  2203.  */ 
  2204. public function setSpacesRE($re='/[^\S\xa0]/') { 
  2205.     $this->re_spaces = $re; 
  2206.     $re_parts = explode('/', $re); 
  2207.     // get pattern parts 
  2208.     $this->re_space = array(); 
  2209.     if (isset($re_parts[1]) AND !empty($re_parts[1])) { 
  2210.         $this->re_space['p'] = $re_parts[1]; 
  2211.     } else { 
  2212.         $this->re_space['p'] = '[\s]'; 
  2213.     } 
  2214.     // set pattern modifiers 
  2215.     if (isset($re_parts[2]) AND !empty($re_parts[2])) { 
  2216.         $this->re_space['m'] = $re_parts[2]; 
  2217.     } else { 
  2218.         $this->re_space['m'] = ''; 
  2219.     } 
  2220. } 
  2221.  
  2222. /** 
  2223.  * Enable or disable Right-To-Left language mode 
  2224.  * @param $enable (Boolean) if true enable Right-To-Left language mode. 
  2225.  * @param $resetx (Boolean) if true reset the X position on direction change. 
  2226.  * @public 
  2227.  * @since 2.0.000 (2008-01-03) 
  2228.  */ 
  2229. public function setRTL($enable, $resetx=true) { 
  2230.     $enable = $enable ? true : false; 
  2231.     $resetx = ($resetx AND ($enable != $this->rtl)); 
  2232.     $this->rtl = $enable; 
  2233.     $this->tmprtl = false; 
  2234.     if ($resetx) { 
  2235.         $this->Ln(0); 
  2236.     } 
  2237. } 
  2238.  
  2239. /** 
  2240.  * Return the RTL status 
  2241.  * @return boolean 
  2242.  * @public 
  2243.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  2244.  */ 
  2245. public function getRTL() { 
  2246.     return $this->rtl; 
  2247. } 
  2248.  
  2249. /** 
  2250.  * Force temporary RTL language direction 
  2251.  * @param $mode (mixed) can be false, 'L' for LTR or 'R' for RTL 
  2252.  * @public 
  2253.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-09) 
  2254.  */ 
  2255. public function setTempRTL($mode) { 
  2256.     $newmode = false; 
  2257.     switch (strtoupper($mode)) { 
  2258.         case 'LTR': 
  2259.         case 'L': { 
  2260.             if ($this->rtl) { 
  2261.                 $newmode = 'L'; 
  2262.             } 
  2263.             break; 
  2264.         } 
  2265.         case 'RTL': 
  2266.         case 'R': { 
  2267.             if (!$this->rtl) { 
  2268.                 $newmode = 'R'; 
  2269.             } 
  2270.             break; 
  2271.         } 
  2272.         case false: 
  2273.         default: { 
  2274.             $newmode = false; 
  2275.             break; 
  2276.         } 
  2277.     } 
  2278.     $this->tmprtl = $newmode; 
  2279. } 
  2280.  
  2281. /** 
  2282.  * Return the current temporary RTL status 
  2283.  * @return boolean 
  2284.  * @public 
  2285.  * @since 4.8.014 (2009-11-04) 
  2286.  */ 
  2287. public function isRTLTextDir() { 
  2288.     return ($this->rtl OR ($this->tmprtl == 'R')); 
  2289. } 
  2290.  
  2291. /** 
  2292.  * Set the last cell height. 
  2293.  * @param $h (float) cell height. 
  2294.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2295.  * @public 
  2296.  * @since 1.53.0.TC034 
  2297.  */ 
  2298. public function setLastH($h) { 
  2299.     $this->lasth = $h; 
  2300. } 
  2301.  
  2302. /** 
  2303.  * Return the cell height 
  2304.  * @param $fontsize (int) Font size in internal units 
  2305.  * @param $padding (boolean) If true add cell padding 
  2306.  * @public 
  2307.  */ 
  2308. public function getCellHeight($fontsize, $padding=TRUE) { 
  2309.     $height = ($fontsize * $this->cell_height_ratio); 
  2310.     if ($padding) { 
  2311.         $height += ($this->cell_padding['T'] + $this->cell_padding['B']); 
  2312.     } 
  2313.     return round($height, 6); 
  2314. } 
  2315.  
  2316. /** 
  2317.  * Reset the last cell height. 
  2318.  * @public 
  2319.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2320.  */ 
  2321. public function resetLastH() { 
  2322.     $this->lasth = $this->getCellHeight($this->FontSize); 
  2323. } 
  2324.  
  2325. /** 
  2326.  * Get the last cell height. 
  2327.  * @return last cell height 
  2328.  * @public 
  2329.  * @since 3.0.017 (2008-08-05) 
  2330.  */ 
  2331. public function getLastH() { 
  2332.     return $this->lasth; 
  2333. } 
  2334.  
  2335. /** 
  2336.  * Set the adjusting factor to convert pixels to user units. 
  2337.  * @param $scale (float) adjusting factor to convert pixels to user units. 
  2338.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2339.  * @public 
  2340.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2341.  */ 
  2342. public function setImageScale($scale) { 
  2343.     $this->imgscale = $scale; 
  2344. } 
  2345.  
  2346. /** 
  2347.  * Returns the adjusting factor to convert pixels to user units. 
  2348.  * @return float adjusting factor to convert pixels to user units. 
  2349.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2350.  * @public 
  2351.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2352.  */ 
  2353. public function getImageScale() { 
  2354.     return $this->imgscale; 
  2355. } 
  2356.  
  2357. /** 
  2358.  * Returns an array of page dimensions: 
  2359.  * <ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['w'] = page width in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['h'] = height in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['wk'] = page width in user units</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['hk'] = page height in user units</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm'] = top margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['bm'] = bottom margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['lm'] = left margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['rm'] = right margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['pb'] = auto page break</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['or'] = page orientation</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] = original left margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm'] = original right margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['Rotate'] = The number of degrees by which the page shall be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value shall be a multiple of 90.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['PZ'] = The page's preferred zoom (magnification) factor.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans'] : the style and duration of the visual transition to use when moving from another page to the given page during a presentation<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Dur'] = The page's display duration (also called its advance timing): the maximum length of time, in seconds, that the page shall be displayed during presentations before the viewer application shall automatically advance to the next page.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['S'] = transition style : Split, Blinds, Box, Wipe, Dissolve, Glitter, R, Fly, Push, Cover, Uncover, Fade</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['D'] = The duration of the transition effect, in seconds.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Dm'] = (Split and Blinds transition styles only) The dimension in which the specified transition effect shall occur: H = Horizontal, V = Vertical. Default value: H.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['M'] = (Split, Box and Fly transition styles only) The direction of motion for the specified transition effect: I = Inward from the edges of the page, O = Outward from the center of the pageDefault value: I.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Di'] = (Wipe, Glitter, Fly, Cover, Uncover and Push transition styles only) The direction in which the specified transition effect shall moves, expressed in degrees counterclockwise starting from a left-to-right direction. If the value is a number, it shall be one of: 0 = Left to right, 90 = Bottom to top (Wipe only), 180 = Right to left (Wipe only), 270 = Top to bottom, 315 = Top-left to bottom-right (Glitter only). If the value is a name, it shall be None, which is relevant only for the Fly transition when the value of SS is not 1.0. Default value: 0.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['SS'] = (Fly transition style only) The starting or ending scale at which the changes shall be drawn. If M specifies an inward transition, the scale of the changes drawn shall progress from SS to 1.0 over the course of the transition. If M specifies an outward transition, the scale of the changes drawn shall progress from 1.0 to SS over the course of the transition. Default: 1.0. </li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['B'] = (Fly transition style only) If true, the area that shall be flown in is rectangular and opaque. Default: false.</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox'] : the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page shall be displayed or printed<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox'] : the visible region of default user space<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox'] : the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox'] : the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox'] : the extent of the page's meaningful content<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li></ul> 
  2360.  * @param $pagenum (int) page number (empty = current page) 
  2361.  * @return array of page dimensions. 
  2362.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2363.  * @public 
  2364.  * @since 4.5.027 (2009-03-16) 
  2365.  */ 
  2366. public function getPageDimensions($pagenum='') { 
  2367.     if (empty($pagenum)) { 
  2368.         $pagenum = $this->page; 
  2369.     } 
  2370.     return $this->pagedim[$pagenum]; 
  2371. } 
  2372.  
  2373. /** 
  2374.  * Returns the page width in units. 
  2375.  * @param $pagenum (int) page number (empty = current page) 
  2376.  * @return int page width. 
  2377.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2378.  * @public 
  2379.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2380.  * @see getPageDimensions() 
  2381.  */ 
  2382. public function getPageWidth($pagenum='') { 
  2383.     if (empty($pagenum)) { 
  2384.         return $this->w; 
  2385.     } 
  2386.     return $this->pagedim[$pagenum]['w']; 
  2387. } 
  2388.  
  2389. /** 
  2390.  * Returns the page height in units. 
  2391.  * @param $pagenum (int) page number (empty = current page) 
  2392.  * @return int page height. 
  2393.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2394.  * @public 
  2395.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2396.  * @see getPageDimensions() 
  2397.  */ 
  2398. public function getPageHeight($pagenum='') { 
  2399.     if (empty($pagenum)) { 
  2400.         return $this->h; 
  2401.     } 
  2402.     return $this->pagedim[$pagenum]['h']; 
  2403. } 
  2404.  
  2405. /** 
  2406.  * Returns the page break margin. 
  2407.  * @param $pagenum (int) page number (empty = current page) 
  2408.  * @return int page break margin. 
  2409.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2410.  * @public 
  2411.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2412.  * @see getPageDimensions() 
  2413.  */ 
  2414. public function getBreakMargin($pagenum='') { 
  2415.     if (empty($pagenum)) { 
  2416.         return $this->bMargin; 
  2417.     } 
  2418.     return $this->pagedim[$pagenum]['bm']; 
  2419. } 
  2420.  
  2421. /** 
  2422.  * Returns the scale factor (number of points in user unit). 
  2423.  * @return int scale factor. 
  2424.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2425.  * @public 
  2426.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2427.  */ 
  2428. public function getScaleFactor() { 
  2429.     return $this->k; 
  2430. } 
  2431.  
  2432. /** 
  2433.  * Defines the left, top and right margins. 
  2434.  * @param $left (float) Left margin. 
  2435.  * @param $top (float) Top margin. 
  2436.  * @param $right (float) Right margin. Default value is the left one. 
  2437.  * @param $keepmargins (boolean) if true overwrites the default page margins 
  2438.  * @public 
  2439.  * @since 1.0 
  2440.  * @see SetLeftMargin(), SetTopMargin(), SetRightMargin(), SetAutoPageBreak() 
  2441.  */ 
  2442. public function SetMargins($left, $top, $right=-1, $keepmargins=false) { 
  2443.     //Set left, top and right margins 
  2444.     $this->lMargin = $left; 
  2445.     $this->tMargin = $top; 
  2446.     if ($right == -1) { 
  2447.         $right = $left; 
  2448.     } 
  2449.     $this->rMargin = $right; 
  2450.     if ($keepmargins) { 
  2451.         // overwrite original values 
  2452.         $this->original_lMargin = $this->lMargin; 
  2453.         $this->original_rMargin = $this->rMargin; 
  2454.     } 
  2455. } 
  2456.  
  2457. /** 
  2458.  * Defines the left margin. The method can be called before creating the first page. If the current abscissa gets out of page, it is brought back to the margin. 
  2459.  * @param $margin (float) The margin. 
  2460.  * @public 
  2461.  * @since 1.4 
  2462.  * @see SetTopMargin(), SetRightMargin(), SetAutoPageBreak(), SetMargins() 
  2463.  */ 
  2464. public function SetLeftMargin($margin) { 
  2465.     //Set left margin 
  2466.     $this->lMargin = $margin; 
  2467.     if (($this->page > 0) AND ($this->x < $margin)) { 
  2468.         $this->x = $margin; 
  2469.     } 
  2470. } 
  2471.  
  2472. /** 
  2473.  * Defines the top margin. The method can be called before creating the first page. 
  2474.  * @param $margin (float) The margin. 
  2475.  * @public 
  2476.  * @since 1.5 
  2477.  * @see SetLeftMargin(), SetRightMargin(), SetAutoPageBreak(), SetMargins() 
  2478.  */ 
  2479. public function SetTopMargin($margin) { 
  2480.     //Set top margin 
  2481.     $this->tMargin = $margin; 
  2482.     if (($this->page > 0) AND ($this->y < $margin)) { 
  2483.         $this->y = $margin; 
  2484.     } 
  2485. } 
  2486.  
  2487. /** 
  2488.  * Defines the right margin. The method can be called before creating the first page. 
  2489.  * @param $margin (float) The margin. 
  2490.  * @public 
  2491.  * @since 1.5 
  2492.  * @see SetLeftMargin(), SetTopMargin(), SetAutoPageBreak(), SetMargins() 
  2493.  */ 
  2494. public function SetRightMargin($margin) { 
  2495.     $this->rMargin = $margin; 
  2496.     if (($this->page > 0) AND ($this->x > ($this->w - $margin))) { 
  2497.         $this->x = $this->w - $margin; 
  2498.     } 
  2499. } 
  2500.  
  2501. /** 
  2502.  * Set the same internal Cell padding for top, right, bottom, left- 
  2503.  * @param $pad (float) internal padding. 
  2504.  * @public 
  2505.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-09) 
  2506.  * @see getCellPaddings(), setCellPaddings() 
  2507.  */ 
  2508. public function SetCellPadding($pad) { 
  2509.     if ($pad >= 0) { 
  2510.         $this->cell_padding['L'] = $pad; 
  2511.         $this->cell_padding['T'] = $pad; 
  2512.         $this->cell_padding['R'] = $pad; 
  2513.         $this->cell_padding['B'] = $pad; 
  2514.     } 
  2515. } 
  2516.  
  2517. /** 
  2518.  * Set the internal Cell paddings. 
  2519.  * @param $left (float) left padding 
  2520.  * @param $top (float) top padding 
  2521.  * @param $right (float) right padding 
  2522.  * @param $bottom (float) bottom padding 
  2523.  * @public 
  2524.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2525.  * @see getCellPaddings(), SetCellPadding() 
  2526.  */ 
  2527. public function setCellPaddings($left='', $top='', $right='', $bottom='') { 
  2528.     if (($left !== '') AND ($left >= 0)) { 
  2529.         $this->cell_padding['L'] = $left; 
  2530.     } 
  2531.     if (($top !== '') AND ($top >= 0)) { 
  2532.         $this->cell_padding['T'] = $top; 
  2533.     } 
  2534.     if (($right !== '') AND ($right >= 0)) { 
  2535.         $this->cell_padding['R'] = $right; 
  2536.     } 
  2537.     if (($bottom !== '') AND ($bottom >= 0)) { 
  2538.         $this->cell_padding['B'] = $bottom; 
  2539.     } 
  2540. } 
  2541.  
  2542. /** 
  2543.  * Get the internal Cell padding array. 
  2544.  * @return array of padding values 
  2545.  * @public 
  2546.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2547.  * @see setCellPaddings(), SetCellPadding() 
  2548.  */ 
  2549. public function getCellPaddings() { 
  2550.     return $this->cell_padding; 
  2551. } 
  2552.  
  2553. /** 
  2554.  * Set the internal Cell margins. 
  2555.  * @param $left (float) left margin 
  2556.  * @param $top (float) top margin 
  2557.  * @param $right (float) right margin 
  2558.  * @param $bottom (float) bottom margin 
  2559.  * @public 
  2560.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2561.  * @see getCellMargins() 
  2562.  */ 
  2563. public function setCellMargins($left='', $top='', $right='', $bottom='') { 
  2564.     if (($left !== '') AND ($left >= 0)) { 
  2565.         $this->cell_margin['L'] = $left; 
  2566.     } 
  2567.     if (($top !== '') AND ($top >= 0)) { 
  2568.         $this->cell_margin['T'] = $top; 
  2569.     } 
  2570.     if (($right !== '') AND ($right >= 0)) { 
  2571.         $this->cell_margin['R'] = $right; 
  2572.     } 
  2573.     if (($bottom !== '') AND ($bottom >= 0)) { 
  2574.         $this->cell_margin['B'] = $bottom; 
  2575.     } 
  2576. } 
  2577.  
  2578. /** 
  2579.  * Get the internal Cell margin array. 
  2580.  * @return array of margin values 
  2581.  * @public 
  2582.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2583.  * @see setCellMargins() 
  2584.  */ 
  2585. public function getCellMargins() { 
  2586.     return $this->cell_margin; 
  2587. } 
  2588.  
  2589. /** 
  2590.  * Adjust the internal Cell padding array to take account of the line width. 
  2591.  * @param $brd (mixed) Indicates if borders must be drawn around the cell. The value can be a number:<ul><li>0: no border (default)</li><li>1: frame</li></ul> or a string containing some or all of the following characters (in any order):<ul><li>L: left</li><li>T: top</li><li>R: right</li><li>B: bottom</li></ul> or an array of line styles for each border group - for example: array('LTRB' => array('width' => 2, 'cap' => 'butt', 'join' => 'miter', 'dash' => 0, 'color' => array(0, 0, 0))) 
  2592.  * @return array of adjustments 
  2593.  * @public 
  2594.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2595.  */ 
  2596. protected function adjustCellPadding($brd=0) { 
  2597.     if (empty($brd)) { 
  2598.         return; 
  2599.     } 
  2600.     if (is_string($brd)) { 
  2601.         // convert string to array 
  2602.         $slen = strlen($brd); 
  2603.         $newbrd = array(); 
  2604.         for ($i = 0; $i < $slen; ++$i) { 
  2605.             $newbrd[$brd[$i]] = true; 
  2606.         } 
  2607.         $brd = $newbrd; 
  2608.     } elseif (($brd === 1) OR ($brd === true) OR (is_numeric($brd) AND (intval($brd) > 0))) { 
  2609.         $brd = array('LRTB' => true); 
  2610.     } 
  2611.     if (!is_array($brd)) { 
  2612.         return; 
  2613.     } 
  2614.     // store current cell padding 
  2615.     $cp = $this->cell_padding; 
  2616.     // select border mode 
  2617.     if (isset($brd['mode'])) { 
  2618.         $mode = $brd['mode']; 
  2619.         unset($brd['mode']); 
  2620.     } else { 
  2621.         $mode = 'normal'; 
  2622.     } 
  2623.     // process borders 
  2624.     foreach ($brd as $border => $style) { 
  2625.         $line_width = $this->LineWidth; 
  2626.         if (is_array($style) AND isset($style['width'])) { 
  2627.             // get border width 
  2628.             $line_width = $style['width']; 
  2629.         } 
  2630.         $adj = 0; // line width inside the cell 
  2631.         switch ($mode) { 
  2632.             case 'ext': { 
  2633.                 $adj = 0; 
  2634.                 break; 
  2635.             } 
  2636.             case 'int': { 
  2637.                 $adj = $line_width; 
  2638.                 break; 
  2639.             } 
  2640.             case 'normal': 
  2641.             default: { 
  2642.                 $adj = ($line_width / 2); 
  2643.                 break; 
  2644.             } 
  2645.         } 
  2646.         // correct internal cell padding if required to avoid overlap between text and lines 
  2647.         if ((strpos($border, 'T') !== false) AND ($this->cell_padding['T'] < $adj)) { 
  2648.             $this->cell_padding['T'] = $adj; 
  2649.         } 
  2650.         if ((strpos($border, 'R') !== false) AND ($this->cell_padding['R'] < $adj)) { 
  2651.             $this->cell_padding['R'] = $adj; 
  2652.         } 
  2653.         if ((strpos($border, 'B') !== false) AND ($this->cell_padding['B'] < $adj)) { 
  2654.             $this->cell_padding['B'] = $adj; 
  2655.         } 
  2656.         if ((strpos($border, 'L') !== false) AND ($this->cell_padding['L'] < $adj)) { 
  2657.             $this->cell_padding['L'] = $adj; 
  2658.         } 
  2659.     } 
  2660.     return array('T' => ($this->cell_padding['T'] - $cp['T']), 'R' => ($this->cell_padding['R'] - $cp['R']), 'B' => ($this->cell_padding['B'] - $cp['B']), 'L' => ($this->cell_padding['L'] - $cp['L'])); 
  2661. } 
  2662.  
  2663. /** 
  2664.  * Enables or disables the automatic page breaking mode. When enabling, the second parameter is the distance from the bottom of the page that defines the triggering limit. By default, the mode is on and the margin is 2 cm. 
  2665.  * @param $auto (boolean) Boolean indicating if mode should be on or off. 
  2666.  * @param $margin (float) Distance from the bottom of the page. 
  2667.  * @public 
  2668.  * @since 1.0 
  2669.  * @see Cell(), MultiCell(), AcceptPageBreak() 
  2670.  */ 
  2671. public function SetAutoPageBreak($auto, $margin=0) { 
  2672.     $this->AutoPageBreak = $auto ? true : false; 
  2673.     $this->bMargin = $margin; 
  2674.     $this->PageBreakTrigger = $this->h - $margin; 
  2675. } 
  2676.  
  2677. /** 
  2678.  * Return the auto-page-break mode (true or false). 
  2679.  * @return boolean auto-page-break mode 
  2680.  * @public 
  2681.  * @since 5.9.088 
  2682.  */ 
  2683. public function getAutoPageBreak() { 
  2684.     return $this->AutoPageBreak; 
  2685. } 
  2686.  
  2687. /** 
  2688.  * Defines the way the document is to be displayed by the viewer. 
  2689.  * @param $zoom (mixed) The zoom to use. It can be one of the following string values or a number indicating the zooming factor to use. <ul><li>fullpage: displays the entire page on screen </li><li>fullwidth: uses maximum width of window</li><li>real: uses real size (equivalent to 100% zoom)</li><li>default: uses viewer default mode</li></ul> 
  2690.  * @param $layout (string) The page layout. Possible values are:<ul><li>SinglePage Display one page at a time</li><li>OneColumn Display the pages in one column</li><li>TwoColumnLeft Display the pages in two columns, with odd-numbered pages on the left</li><li>TwoColumnRight Display the pages in two columns, with odd-numbered pages on the right</li><li>TwoPageLeft (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the left</li><li>TwoPageRight (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the right</li></ul> 
  2691.  * @param $mode (string) A name object specifying how the document should be displayed when opened:<ul><li>UseNone Neither document outline nor thumbnail images visible</li><li>UseOutlines Document outline visible</li><li>UseThumbs Thumbnail images visible</li><li>FullScreen Full-screen mode, with no menu bar, window controls, or any other window visible</li><li>UseOC (PDF 1.5) Optional content group panel visible</li><li>UseAttachments (PDF 1.6) Attachments panel visible</li></ul> 
  2692.  * @public 
  2693.  * @since 1.2 
  2694.  */ 
  2695. public function SetDisplayMode($zoom, $layout='SinglePage', $mode='UseNone') { 
  2696.     if (($zoom == 'fullpage') OR ($zoom == 'fullwidth') OR ($zoom == 'real') OR ($zoom == 'default') OR (!is_string($zoom))) { 
  2697.         $this->ZoomMode = $zoom; 
  2698.     } else { 
  2699.         $this->Error('Incorrect zoom display mode: '.$zoom); 
  2700.     } 
  2701.     $this->LayoutMode = TCPDF_STATIC::getPageLayoutMode($layout); 
  2702.     $this->PageMode = TCPDF_STATIC::getPageMode($mode); 
  2703. } 
  2704.  
  2705. /** 
  2706.  * Activates or deactivates page compression. When activated, the internal representation of each page is compressed, which leads to a compression ratio of about 2 for the resulting document. Compression is on by default. 
  2707.  * Note: the Zlib extension is required for this feature. If not present, compression will be turned off. 
  2708.  * @param $compress (boolean) Boolean indicating if compression must be enabled. 
  2709.  * @public 
  2710.  * @since 1.4 
  2711.  */ 
  2712. public function SetCompression($compress=true) { 
  2713.     if (function_exists('gzcompress')) { 
  2714.         $this->compress = $compress ? true : false; 
  2715.     } else { 
  2716.         $this->compress = false; 
  2717.     } 
  2718. } 
  2719.  
  2720. /** 
  2721.  * Set flag to force sRGB_IEC61966-2.1 black scaled ICC color profile for the whole document. 
  2722.  * @param $mode (boolean) If true force sRGB output intent. 
  2723.  * @public 
  2724.  * @since 5.9.121 (2011-09-28) 
  2725.  */ 
  2726. public function setSRGBmode($mode=false) { 
  2727.     $this->force_srgb = $mode ? true : false; 
  2728. } 
  2729.  
  2730. /** 
  2731.  * Turn on/off Unicode mode for document information dictionary (meta tags). 
  2732.  * This has effect only when unicode mode is set to false. 
  2733.  * @param $unicode (boolean) if true set the meta information in Unicode 
  2734.  * @since 5.9.027 (2010-12-01) 
  2735.  * @public 
  2736.  */ 
  2737. public function SetDocInfoUnicode($unicode=true) { 
  2738.     $this->docinfounicode = $unicode ? true : false; 
  2739. } 
  2740.  
  2741. /** 
  2742.  * Defines the title of the document. 
  2743.  * @param $title (string) The title. 
  2744.  * @public 
  2745.  * @since 1.2 
  2746.  * @see SetAuthor(), SetCreator(), SetKeywords(), SetSubject() 
  2747.  */ 
  2748. public function SetTitle($title) { 
  2749.     $this->title = $title; 
  2750. } 
  2751.  
  2752. /** 
  2753.  * Defines the subject of the document. 
  2754.  * @param $subject (string) The subject. 
  2755.  * @public 
  2756.  * @since 1.2 
  2757.  * @see SetAuthor(), SetCreator(), SetKeywords(), SetTitle() 
  2758.  */ 
  2759. public function SetSubject($subject) { 
  2760.     $this->subject = $subject; 
  2761. } 
  2762.  
  2763. /** 
  2764.  * Defines the author of the document. 
  2765.  * @param $author (string) The name of the author. 
  2766.  * @public 
  2767.  * @since 1.2 
  2768.  * @see SetCreator(), SetKeywords(), SetSubject(), SetTitle() 
  2769.  */ 
  2770. public function SetAuthor($author) { 
  2771.     $this->author = $author; 
  2772. } 
  2773.  
  2774. /** 
  2775.  * Associates keywords with the document, generally in the form 'keyword1 keyword2 ...'. 
  2776.  * @param $keywords (string) The list of keywords. 
  2777.  * @public 
  2778.  * @since 1.2 
  2779.  * @see SetAuthor(), SetCreator(), SetSubject(), SetTitle() 
  2780.  */ 
  2781. public function SetKeywords($keywords) { 
  2782.     $this->keywords = $keywords; 
  2783. } 
  2784.  
  2785. /** 
  2786.  * Defines the creator of the document. This is typically the name of the application that generates the PDF. 
  2787.  * @param $creator (string) The name of the creator. 
  2788.  * @public 
  2789.  * @since 1.2 
  2790.  * @see SetAuthor(), SetKeywords(), SetSubject(), SetTitle() 
  2791.  */ 
  2792. public function SetCreator($creator) { 
  2793.     $this->creator = $creator; 
  2794. } 
  2795.  
  2796. /** 
  2797.  * Throw an exception or print an error message and die if the K_TCPDF_PARSER_THROW_EXCEPTION_ERROR constant is set to true. 
  2798.  * @param $msg (string) The error message 
  2799.  * @public 
  2800.  * @since 1.0 
  2801.  */ 
  2802. public function Error($msg) { 
  2803.     // unset all class variables 
  2804.     $this->_destroy(true); 
  2805.     if (defined('K_TCPDF_THROW_EXCEPTION_ERROR') AND !K_TCPDF_THROW_EXCEPTION_ERROR) { 
  2806.         die('<strong>TCPDF ERROR: </strong>'.$msg); 
  2807.     } else { 
  2808.         throw new Exception('TCPDF ERROR: '.$msg); 
  2809.     } 
  2810. } 
  2811.  
  2812. /** 
  2813.  * This method begins the generation of the PDF document. 
  2814.  * It is not necessary to call it explicitly because AddPage() does it automatically. 
  2815.  * Note: no page is created by this method 
  2816.  * @public 
  2817.  * @since 1.0 
  2818.  * @see AddPage(), Close() 
  2819.  */ 
  2820. public function Open() { 
  2821.     $this->state = 1; 
  2822. } 
  2823.  
  2824. /** 
  2825.  * Terminates the PDF document. 
  2826.  * It is not necessary to call this method explicitly because Output() does it automatically. 
  2827.  * If the document contains no page, AddPage() is called to prevent from getting an invalid document. 
  2828.  * @public 
  2829.  * @since 1.0 
  2830.  * @see Open(), Output() 
  2831.  */ 
  2832. public function Close() { 
  2833.     if ($this->state == 3) { 
  2834.         return; 
  2835.     } 
  2836.     if ($this->page == 0) { 
  2837.         $this->AddPage(); 
  2838.     } 
  2839.     $this->endLayer(); 
  2840.     if ($this->tcpdflink) { 
  2841.         // save current graphic settings 
  2842.         $gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  2843.         $this->setEqualColumns(); 
  2844.         $this->lastpage(true); 
  2845.         $this->SetAutoPageBreak(false); 
  2846.         $this->x = 0; 
  2847.         $this->y = $this->h - (1 / $this->k); 
  2848.         $this->lMargin = 0; 
  2849.         $this->_outSaveGraphicsState(); 
  2850.         $font = defined('PDF_FONT_NAME_MAIN')?PDF_FONT_NAME_MAIN:'helvetica'; 
  2851.         $this->SetFont($font, '', 1); 
  2852.         $this->setTextRenderingMode(0, false, false); 
  2853.         $msg = "\x50\x6f\x77\x65\x72\x65\x64\x20\x62\x79\x20\x54\x43\x50\x44\x46\x20\x28\x77\x77\x77\x2e\x74\x63\x70\x64\x66\x2e\x6f\x72\x67\x29"; 
  2854.         $lnk = "\x68\x74\x74\x70\x3a\x2f\x2f\x77\x77\x77\x2e\x74\x63\x70\x64\x66\x2e\x6f\x72\x67"; 
  2855.         $this->Cell(0, 0, $msg, 0, 0, 'L', 0, $lnk, 0, false, 'D', 'B'); 
  2856.         $this->_outRestoreGraphicsState(); 
  2857.         // restore graphic settings 
  2858.         $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  2859.     } 
  2860.     // close page 
  2861.     $this->endPage(); 
  2862.     // close document 
  2863.     $this->_enddoc(); 
  2864.     // unset all class variables (except critical ones) 
  2865.     $this->_destroy(false); 
  2866. } 
  2867.  
  2868. /** 
  2869.  * Move pointer at the specified document page and update page dimensions. 
  2870.  * @param $pnum (int) page number (1 ... numpages) 
  2871.  * @param $resetmargins (boolean) if true reset left, right, top margins and Y position. 
  2872.  * @public 
  2873.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  2874.  * @see getPage(), lastpage(), getNumPages() 
  2875.  */ 
  2876. public function setPage($pnum, $resetmargins=false) { 
  2877.     if (($pnum == $this->page) AND ($this->state == 2)) { 
  2878.         return; 
  2879.     } 
  2880.     if (($pnum > 0) AND ($pnum <= $this->numpages)) { 
  2881.         $this->state = 2; 
  2882.         // save current graphic settings 
  2883.         //$gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  2884.         $oldpage = $this->page; 
  2885.         $this->page = $pnum; 
  2886.         $this->wPt = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['w']; 
  2887.         $this->hPt = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['h']; 
  2888.         $this->w = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['wk']; 
  2889.         $this->h = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['hk']; 
  2890.         $this->tMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm']; 
  2891.         $this->bMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['bm']; 
  2892.         $this->original_lMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm']; 
  2893.         $this->original_rMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm']; 
  2894.         $this->AutoPageBreak = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['pb']; 
  2895.         $this->CurOrientation = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['or']; 
  2896.         $this->SetAutoPageBreak($this->AutoPageBreak, $this->bMargin); 
  2897.         // restore graphic settings 
  2898.         //$this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  2899.         if ($resetmargins) { 
  2900.             $this->lMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm']; 
  2901.             $this->rMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm']; 
  2902.             $this->SetY($this->tMargin); 
  2903.         } else { 
  2904.             // account for booklet mode 
  2905.             if ($this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] != $this->pagedim[$oldpage]['olm']) { 
  2906.                 $deltam = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] - $this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm']; 
  2907.                 $this->lMargin += $deltam; 
  2908.                 $this->rMargin -= $deltam; 
  2909.             } 
  2910.         } 
  2911.     } else { 
  2912.         $this->Error('Wrong page number on setPage() function: '.$pnum); 
  2913.     } 
  2914. } 
  2915.  
  2916. /** 
  2917.  * Reset pointer to the last document page. 
  2918.  * @param $resetmargins (boolean) if true reset left, right, top margins and Y position. 
  2919.  * @public 
  2920.  * @since 2.0.000 (2008-01-04) 
  2921.  * @see setPage(), getPage(), getNumPages() 
  2922.  */ 
  2923. public function lastPage($resetmargins=false) { 
  2924.     $this->setPage($this->getNumPages(), $resetmargins); 
  2925. } 
  2926.  
  2927. /** 
  2928.  * Get current document page number. 
  2929.  * @return int page number 
  2930.  * @public 
  2931.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  2932.  * @see setPage(), lastpage(), getNumPages() 
  2933.  */ 
  2934. public function getPage() { 
  2935.     return $this->page; 
  2936. } 
  2937.  
  2938. /** 
  2939.  * Get the total number of insered pages. 
  2940.  * @return int number of pages 
  2941.  * @public 
  2942.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  2943.  * @see setPage(), getPage(), lastpage() 
  2944.  */ 
  2945. public function getNumPages() { 
  2946.     return $this->numpages; 
  2947. } 
  2948.  
  2949. /** 
  2950.  * Adds a new TOC (Table Of Content) page to the document. 
  2951.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. 
  2952.  * @param $format (mixed) The format used for pages. It can be either: one of the string values specified at getPageSizeFromFormat() or an array of parameters specified at setPageFormat(). 
  2953.  * @param $keepmargins (boolean) if true overwrites the default page margins with the current margins 
  2954.  * @public 
  2955.  * @since 5.0.001 (2010-05-06) 
  2956.  * @see AddPage(), startPage(), endPage(), endTOCPage() 
  2957.  */ 
  2958. public function addTOCPage($orientation='', $format='', $keepmargins=false) { 
  2959.     $this->AddPage($orientation, $format, $keepmargins, true); 
  2960. } 
  2961.  
  2962. /** 
  2963.  * Terminate the current TOC (Table Of Content) page 
  2964.  * @public 
  2965.  * @since 5.0.001 (2010-05-06) 
  2966.  * @see AddPage(), startPage(), endPage(), addTOCPage() 
  2967.  */ 
  2968. public function endTOCPage() { 
  2969.     $this->endPage(true); 
  2970. } 
  2971.  
  2972. /** 
  2973.  * Adds a new page to the document. If a page is already present, the Footer() method is called first to output the footer (if enabled). Then the page is added, the current position set to the top-left corner according to the left and top margins (or top-right if in RTL mode), and Header() is called to display the header (if enabled). 
  2974.  * The origin of the coordinate system is at the top-left corner (or top-right for RTL) and increasing ordinates go downwards. 
  2975.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>P or PORTRAIT (default)</li><li>L or LANDSCAPE</li></ul> 
  2976.  * @param $format (mixed) The format used for pages. It can be either: one of the string values specified at getPageSizeFromFormat() or an array of parameters specified at setPageFormat(). 
  2977.  * @param $keepmargins (boolean) if true overwrites the default page margins with the current margins 
  2978.  * @param $tocpage (boolean) if true set the tocpage state to true (the added page will be used to display Table Of Content). 
  2979.  * @public 
  2980.  * @since 1.0 
  2981.  * @see startPage(), endPage(), addTOCPage(), endTOCPage(), getPageSizeFromFormat(), setPageFormat() 
  2982.  */
