  2983. public function AddPage($orientation='', $format='', $keepmargins=false, $tocpage=false) { 
  2984.     if ($this->inxobj) { 
  2985.         // we are inside an XObject template 
  2986.         return; 
  2987.     } 
  2988.     if (!isset($this->original_lMargin) OR $keepmargins) { 
  2989.         $this->original_lMargin = $this->lMargin; 
  2990.     } 
  2991.     if (!isset($this->original_rMargin) OR $keepmargins) { 
  2992.         $this->original_rMargin = $this->rMargin; 
  2993.     } 
  2994.     // terminate previous page 
  2995.     $this->endPage(); 
  2996.     // start new page 
  2997.     $this->startPage($orientation, $format, $tocpage); 
  2998. } 
  2999.  
  3000. /** 
  3001.  * Terminate the current page 
  3002.  * @param $tocpage (boolean) if true set the tocpage state to false (end the page used to display Table Of Content). 
  3003.  * @public 
  3004.  * @since 4.2.010 (2008-11-14) 
  3005.  * @see AddPage(), startPage(), addTOCPage(), endTOCPage() 
  3006.  */ 
  3007. public function endPage($tocpage=false) { 
  3008.     // check if page is already closed 
  3009.     if (($this->page == 0) OR ($this->numpages > $this->page) OR (!$this->pageopen[$this->page])) { 
  3010.         return; 
  3011.     } 
  3012.     // print page footer 
  3013.     $this->setFooter(); 
  3014.     // close page 
  3015.     $this->_endpage(); 
  3016.     // mark page as closed 
  3017.     $this->pageopen[$this->page] = false; 
  3018.     if ($tocpage) { 
  3019.         $this->tocpage = false; 
  3020.     } 
  3021. } 
  3022.  
  3023. /** 
  3024.  * Starts a new page to the document. The page must be closed using the endPage() function. 
  3025.  * The origin of the coordinate system is at the top-left corner and increasing ordinates go downwards. 
  3026.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>P or PORTRAIT (default)</li><li>L or LANDSCAPE</li></ul> 
  3027.  * @param $format (mixed) The format used for pages. It can be either: one of the string values specified at getPageSizeFromFormat() or an array of parameters specified at setPageFormat(). 
  3028.  * @param $tocpage (boolean) if true the page is designated to contain the Table-Of-Content. 
  3029.  * @since 4.2.010 (2008-11-14) 
  3030.  * @see AddPage(), endPage(), addTOCPage(), endTOCPage(), getPageSizeFromFormat(), setPageFormat() 
  3031.  * @public 
  3032.  */ 
  3033. public function startPage($orientation='', $format='', $tocpage=false) { 
  3034.     if ($tocpage) { 
  3035.         $this->tocpage = true; 
  3036.     } 
  3037.     // move page numbers of documents to be attached 
  3038.     if ($this->tocpage) { 
  3039.         // move reference to unexistent pages (used for page attachments) 
  3040.         // adjust outlines 
  3041.         $tmpoutlines = $this->outlines; 
  3042.         foreach ($tmpoutlines as $key => $outline) { 
  3043.             if (!$outline['f'] AND ($outline['p'] > $this->numpages)) { 
  3044.                 $this->outlines[$key]['p'] = ($outline['p'] + 1); 
  3045.             } 
  3046.         } 
  3047.         // adjust dests 
  3048.         $tmpdests = $this->dests; 
  3049.         foreach ($tmpdests as $key => $dest) { 
  3050.             if (!$dest['f'] AND ($dest['p'] > $this->numpages)) { 
  3051.                 $this->dests[$key]['p'] = ($dest['p'] + 1); 
  3052.             } 
  3053.         } 
  3054.         // adjust links 
  3055.         $tmplinks = $this->links; 
  3056.         foreach ($tmplinks as $key => $link) { 
  3057.             if (!$link['f'] AND ($link['p'] > $this->numpages)) { 
  3058.                 $this->links[$key]['p'] = ($link['p'] + 1); 
  3059.             } 
  3060.         } 
  3061.     } 
  3062.     if ($this->numpages > $this->page) { 
  3063.         // this page has been already added 
  3064.         $this->setPage($this->page + 1); 
  3065.         $this->SetY($this->tMargin); 
  3066.         return; 
  3067.     } 
  3068.     // start a new page 
  3069.     if ($this->state == 0) { 
  3070.         $this->Open(); 
  3071.     } 
  3072.     ++$this->numpages; 
  3073.     $this->swapMargins($this->booklet); 
  3074.     // save current graphic settings 
  3075.     $gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  3076.     // start new page 
  3077.     $this->_beginpage($orientation, $format); 
  3078.     // mark page as open 
  3079.     $this->pageopen[$this->page] = true; 
  3080.     // restore graphic settings 
  3081.     $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  3082.     // mark this point 
  3083.     $this->setPageMark(); 
  3084.     // print page header 
  3085.     $this->setHeader(); 
  3086.     // restore graphic settings 
  3087.     $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  3088.     // mark this point 
  3089.     $this->setPageMark(); 
  3090.     // print table header (if any) 
  3091.     $this->setTableHeader(); 
  3092.     // set mark for empty page check 
  3093.     $this->emptypagemrk[$this->page]= $this->pagelen[$this->page]; 
  3094. } 
  3095.  
  3096. /** 
  3097.  * Set start-writing mark on current page stream used to put borders and fills. 
  3098.  * Borders and fills are always created after content and inserted on the position marked by this method. 
  3099.  * This function must be called after calling Image() function for a background image. 
  3100.  * Background images must be always inserted before calling Multicell() or WriteHTMLCell() or WriteHTML() functions. 
  3101.  * @public 
  3102.  * @since 3.0.016 (2008-07-30) 
  3103.  */ 
  3104. public function setPageMark() { 
  3105.     $this->intmrk[$this->page] = $this->pagelen[$this->page]; 
  3106.     $this->bordermrk[$this->page] = $this->intmrk[$this->page]; 
  3107.     $this->setContentMark(); 
  3108. } 
  3109.  
  3110. /** 
  3111.  * Set start-writing mark on selected page. 
  3112.  * Borders and fills are always created after content and inserted on the position marked by this method. 
  3113.  * @param $page (int) page number (default is the current page) 
  3114.  * @protected 
  3115.  * @since 4.6.021 (2009-07-20) 
  3116.  */ 
  3117. protected function setContentMark($page=0) { 
  3118.     if ($page <= 0) { 
  3119.         $page = $this->page; 
  3120.     } 
  3121.     if (isset($this->footerlen[$page])) { 
  3122.         $this->cntmrk[$page] = $this->pagelen[$page] - $this->footerlen[$page]; 
  3123.     } else { 
  3124.         $this->cntmrk[$page] = $this->pagelen[$page]; 
  3125.     } 
  3126. } 
  3127.  
  3128. /** 
  3129.  * Set header data. 
  3130.  * @param $ln (string) header image logo 
  3131.  * @param $lw (string) header image logo width in mm 
  3132.  * @param $ht (string) string to print as title on document header 
  3133.  * @param $hs (string) string to print on document header 
  3134.  * @param $tc (array) RGB array color for text. 
  3135.  * @param $lc (array) RGB array color for line. 
  3136.  * @public 
  3137.  */ 
  3138. public function setHeaderData($ln='', $lw=0, $ht='', $hs='', $tc=array(0, 0, 0), $lc=array(0, 0, 0)) { 
  3139.     $this->header_logo = $ln; 
  3140.     $this->header_logo_width = $lw; 
  3141.     $this->header_title = $ht; 
  3142.     $this->header_string = $hs; 
  3143.     $this->header_text_color = $tc; 
  3144.     $this->header_line_color = $lc; 
  3145. } 
  3146.  
  3147. /** 
  3148.  * Set footer data. 
  3149.  * @param $tc (array) RGB array color for text. 
  3150.  * @param $lc (array) RGB array color for line. 
  3151.  * @public 
  3152.  */ 
  3153. public function setFooterData($tc=array(0, 0, 0), $lc=array(0, 0, 0)) { 
  3154.     $this->footer_text_color = $tc; 
  3155.     $this->footer_line_color = $lc; 
  3156. } 
  3157.  
  3158. /** 
  3159.  * Returns header data: 
  3160.  * <ul><li>$ret['logo'] = logo image</li><li>$ret['logo_width'] = width of the image logo in user units</li><li>$ret['title'] = header title</li><li>$ret['string'] = header description string</li></ul> 
  3161.  * @return array() 
  3162.  * @public 
  3163.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3164.  */ 
  3165. public function getHeaderData() { 
  3166.     $ret = array(); 
  3167.     $ret['logo'] = $this->header_logo; 
  3168.     $ret['logo_width'] = $this->header_logo_width; 
  3169.     $ret['title'] = $this->header_title; 
  3170.     $ret['string'] = $this->header_string; 
  3171.     $ret['text_color'] = $this->header_text_color; 
  3172.     $ret['line_color'] = $this->header_line_color; 
  3173.     return $ret; 
  3174. } 
  3175.  
  3176. /** 
  3177.  * Set header margin. 
  3178.  * (minimum distance between header and top page margin) 
  3179.  * @param $hm (int) distance in user units 
  3180.  * @public 
  3181.  */ 
  3182. public function setHeaderMargin($hm=10) { 
  3183.     $this->header_margin = $hm; 
  3184. } 
  3185.  
  3186. /** 
  3187.  * Returns header margin in user units. 
  3188.  * @return float 
  3189.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3190.  * @public 
  3191.  */ 
  3192. public function getHeaderMargin() { 
  3193.     return $this->header_margin; 
  3194. } 
  3195.  
  3196. /** 
  3197.  * Set footer margin. 
  3198.  * (minimum distance between footer and bottom page margin) 
  3199.  * @param $fm (int) distance in user units 
  3200.  * @public 
  3201.  */ 
  3202. public function setFooterMargin($fm=10) { 
  3203.     $this->footer_margin = $fm; 
  3204. } 
  3205.  
  3206. /** 
  3207.  * Returns footer margin in user units. 
  3208.  * @return float 
  3209.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3210.  * @public 
  3211.  */ 
  3212. public function getFooterMargin() { 
  3213.     return $this->footer_margin; 
  3214. } 
  3215. /** 
  3216.  * Set a flag to print page header. 
  3217.  * @param $val (boolean) set to true to print the page header (default), false otherwise. 
  3218.  * @public 
  3219.  */ 
  3220. public function setPrintHeader($val=true) { 
  3221.     $this->print_header = $val ? true : false; 
  3222. } 
  3223.  
  3224. /** 
  3225.  * Set a flag to print page footer. 
  3226.  * @param $val (boolean) set to true to print the page footer (default), false otherwise. 
  3227.  * @public 
  3228.  */ 
  3229. public function setPrintFooter($val=true) { 
  3230.     $this->print_footer = $val ? true : false; 
  3231. } 
  3232.  
  3233. /** 
  3234.  * Return the right-bottom (or left-bottom for RTL) corner X coordinate of last inserted image 
  3235.  * @return float 
  3236.  * @public 
  3237.  */ 
  3238. public function getImageRBX() { 
  3239.     return $this->img_rb_x; 
  3240. } 
  3241.  
  3242. /** 
  3243.  * Return the right-bottom (or left-bottom for RTL) corner Y coordinate of last inserted image 
  3244.  * @return float 
  3245.  * @public 
  3246.  */ 
  3247. public function getImageRBY() { 
  3248.     return $this->img_rb_y; 
  3249. } 
  3250.  
  3251. /** 
  3252.  * Reset the xobject template used by Header() method. 
  3253.  * @public 
  3254.  */ 
  3255. public function resetHeaderTemplate() { 
  3256.     $this->header_xobjid = false; 
  3257. } 
  3258.  
  3259. /** 
  3260.  * Set a flag to automatically reset the xobject template used by Header() method at each page. 
  3261.  * @param $val (boolean) set to true to reset Header xobject template at each page, false otherwise. 
  3262.  * @public 
  3263.  */ 
  3264. public function setHeaderTemplateAutoreset($val=true) { 
  3265.     $this->header_xobj_autoreset = $val ? true : false; 
  3266. } 
  3267.  
  3268. /** 
  3269.  * This method is used to render the page header. 
  3270.  * It is automatically called by AddPage() and could be overwritten in your own inherited class. 
  3271.  * @public 
  3272.  */ 
  3273. public function Header() { 
  3274.     if ($this->header_xobjid === false) { 
  3275.         // start a new XObject Template 
  3276.         $this->header_xobjid = $this->startTemplate($this->w, $this->tMargin); 
  3277.         $headerfont = $this->getHeaderFont(); 
  3278.         $headerdata = $this->getHeaderData(); 
  3279.         $this->y = $this->header_margin; 
  3280.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3281.             $this->x = $this->w - $this->original_rMargin; 
  3282.         } else { 
  3283.             $this->x = $this->original_lMargin; 
  3284.         } 
  3285.         if (($headerdata['logo']) AND ($headerdata['logo'] != K_BLANK_IMAGE)) { 
  3286.             $imgtype = TCPDF_IMAGES::getImageFileType(K_PATH_IMAGES.$headerdata['logo']); 
  3287.             if (($imgtype == 'eps') OR ($imgtype == 'ai')) { 
  3288.                 $this->ImageEps(K_PATH_IMAGES.$headerdata['logo'], '', '', $headerdata['logo_width']); 
  3289.             } elseif ($imgtype == 'svg') { 
  3290.                 $this->ImageSVG(K_PATH_IMAGES.$headerdata['logo'], '', '', $headerdata['logo_width']); 
  3291.             } else { 
  3292.                 $this->Image(K_PATH_IMAGES.$headerdata['logo'], '', '', $headerdata['logo_width']); 
  3293.             } 
  3294.             $imgy = $this->getImageRBY(); 
  3295.         } else { 
  3296.             $imgy = $this->y; 
  3297.         } 
  3298.         $cell_height = $this->getCellHeight($headerfont[2] / $this->k); 
  3299.         // set starting margin for text data cell 
  3300.         if ($this->getRTL()) { 
  3301.             $header_x = $this->original_rMargin + ($headerdata['logo_width'] * 1.1); 
  3302.         } else { 
  3303.             $header_x = $this->original_lMargin + ($headerdata['logo_width'] * 1.1); 
  3304.         } 
  3305.         $cw = $this->w - $this->original_lMargin - $this->original_rMargin - ($headerdata['logo_width'] * 1.1); 
  3306.         $this->SetTextColorArray($this->header_text_color); 
  3307.         // header title 
  3308.         $this->SetFont($headerfont[0], 'B', $headerfont[2] + 1); 
  3309.         $this->SetX($header_x); 
  3310.         $this->Cell($cw, $cell_height, $headerdata['title'], 0, 1, '', 0, '', 0); 
  3311.         // header string 
  3312.         $this->SetFont($headerfont[0], $headerfont[1], $headerfont[2]); 
  3313.         $this->SetX($header_x); 
  3314.         $this->MultiCell($cw, $cell_height, $headerdata['string'], 0, '', 0, 1, '', '', true, 0, false, true, 0, 'T', false); 
  3315.         // print an ending header line 
  3316.         $this->SetLineStyle(array('width' => 0.85 / $this->k, 'cap' => 'butt', 'join' => 'miter', 'dash' => 0, 'color' => $headerdata['line_color'])); 
  3317.         $this->SetY((2.835 / $this->k) + max($imgy, $this->y)); 
  3318.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3319.             $this->SetX($this->original_rMargin); 
  3320.         } else { 
  3321.             $this->SetX($this->original_lMargin); 
  3322.         } 
  3323.         $this->Cell(($this->w - $this->original_lMargin - $this->original_rMargin), 0, '', 'T', 0, 'C'); 
  3324.         $this->endTemplate(); 
  3325.     } 
  3326.     // print header template 
  3327.     $x = 0; 
  3328.     $dx = 0; 
  3329.     if (!$this->header_xobj_autoreset AND $this->booklet AND (($this->page % 2) == 0)) { 
  3330.         // adjust margins for booklet mode 
  3331.         $dx = ($this->original_lMargin - $this->original_rMargin); 
  3332.     } 
  3333.     if ($this->rtl) { 
  3334.         $x = $this->w + $dx; 
  3335.     } else { 
  3336.         $x = 0 + $dx; 
  3337.     } 
  3338.     $this->printTemplate($this->header_xobjid, $x, 0, 0, 0, '', '', false); 
  3339.     if ($this->header_xobj_autoreset) { 
  3340.         // reset header xobject template at each page 
  3341.         $this->header_xobjid = false; 
  3342.     } 
  3343. } 
  3344.  
  3345. /** 
  3346.  * This method is used to render the page footer. 
  3347.  * It is automatically called by AddPage() and could be overwritten in your own inherited class. 
  3348.  * @public 
  3349.  */ 
  3350. public function Footer() { 
  3351.     $cur_y = $this->y; 
  3352.     $this->SetTextColorArray($this->footer_text_color); 
  3353.     //set style for cell border 
  3354.     $line_width = (0.85 / $this->k); 
  3355.     $this->SetLineStyle(array('width' => $line_width, 'cap' => 'butt', 'join' => 'miter', 'dash' => 0, 'color' => $this->footer_line_color)); 
  3356.     //print document barcode 
  3357.     $barcode = $this->getBarcode(); 
  3358.     if (!empty($barcode)) { 
  3359.         $this->Ln($line_width); 
  3360.         $barcode_width = round(($this->w - $this->original_lMargin - $this->original_rMargin) / 3); 
  3361.         $style = array( 
  3362.             'position' => $this->rtl?'R':'L',  
  3363.             'align' => $this->rtl?'R':'L',  
  3364.             'stretch' => false,  
  3365.             'fitwidth' => true,  
  3366.             'cellfitalign' => '',  
  3367.             'border' => false,  
  3368.             'padding' => 0,  
  3369.             'fgcolor' => array(0, 0, 0),  
  3370.             'bgcolor' => false,  
  3371.             'text' => false 
  3372.  ); 
  3373.         $this->write1DBarcode($barcode, 'C128', '', $cur_y + $line_width, '', (($this->footer_margin / 3) - $line_width), 0.3, $style, ''); 
  3374.     } 
  3375.     $w_page = isset($this->l['w_page']) ? $this->l['w_page'].' ' : ''; 
  3376.     if (empty($this->pagegroups)) { 
  3377.         $pagenumtxt = $w_page.$this->getAliasNumPage().' / '.$this->getAliasNbPages(); 
  3378.     } else { 
  3379.         $pagenumtxt = $w_page.$this->getPageNumGroupAlias().' / '.$this->getPageGroupAlias(); 
  3380.     } 
  3381.     $this->SetY($cur_y); 
  3382.     //Print page number 
  3383.     if ($this->getRTL()) { 
  3384.         $this->SetX($this->original_rMargin); 
  3385.         $this->Cell(0, 0, $pagenumtxt, 'T', 0, 'L'); 
  3386.     } else { 
  3387.         $this->SetX($this->original_lMargin); 
  3388.         $this->Cell(0, 0, $this->getAliasRightShift().$pagenumtxt, 'T', 0, 'R'); 
  3389.     } 
  3390. } 
  3391.  
  3392. /** 
  3393.  * This method is used to render the page header. 
  3394.  * @protected 
  3395.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3396.  */ 
  3397. protected function setHeader() { 
  3398.     if (!$this->print_header OR ($this->state != 2)) { 
  3399.         return; 
  3400.     } 
  3401.     $this->InHeader = true; 
  3402.     $this->setGraphicVars($this->default_graphic_vars); 
  3403.     $temp_thead = $this->thead; 
  3404.     $temp_theadMargins = $this->theadMargins; 
  3405.     $lasth = $this->lasth; 
  3406.     $newline = $this->newline; 
  3407.     $this->_outSaveGraphicsState(); 
  3408.     $this->rMargin = $this->original_rMargin; 
  3409.     $this->lMargin = $this->original_lMargin; 
  3410.     $this->SetCellPadding(0); 
  3411.     //set current position 
  3412.     if ($this->rtl) { 
  3413.         $this->SetXY($this->original_rMargin, $this->header_margin); 
  3414.     } else { 
  3415.         $this->SetXY($this->original_lMargin, $this->header_margin); 
  3416.     } 
  3417.     $this->SetFont($this->header_font[0], $this->header_font[1], $this->header_font[2]); 
  3418.     $this->Header(); 
  3419.     //restore position 
  3420.     if ($this->rtl) { 
  3421.         $this->SetXY($this->original_rMargin, $this->tMargin); 
  3422.     } else { 
  3423.         $this->SetXY($this->original_lMargin, $this->tMargin); 
  3424.     } 
  3425.     $this->_outRestoreGraphicsState(); 
  3426.     $this->lasth = $lasth; 
  3427.     $this->thead = $temp_thead; 
  3428.     $this->theadMargins = $temp_theadMargins; 
  3429.     $this->newline = $newline; 
  3430.     $this->InHeader = false; 
  3431. } 
  3432.  
  3433. /** 
  3434.  * This method is used to render the page footer. 
  3435.  * @protected 
  3436.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3437.  */ 
  3438. protected function setFooter() { 
  3439.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  3440.         return; 
  3441.     } 
  3442.     $this->InFooter = true; 
  3443.     // save current graphic settings 
  3444.     $gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  3445.     // mark this point 
  3446.     $this->footerpos[$this->page] = $this->pagelen[$this->page]; 
  3447.     $this->_out("\n"); 
  3448.     if ($this->print_footer) { 
  3449.         $this->setGraphicVars($this->default_graphic_vars); 
  3450.         $this->current_column = 0; 
  3451.         $this->num_columns = 1; 
  3452.         $temp_thead = $this->thead; 
  3453.         $temp_theadMargins = $this->theadMargins; 
  3454.         $lasth = $this->lasth; 
  3455.         $this->_outSaveGraphicsState(); 
  3456.         $this->rMargin = $this->original_rMargin; 
  3457.         $this->lMargin = $this->original_lMargin; 
  3458.         $this->SetCellPadding(0); 
  3459.         //set current position 
  3460.         $footer_y = $this->h - $this->footer_margin; 
  3461.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3462.             $this->SetXY($this->original_rMargin, $footer_y); 
  3463.         } else { 
  3464.             $this->SetXY($this->original_lMargin, $footer_y); 
  3465.         } 
  3466.         $this->SetFont($this->footer_font[0], $this->footer_font[1], $this->footer_font[2]); 
  3467.         $this->Footer(); 
  3468.         //restore position 
  3469.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3470.             $this->SetXY($this->original_rMargin, $this->tMargin); 
  3471.         } else { 
  3472.             $this->SetXY($this->original_lMargin, $this->tMargin); 
  3473.         } 
  3474.         $this->_outRestoreGraphicsState(); 
  3475.         $this->lasth = $lasth; 
  3476.         $this->thead = $temp_thead; 
  3477.         $this->theadMargins = $temp_theadMargins; 
  3478.     } 
  3479.     // restore graphic settings 
  3480.     $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  3481.     $this->current_column = $gvars['current_column']; 
  3482.     $this->num_columns = $gvars['num_columns']; 
  3483.     // calculate footer length 
  3484.     $this->footerlen[$this->page] = $this->pagelen[$this->page] - $this->footerpos[$this->page] + 1; 
  3485.     $this->InFooter = false; 
  3486. } 
  3487.  
  3488. /** 
  3489.  * Check if we are on the page body (excluding page header and footer). 
  3490.  * @return true if we are not in page header nor in page footer, false otherwise. 
  3491.  * @protected 
  3492.  * @since 5.9.091 (2011-06-15) 
  3493.  */ 
  3494. protected function inPageBody() { 
  3495.     return (($this->InHeader === false) AND ($this->InFooter === false)); 
  3496. } 
  3497.  
  3498. /** 
  3499.  * This method is used to render the table header on new page (if any). 
  3500.  * @protected 
  3501.  * @since 4.5.030 (2009-03-25) 
  3502.  */ 
  3503. protected function setTableHeader() { 
  3504.     if ($this->num_columns > 1) { 
  3505.         // multi column mode 
  3506.         return; 
  3507.     } 
  3508.     if (isset($this->theadMargins['top'])) { 
  3509.         // restore the original top-margin 
  3510.         $this->tMargin = $this->theadMargins['top']; 
  3511.         $this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm'] = $this->tMargin; 
  3512.         $this->y = $this->tMargin; 
  3513.     } 
  3514.     if (!TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($this->thead) AND (!$this->inthead)) { 
  3515.         // set margins 
  3516.         $prev_lMargin = $this->lMargin; 
  3517.         $prev_rMargin = $this->rMargin; 
  3518.         $prev_cell_padding = $this->cell_padding; 
  3519.         $this->lMargin = $this->theadMargins['lmargin'] + ($this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] - $this->pagedim[$this->theadMargins['page']]['olm']); 
  3520.         $this->rMargin = $this->theadMargins['rmargin'] + ($this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm'] - $this->pagedim[$this->theadMargins['page']]['orm']); 
  3521.         $this->cell_padding = $this->theadMargins['cell_padding']; 
  3522.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3523.             $this->x = $this->w - $this->rMargin; 
  3524.         } else { 
  3525.             $this->x = $this->lMargin; 
  3526.         } 
  3527.         // account for special "cell" mode 
  3528.         if ($this->theadMargins['cell']) { 
  3529.             if ($this->rtl) { 
  3530.                 $this->x -= $this->cell_padding['R']; 
  3531.             } else { 
  3532.                 $this->x += $this->cell_padding['L']; 
  3533.             } 
  3534.         } 
  3535.         $gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  3536.         if (!empty($this->theadMargins['gvars'])) { 
  3537.             // set the correct graphic style 
  3538.             $this->setGraphicVars($this->theadMargins['gvars']); 
  3539.             $this->rMargin = $gvars['rMargin']; 
  3540.             $this->lMargin = $gvars['lMargin']; 
  3541.         } 
  3542.         // print table header 
  3543.         $this->writeHTML($this->thead, false, false, false, false, ''); 
  3544.         $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  3545.         // set new top margin to skip the table headers 
  3546.         if (!isset($this->theadMargins['top'])) { 
  3547.             $this->theadMargins['top'] = $this->tMargin; 
  3548.         } 
  3549.         // store end of header position 
  3550.         if (!isset($this->columns[0]['th'])) { 
  3551.             $this->columns[0]['th'] = array(); 
  3552.         } 
  3553.         $this->columns[0]['th']['\''.$this->page.'\''] = $this->y; 
  3554.         $this->tMargin = $this->y; 
  3555.         $this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm'] = $this->tMargin; 
  3556.         $this->lasth = 0; 
  3557.         $this->lMargin = $prev_lMargin; 
  3558.         $this->rMargin = $prev_rMargin; 
  3559.         $this->cell_padding = $prev_cell_padding; 
  3560.     } 
  3561. } 
  3562.  
  3563. /** 
  3564.  * Returns the current page number. 
  3565.  * @return int page number 
  3566.  * @public 
  3567.  * @since 1.0 
  3568.  * @see getAliasNbPages() 
  3569.  */ 
  3570. public function PageNo() { 
  3571.     return $this->page; 
  3572. } 
  3573.  
  3574. /** 
  3575.  * Returns the array of spot colors. 
  3576.  * @return (array) Spot colors array. 
  3577.  * @public 
  3578.  * @since 6.0.038 (2013-09-30) 
  3579.  */ 
  3580. public function getAllSpotColors() { 
  3581.     return $this->spot_colors; 
  3582. } 
  3583.  
  3584. /** 
  3585.  * Defines a new spot color. 
  3586.  * It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. 
  3587.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3588.  * @param $name (string) Full name of the spot color. 
  3589.  * @param $c (float) Cyan color for CMYK. Value between 0 and 100. 
  3590.  * @param $m (float) Magenta color for CMYK. Value between 0 and 100. 
  3591.  * @param $y (float) Yellow color for CMYK. Value between 0 and 100. 
  3592.  * @param $k (float) Key (Black) color for CMYK. Value between 0 and 100. 
  3593.  * @public 
  3594.  * @since 3.0.024 (2008-09-12) 
  3595.  * @see SetDrawSpotColor(), SetFillSpotColor(), SetTextSpotColor() 
  3596.  */ 
  3597. public function AddSpotColor($name, $c, $m, $y, $k) { 
  3598.     if (!isset($this->spot_colors[$name])) { 
  3599.         $i = (1 + count($this->spot_colors)); 
  3600.         $this->spot_colors[$name] = array('C' => $c, 'M' => $m, 'Y' => $y, 'K' => $k, 'name' => $name, 'i' => $i); 
  3601.     } 
  3602. } 
  3603.  
  3604. /** 
  3605.  * Set the spot color for the specified type ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3606.  * @param $type (string) Type of object affected by this color: ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3607.  * @param $name (string) Name of the spot color. 
  3608.  * @param $tint (float) Intensity of the color (from 0 to 100 ; 100 = full intensity by default). 
  3609.  * @return (string) PDF color command. 
  3610.  * @public 
  3611.  * @since 5.9.125 (2011-10-03) 
  3612.  */ 
  3613. public function setSpotColor($type, $name, $tint=100) { 
  3614.     $spotcolor = TCPDF_COLORS::getSpotColor($name, $this->spot_colors); 
  3615.     if ($spotcolor === false) { 
  3616.         $this->Error('Undefined spot color: '.$name.', you must add it using the AddSpotColor() method.'); 
  3617.     } 
  3618.     $tint = (max(0, min(100, $tint)) / 100); 
  3619.     $pdfcolor = sprintf('/CS%d ', $this->spot_colors[$name]['i']); 
  3620.     switch ($type) { 
  3621.         case 'draw': { 
  3622.             $pdfcolor .= sprintf('CS %F SCN', $tint); 
  3623.             $this->DrawColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3624.             $this->strokecolor = $spotcolor; 
  3625.             break; 
  3626.         } 
  3627.         case 'fill': { 
  3628.             $pdfcolor .= sprintf('cs %F scn', $tint); 
  3629.             $this->FillColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3630.             $this->bgcolor = $spotcolor; 
  3631.             break; 
  3632.         } 
  3633.         case 'text': { 
  3634.             $pdfcolor .= sprintf('cs %F scn', $tint); 
  3635.             $this->TextColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3636.             $this->fgcolor = $spotcolor; 
  3637.             break; 
  3638.         } 
  3639.     } 
  3640.     $this->ColorFlag = ($this->FillColor != $this->TextColor); 
  3641.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  3642.         $this->_out($pdfcolor); 
  3643.     } 
  3644.     if ($this->inxobj) { 
  3645.         // we are inside an XObject template 
  3646.         $this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['spot_colors'][$name] = $this->spot_colors[$name]; 
  3647.     } 
  3648.     return $pdfcolor; 
  3649. } 
  3650.  
  3651. /** 
  3652.  * Defines the spot color used for all drawing operations (lines, rectangles and cell borders). 
  3653.  * @param $name (string) Name of the spot color. 
  3654.  * @param $tint (float) Intensity of the color (from 0 to 100 ; 100 = full intensity by default). 
  3655.  * @public 
  3656.  * @since 3.0.024 (2008-09-12) 
  3657.  * @see AddSpotColor(), SetFillSpotColor(), SetTextSpotColor() 
  3658.  */ 
  3659. public function SetDrawSpotColor($name, $tint=100) { 
  3660.     $this->setSpotColor('draw', $name, $tint); 
  3661. } 
  3662.  
  3663. /** 
  3664.  * Defines the spot color used for all filling operations (filled rectangles and cell backgrounds). 
  3665.  * @param $name (string) Name of the spot color. 
  3666.  * @param $tint (float) Intensity of the color (from 0 to 100 ; 100 = full intensity by default). 
  3667.  * @public 
  3668.  * @since 3.0.024 (2008-09-12) 
  3669.  * @see AddSpotColor(), SetDrawSpotColor(), SetTextSpotColor() 
  3670.  */ 
  3671. public function SetFillSpotColor($name, $tint=100) { 
  3672.     $this->setSpotColor('fill', $name, $tint); 
  3673. } 
  3674.  
  3675. /** 
  3676.  * Defines the spot color used for text. 
  3677.  * @param $name (string) Name of the spot color. 
  3678.  * @param $tint (int) Intensity of the color (from 0 to 100 ; 100 = full intensity by default). 
  3679.  * @public 
  3680.  * @since 3.0.024 (2008-09-12) 
  3681.  * @see AddSpotColor(), SetDrawSpotColor(), SetFillSpotColor() 
  3682.  */ 
  3683. public function SetTextSpotColor($name, $tint=100) { 
  3684.     $this->setSpotColor('text', $name, $tint); 
  3685. } 
  3686.  
  3687. /** 
  3688.  * Set the color array for the specified type ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3689.  * It can be expressed in RGB, CMYK or GRAY SCALE components. 
  3690.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3691.  * @param $type (string) Type of object affected by this color: ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3692.  * @param $color (array) Array of colors (1=gray, 3=RGB, 4=CMYK or 5=spotcolor=CMYK+name values). 
  3693.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the PDF command. 
  3694.  * @return (string) The PDF command or empty string. 
  3695.  * @public 
  3696.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-06-11) 
  3697.  */ 
  3698. public function setColorArray($type, $color, $ret=false) { 
  3699.     if (is_array($color)) { 
  3700.         $color = array_values($color); 
  3701.         // component: grey, RGB red or CMYK cyan 
  3702.         $c = isset($color[0]) ? $color[0] : -1; 
  3703.         // component: RGB green or CMYK magenta 
  3704.         $m = isset($color[1]) ? $color[1] : -1; 
  3705.         // component: RGB blue or CMYK yellow 
  3706.         $y = isset($color[2]) ? $color[2] : -1; 
  3707.         // component: CMYK black 
  3708.         $k = isset($color[3]) ? $color[3] : -1; 
  3709.         // color name 
  3710.         $name = isset($color[4]) ? $color[4] : ''; 
  3711.         if ($c >= 0) { 
  3712.             return $this->setColor($type, $c, $m, $y, $k, $ret, $name); 
  3713.         } 
  3714.     } 
  3715.     return ''; 
  3716. } 
  3717.  
  3718. /** 
  3719.  * Defines the color used for all drawing operations (lines, rectangles and cell borders). 
  3720.  * It can be expressed in RGB, CMYK or GRAY SCALE components. 
  3721.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3722.  * @param $color (array) Array of colors (1, 3 or 4 values). 
  3723.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the PDF command. 
  3724.  * @return string the PDF command 
  3725.  * @public 
  3726.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-06-11) 
  3727.  * @see SetDrawColor() 
  3728.  */ 
  3729. public function SetDrawColorArray($color, $ret=false) { 
  3730.     return $this->setColorArray('draw', $color, $ret); 
  3731. } 
  3732.  
  3733. /** 
  3734.  * Defines the color used for all filling operations (filled rectangles and cell backgrounds). 
  3735.  * It can be expressed in RGB, CMYK or GRAY SCALE components. 
  3736.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3737.  * @param $color (array) Array of colors (1, 3 or 4 values). 
  3738.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the PDF command. 
  3739.  * @public 
  3740.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-6-11) 
  3741.  * @see SetFillColor() 
  3742.  */ 
  3743. public function SetFillColorArray($color, $ret=false) { 
  3744.     return $this->setColorArray('fill', $color, $ret); 
  3745. } 
  3746.  
  3747. /** 
  3748.  * Defines the color used for text. It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. 
  3749.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3750.  * @param $color (array) Array of colors (1, 3 or 4 values). 
  3751.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the PDF command. 
  3752.  * @public 
  3753.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-6-11) 
  3754.  * @see SetFillColor() 
  3755.  */ 
  3756. public function SetTextColorArray($color, $ret=false) { 
  3757.     return $this->setColorArray('text', $color, $ret); 
  3758. } 
  3759.  
  3760. /** 
  3761.  * Defines the color used by the specified type ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3762.  * @param $type (string) Type of object affected by this color: ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3763.  * @param $col1 (float) GRAY level for single color, or Red color for RGB (0-255), or CYAN color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3764.  * @param $col2 (float) GREEN color for RGB (0-255), or MAGENTA color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3765.  * @param $col3 (float) BLUE color for RGB (0-255), or YELLOW color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3766.  * @param $col4 (float) KEY (BLACK) color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3767.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the command. 
  3768.  * @param $name (string) spot color name (if any) 
  3769.  * @return (string) The PDF command or empty string. 
  3770.  * @public 
  3771.  * @since 5.9.125 (2011-10-03) 
  3772.  */ 
  3773. public function setColor($type, $col1=0, $col2=-1, $col3=-1, $col4=-1, $ret=false, $name='') { 
  3774.     // set default values 
  3775.     if (!is_numeric($col1)) { 
  3776.         $col1 = 0; 
  3777.     } 
  3778.     if (!is_numeric($col2)) { 
  3779.         $col2 = -1; 
  3780.     } 
  3781.     if (!is_numeric($col3)) { 
  3782.         $col3 = -1; 
  3783.     } 
  3784.     if (!is_numeric($col4)) { 
  3785.         $col4 = -1; 
  3786.     } 
  3787.     // set color by case 
  3788.     $suffix = ''; 
  3789.     if (($col2 == -1) AND ($col3 == -1) AND ($col4 == -1)) { 
  3790.         // Grey scale 
  3791.         $col1 = max(0, min(255, $col1)); 
  3792.         $intcolor = array('G' => $col1); 
  3793.         $pdfcolor = sprintf('%F ', ($col1 / 255)); 
  3794.         $suffix = 'g'; 
  3795.     } elseif ($col4 == -1) { 
  3796.         // RGB 
  3797.         $col1 = max(0, min(255, $col1)); 
  3798.         $col2 = max(0, min(255, $col2)); 
  3799.         $col3 = max(0, min(255, $col3)); 
  3800.         $intcolor = array('R' => $col1, 'G' => $col2, 'B' => $col3); 
  3801.         $pdfcolor = sprintf('%F %F %F ', ($col1 / 255), ($col2 / 255), ($col3 / 255)); 
  3802.         $suffix = 'rg'; 
  3803.     } else { 
  3804.         $col1 = max(0, min(100, $col1)); 
  3805.         $col2 = max(0, min(100, $col2)); 
  3806.         $col3 = max(0, min(100, $col3)); 
  3807.         $col4 = max(0, min(100, $col4)); 
  3808.         if (empty($name)) { 
  3809.             // CMYK 
  3810.             $intcolor = array('C' => $col1, 'M' => $col2, 'Y' => $col3, 'K' => $col4); 
  3811.             $pdfcolor = sprintf('%F %F %F %F ', ($col1 / 100), ($col2 / 100), ($col3 / 100), ($col4 / 100)); 
  3812.             $suffix = 'k'; 
  3813.         } else { 
  3814.             // SPOT COLOR 
  3815.             $intcolor = array('C' => $col1, 'M' => $col2, 'Y' => $col3, 'K' => $col4, 'name' => $name); 
  3816.             $this->AddSpotColor($name, $col1, $col2, $col3, $col4); 
  3817.             $pdfcolor = $this->setSpotColor($type, $name, 100); 
  3818.         } 
  3819.     } 
  3820.     switch ($type) { 
  3821.         case 'draw': { 
  3822.             $pdfcolor .= strtoupper($suffix); 
  3823.             $this->DrawColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3824.             $this->strokecolor = $intcolor; 
  3825.             break; 
  3826.         } 
  3827.         case 'fill': { 
  3828.             $pdfcolor .= $suffix; 
  3829.             $this->FillColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3830.             $this->bgcolor = $intcolor; 
  3831.             break; 
  3832.         } 
  3833.         case 'text': { 
  3834.             $pdfcolor .= $suffix; 
  3835.             $this->TextColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3836.             $this->fgcolor = $intcolor; 
  3837.             break; 
  3838.         } 
  3839.     } 
  3840.     $this->ColorFlag = ($this->FillColor != $this->TextColor); 
  3841.     if (($type != 'text') AND ($this->state == 2)) { 
  3842.         if (!$ret) { 
  3843.             $this->_out($pdfcolor); 
  3844.         } 
  3845.         return $pdfcolor; 
  3846.     } 
  3847.     return ''; 
  3848. } 
  3849.  
  3850. /** 
  3851.  * Defines the color used for all drawing operations (lines, rectangles and cell borders). It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3852.  * @param $col1 (float) GRAY level for single color, or Red color for RGB (0-255), or CYAN color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3853.  * @param $col2 (float) GREEN color for RGB (0-255), or MAGENTA color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3854.  * @param $col3 (float) BLUE color for RGB (0-255), or YELLOW color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3855.  * @param $col4 (float) KEY (BLACK) color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3856.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the command. 
  3857.  * @param $name (string) spot color name (if any) 
  3858.  * @return string the PDF command 
  3859.  * @public 
  3860.  * @since 1.3 
  3861.  * @see SetDrawColorArray(), SetFillColor(), SetTextColor(), Line(), Rect(), Cell(), MultiCell() 
  3862.  */ 
  3863. public function SetDrawColor($col1=0, $col2=-1, $col3=-1, $col4=-1, $ret=false, $name='') { 
  3864.     return $this->setColor('draw', $col1, $col2, $col3, $col4, $ret, $name); 
  3865. } 
  3866.  
  3867. /** 
  3868.  * Defines the color used for all filling operations (filled rectangles and cell backgrounds). It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3869.  * @param $col1 (float) GRAY level for single color, or Red color for RGB (0-255), or CYAN color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3870.  * @param $col2 (float) GREEN color for RGB (0-255), or MAGENTA color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3871.  * @param $col3 (float) BLUE color for RGB (0-255), or YELLOW color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3872.  * @param $col4 (float) KEY (BLACK) color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3873.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the command. 
  3874.  * @param $name (string) Spot color name (if any). 
  3875.  * @return (string) The PDF command. 
  3876.  * @public 
  3877.  * @since 1.3 
  3878.  * @see SetFillColorArray(), SetDrawColor(), SetTextColor(), Rect(), Cell(), MultiCell() 
  3879.  */ 
  3880. public function SetFillColor($col1=0, $col2=-1, $col3=-1, $col4=-1, $ret=false, $name='') { 
  3881.     return $this->setColor('fill', $col1, $col2, $col3, $col4, $ret, $name); 
  3882. } 
  3883.  
  3884. /** 
  3885.  * Defines the color used for text. It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3886.  * @param $col1 (float) GRAY level for single color, or Red color for RGB (0-255), or CYAN color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3887.  * @param $col2 (float) GREEN color for RGB (0-255), or MAGENTA color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3888.  * @param $col3 (float) BLUE color for RGB (0-255), or YELLOW color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3889.  * @param $col4 (float) KEY (BLACK) color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3890.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the command. 
  3891.  * @param $name (string) Spot color name (if any). 
  3892.  * @return (string) Empty string. 
  3893.  * @public 
  3894.  * @since 1.3 
  3895.  * @see SetTextColorArray(), SetDrawColor(), SetFillColor(), Text(), Cell(), MultiCell() 
  3896.  */ 
  3897. public function SetTextColor($col1=0, $col2=-1, $col3=-1, $col4=-1, $ret=false, $name='') { 
  3898.     return $this->setColor('text', $col1, $col2, $col3, $col4, $ret, $name); 
  3899. } 
  3900.  
  3901. /** 
  3902.  * Returns the length of a string in user unit. A font must be selected.<br> 
  3903.  * @param $s (string) The string whose length is to be computed 
  3904.  * @param $fontname (string) Family font. It can be either a name defined by AddFont() or one of the standard families. It is also possible to pass an empty string, in that case, the current family is retained. 
  3905.  * @param $fontstyle (string) Font style. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>empty string: regular</li><li>B: bold</li><li>I: italic</li><li>U: underline</li><li>D: line-through</li><li>O: overline</li></ul> or any combination. The default value is regular. 
  3906.  * @param $fontsize (float) Font size in points. The default value is the current size. 
  3907.  * @param $getarray (boolean) if true returns an array of characters widths, if false returns the total length. 
  3908.  * @return mixed int total string length or array of characted widths 
  3909.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  3910.  * @public 
  3911.  * @since 1.2 
  3912.  */ 
  3913. public function GetStringWidth($s, $fontname='', $fontstyle='', $fontsize=0, $getarray=false) { 
  3914.     return $this->GetArrStringWidth(TCPDF_FONTS::utf8Bidi(TCPDF_FONTS::UTF8StringToArray($s, $this->isunicode, $this->CurrentFont), $s, $this->tmprtl, $this->isunicode, $this->CurrentFont), $fontname, $fontstyle, $fontsize, $getarray); 
  3915. } 
  3916.  
  3917. /** 
  3918.  * Returns the string length of an array of chars in user unit or an array of characters widths. A font must be selected.<br> 
  3919.  * @param $sa (string) The array of chars whose total length is to be computed 
  3920.  * @param $fontname (string) Family font. It can be either a name defined by AddFont() or one of the standard families. It is also possible to pass an empty string, in that case, the current family is retained. 
  3921.  * @param $fontstyle (string) Font style. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>empty string: regular</li><li>B: bold</li><li>I: italic</li><li>U: underline</li><li>D: line through</li><li>O: overline</li></ul> or any combination. The default value is regular. 
  3922.  * @param $fontsize (float) Font size in points. The default value is the current size. 
  3923.  * @param $getarray (boolean) if true returns an array of characters widths, if false returns the total length. 
  3924.  * @return mixed int total string length or array of characted widths 
  3925.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  3926.  * @public 
  3927.  * @since 2.3.000 (2008-03-06) 
  3928.  */ 
  3929. public function GetArrStringWidth($sa, $fontname='', $fontstyle='', $fontsize=0, $getarray=false) { 
  3930.     // store current values 
  3931.     if (!TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($fontname)) { 
  3932.         $prev_FontFamily = $this->FontFamily; 
  3933.         $prev_FontStyle = $this->FontStyle; 
  3934.         $prev_FontSizePt = $this->FontSizePt; 
  3935.         $this->SetFont($fontname, $fontstyle, $fontsize, '', 'default', false); 
  3936.     } 
  3937.     // convert UTF-8 array to Latin1 if required 
  3938.     if ($this->isunicode AND (!$this->isUnicodeFont())) { 
  3939.         $sa = TCPDF_FONTS::UTF8ArrToLatin1Arr($sa); 
  3940.     } 
  3941.     $w = 0; // total width 
  3942.     $wa = array(); // array of characters widths 
  3943.     foreach ($sa as $ck => $char) { 
  3944.         // character width 
  3945.         $cw = $this->GetCharWidth($char, isset($sa[($ck + 1)])); 
  3946.         $wa[] = $cw; 
  3947.         $w += $cw; 
  3948.     } 
  3949.     // restore previous values 
  3950.     if (!TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($fontname)) { 
  3951.         $this->SetFont($prev_FontFamily, $prev_FontStyle, $prev_FontSizePt, '', 'default', false); 
  3952.     } 
  3953.     if ($getarray) { 
  3954.         return $wa; 
  3955.     } 
  3956.     return $w; 
  3957. } 
  3958.  
  3959. /** 
  3960.  * Returns the length of the char in user unit for the current font considering current stretching and spacing (tracking). 
  3961.  * @param $char (int) The char code whose length is to be returned 
  3962.  * @param $notlast (boolean) If false ignore the font-spacing. 
  3963.  * @return float char width 
  3964.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  3965.  * @public 
  3966.  * @since 2.3.000 (2008-03-06) 
  3967.  */ 
  3968. public function GetCharWidth($char, $notlast=true) { 
  3969.     // get raw width 
  3970.     $chw = $this->getRawCharWidth($char); 
  3971.     if (($this->font_spacing < 0) OR (($this->font_spacing > 0) AND $notlast)) { 
  3972.         // increase/decrease font spacing 
  3973.         $chw += $this->font_spacing; 
  3974.     } 
  3975.     if ($this->font_stretching != 100) { 
  3976.         // fixed stretching mode 
  3977.         $chw *= ($this->font_stretching / 100); 
  3978.     } 
  3979.     return $chw; 
  3980. } 
  3981.  
  3982. /** 
  3983.  * Returns the length of the char in user unit for the current font. 
  3984.  * @param $char (int) The char code whose length is to be returned 
  3985.  * @return float char width 
  3986.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  3987.  * @public 
  3988.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-09-28) 
  3989.  */ 
  3990. public function getRawCharWidth($char) { 
  3991.     if ($char == 173) { 
  3992.         // SHY character will not be printed 
  3993.         return (0); 
  3994.     } 
  3995.     if (isset($this->CurrentFont['cw'][$char])) { 
  3996.         $w = $this->CurrentFont['cw'][$char]; 
  3997.     } elseif (isset($this->CurrentFont['dw'])) { 
  3998.         // default width 
  3999.         $w = $this->CurrentFont['dw']; 
  4000.     } elseif (isset($this->CurrentFont['cw'][32])) { 
  4001.         // default width 
  4002.         $w = $this->CurrentFont['cw'][32]; 
  4003.     } else { 
  4004.         $w = 600; 
  4005.     } 
  4006.     return $this->getAbsFontMeasure($w); 
  4007. } 
  4008.  
  4009. /** 
  4010.  * Returns the numbero of characters in a string. 
  4011.  * @param $s (string) The input string. 
  4012.  * @return int number of characters 
  4013.  * @public 
  4014.  * @since 2.0.0001 (2008-01-07) 
  4015.  */ 
  4016. public function GetNumChars($s) { 
  4017.     if ($this->isUnicodeFont()) { 
  4018.         return count(TCPDF_FONTS::UTF8StringToArray($s, $this->isunicode, $this->CurrentFont)); 
  4019.     } 
  4020.     return strlen($s); 
  4021. } 
  4022.  
  4023. /** 
  4024.  * Fill the list of available fonts ($this->fontlist). 
  4025.  * @protected 
  4026.  * @since 3.0.013 (2008-07-28) 
  4027.  */ 
  4028. protected function getFontsList() { 
  4029.     if (($fontsdir = opendir(TCPDF_FONTS::_getfontpath())) !== false) { 
  4030.         while (($file = readdir($fontsdir)) !== false) { 
  4031.             if (substr($file, -4) == '.php') { 
  4032.                 array_push($this->fontlist, strtolower(basename($file, '.php'))); 
  4033.             } 
  4034.         } 
  4035.         closedir($fontsdir); 
  4036.     } 
  4037. } 
  4038.  
  4039. /** 
  4040.  * Returns the unicode caracter specified by the value 
  4041.  * @param $c (int) UTF-8 value 
  4042.  * @return Returns the specified character. 
  4043.  * @since 2.3.000 (2008-03-05) 
  4044.  * @public 
  4045.  * @deprecated 
  4046.  */ 
  4047. public function unichr($c) { 
  4048.     return TCPDF_FONTS::unichr($c, $this->isunicode); 
  4049. } 
  4050.  
  4051. /** 
  4052.  * Convert and add the selected TrueType or Type1 font to the fonts folder (that must be writeable). 
  4053.  * @param $fontfile (string) Font file (full path). 
  4054.  * @param $fonttype (string) Font type. Leave empty for autodetect mode. Valid values are: TrueTypeUnicode, TrueType, Type1, CID0JP = CID-0 Japanese, CID0KR = CID-0 Korean, CID0CS = CID-0 Chinese Simplified, CID0CT = CID-0 Chinese Traditional. 
  4055.  * @param $enc (string) Name of the encoding table to use. Leave empty for default mode. Omit this parameter for TrueType Unicode and symbolic fonts like Symbol or ZapfDingBats. 
  4056.  * @param $flags (int) Unsigned 32-bit integer containing flags specifying various characteristics of the font (PDF32000:2008 - 9.8.2 Font Descriptor Flags): +1 for fixed font; +4 for symbol or +32 for non-symbol; +64 for italic. Fixed and Italic mode are generally autodetected so you have to set it to 32 = non-symbolic font (default) or 4 = symbolic font. 
  4057.  * @param $outpath (string) Output path for generated font files (must be writeable by the web server). Leave empty for default font folder. 
  4058.  * @param $platid (int) Platform ID for CMAP table to extract (when building a Unicode font for Windows this value should be 3, for Macintosh should be 1). 
  4059.  * @param $encid (int) Encoding ID for CMAP table to extract (when building a Unicode font for Windows this value should be 1, for Macintosh should be 0). When Platform ID is 3, legal values for Encoding ID are: 0=Symbol, 1=Unicode, 2=ShiftJIS, 3=PRC, 4=Big5, 5=Wansung, 6=Johab, 7=Reserved, 8=Reserved, 9=Reserved, 10=UCS-4. 
  4060.  * @param $addcbbox (boolean) If true includes the character bounding box information on the php font file. 
  4061.  * @return (string) TCPDF font name. 
  4062.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  4063.  * @since 5.9.123 (2010-09-30) 
  4064.  * @public 
  4065.  * @deprecated 
  4066.  */ 
  4067. public function addTTFfont($fontfile, $fonttype='', $enc='', $flags=32, $outpath='', $platid=3, $encid=1, $addcbbox=false) { 
  4068.     return TCPDF_FONTS::addTTFfont($fontfile, $fonttype, $enc, $flags, $outpath, $platid, $encid, $addcbbox); 
  4069. } 
  4070.  
  4071. /** 
  4072.  * Imports a TrueType, Type1, core, or CID0 font and makes it available. 
  4073.  * It is necessary to generate a font definition file first (read /fonts/utils/README.TXT). 
  4074.  * The definition file (and the font file itself when embedding) must be present either in the current directory or in the one indicated by K_PATH_FONTS if the constant is defined. If it could not be found, the error "Could not include font definition file" is generated. 
  4075.  * @param $family (string) Font family. The name can be chosen arbitrarily. If it is a standard family name, it will override the corresponding font. 
  4076.  * @param $style (string) Font style. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>empty string: regular (default)</li><li>B: bold</li><li>I: italic</li><li>BI or IB: bold italic</li></ul> 
  4077.  * @param $fontfile (string) The font definition file. By default, the name is built from the family and style, in lower case with no spaces. 
  4078.  * @return array containing the font data, or false in case of error. 
  4079.  * @param $subset (mixed) if true embedd only a subset of the font (stores only the information related to the used characters); if false embedd full font; if 'default' uses the default value set using setFontSubsetting(). This option is valid only for TrueTypeUnicode fonts. If you want to enable users to change the document, set this parameter to false. If you subset the font, the person who receives your PDF would need to have your same font in order to make changes to your PDF. The file size of the PDF would also be smaller because you are embedding only part of a font. 
  4080.  * @public 
  4081.  * @since 1.5 
  4082.  * @see SetFont(), setFontSubsetting() 
  4083.  */ 
  4084. public function AddFont($family, $style='', $fontfile='', $subset='default') { 
  4085.     if ($subset === 'default') { 
  4086.         $subset = $this->font_subsetting; 
  4087.     } 
  4088.     if ($this->pdfa_mode) { 
  4089.         $subset = false; 
  4090.     } 
  4091.     if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($family)) { 
  4092.         if (!TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($this->FontFamily)) { 
  4093.             $family = $this->FontFamily; 
  4094.         } else { 
  4095.             $this->Error('Empty font family'); 
  4096.         } 
  4097.     } 
  4098.     // move embedded styles on $style 
  4099.     if (substr($family, -1) == 'I') { 
  4100.         $style .= 'I'; 
  4101.         $family = substr($family, 0, -1); 
  4102.     } 
  4103.     if (substr($family, -1) == 'B') { 
  4104.         $style .= 'B'; 
  4105.         $family = substr($family, 0, -1); 
  4106.     } 
  4107.     // normalize family name 
  4108.     $family = strtolower($family); 
  4109.     if ((!$this->isunicode) AND ($family == 'arial')) { 
  4110.         $family = 'helvetica'; 
  4111.     } 
  4112.     if (($family == 'symbol') OR ($family == 'zapfdingbats')) { 
  4113.         $style = ''; 
  4114.     } 
  4115.     if ($this->pdfa_mode AND (isset($this->CoreFonts[$family]))) { 
  4116.         // all fonts must be embedded 
  4117.         $family = 'pdfa'.$family; 
  4118.     } 
  4119.     $tempstyle = strtoupper($style); 
  4120.     $style = ''; 
  4121.     // underline 
  4122.     if (strpos($tempstyle, 'U') !== false) { 
  4123.         $this->underline = true; 
  4124.     } else { 
  4125.         $this->underline = false; 
  4126.     } 
  4127.     // line-through (deleted) 
  4128.     if (strpos($tempstyle, 'D') !== false) { 
  4129.         $this->linethrough = true; 
  4130.     } else { 
  4131.         $this->linethrough = false; 
  4132.     } 
  4133.     // overline 
  4134.     if (strpos($tempstyle, 'O') !== false) { 
  4135.         $this->overline = true; 
  4136.     } else { 
  4137.         $this->overline = false; 
  4138.     } 
  4139.     // bold 
  4140.     if (strpos($tempstyle, 'B') !== false) { 
  4141.         $style .= 'B'; 
  4142.     } 
  4143.     // oblique 
  4144.     if (strpos($tempstyle, 'I') !== false) { 
  4145.         $style .= 'I'; 
  4146.     } 
  4147.     $bistyle = $style; 
  4148.     $fontkey = $family.$style; 
  4149.     $font_style = $style.($this->underline ? 'U' : '').($this->linethrough ? 'D' : '').($this->overline ? 'O' : ''); 
  4150.     $fontdata = array('fontkey' => $fontkey, 'family' => $family, 'style' => $font_style); 
  4151.     // check if the font has been already added 
  4152.     $fb = $this->getFontBuffer($fontkey); 
  4153.     if ($fb !== false) { 
  4154.         if ($this->inxobj) { 
  4155.             // we are inside an XObject template 
  4156.             $this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['fonts'][$fontkey] = $fb['i']; 
  4157.         } 
  4158.         return $fontdata; 
  4159.     } 
  4160.     // get specified font directory (if any) 
  4161.     $fontdir = false; 
  4162.     if (!TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($fontfile)) { 
  4163.         $fontdir = dirname($fontfile); 
  4164.         if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($fontdir) OR ($fontdir == '.')) { 
  4165.             $fontdir = ''; 
  4166.         } else { 
  4167.             $fontdir .= '/'; 
  4168.         } 
  4169.     } 
  4170.     // true when the font style variation is missing 
  4171.     $missing_style = false; 
  4172.     // search and include font file 
  4173.     if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($fontfile) OR (!@file_exists($fontfile))) { 
  4174.         // build a standard filenames for specified font 
  4175.         $tmp_fontfile = str_replace(' ', '', $family).strtolower($style).'.php'; 
  4176.         $fontfile = TCPDF_FONTS::getFontFullPath($tmp_fontfile, $fontdir); 
  4177.         if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($fontfile)) { 
  4178.             $missing_style = true; 
  4179.             // try to remove the style part 
  4180.             $tmp_fontfile = str_replace(' ', '', $family).'.php'; 
  4181.             $fontfile = TCPDF_FONTS::getFontFullPath($tmp_fontfile, $fontdir); 
  4182.         } 
  4183.     } 
  4184.     // include font file 
  4185.     if (!TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($fontfile) AND (@file_exists($fontfile))) { 
  4186.         include($fontfile); 
  4187.     } else { 
  4188.         $this->Error('Could not include font definition file: '.$family.''); 
  4189.     } 
  4190.     // check font parameters 
  4191.     if ((!isset($type)) OR (!isset($cw))) { 
  4192.         $this->Error('The font definition file has a bad format: '.$fontfile.''); 
  4193.     } 
  4194.     // SET default parameters 
  4195.     if (!isset($file) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($file)) { 
  4196.         $file = ''; 
  4197.     } 
  4198.     if (!isset($enc) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($enc)) { 
  4199.         $enc = ''; 
  4200.     } 
  4201.     if (!isset($cidinfo) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($cidinfo)) { 
  4202.         $cidinfo = array('Registry'=>'Adobe', 'Ordering'=>'Identity', 'Supplement'=>0); 
  4203.         $cidinfo['uni2cid'] = array(); 
  4204.     } 
  4205.     if (!isset($ctg) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($ctg)) { 
  4206.         $ctg = ''; 
  4207.     } 
  4208.     if (!isset($desc) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($desc)) { 
  4209.         $desc = array(); 
  4210.     } 
  4211.     if (!isset($up) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($up)) { 
  4212.         $up = -100; 
  4213.     } 
  4214.     if (!isset($ut) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($ut)) { 
  4215.         $ut = 50; 
  4216.     } 
  4217.     if (!isset($cw) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($cw)) { 
  4218.         $cw = array(); 
  4219.     } 
  4220.     if (!isset($dw) OR TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($dw)) { 
  4221.         // set default width 
  4222.         if (isset($desc['MissingWidth']) AND ($desc['MissingWidth'] > 0)) { 
  4223.             $dw = $desc['MissingWidth']; 
  4224.         } elseif (isset($cw[32])) { 
  4225.             $dw = $cw[32]; 
  4226.         } else { 
  4227.             $dw = 600; 
  4228.         } 
  4229.     } 
  4230.     ++$this->numfonts; 
  4231.     if ($type == 'core') { 
  4232.         $name = $this->CoreFonts[$fontkey]; 
  4233.         $subset = false; 
  4234.     } elseif (($type == 'TrueType') OR ($type == 'Type1')) { 
  4235.         $subset = false; 
  4236.     } elseif ($type == 'TrueTypeUnicode') { 
  4237.         $enc = 'Identity-H'; 
  4238.     } elseif ($type == 'cidfont0') { 
  4239.         if ($this->pdfa_mode) { 
  4240.             $this->Error('All fonts must be embedded in PDF/A mode!'); 
  4241.         } 
  4242.     } else { 
  4243.         $this->Error('Unknow font type: '.$type.''); 
  4244.     } 
  4245.     // set name if unset 
  4246.     if (!isset($name) OR empty($name)) { 
  4247.         $name = $fontkey; 
  4248.     } 
  4249.     // create artificial font style variations if missing (only works with non-embedded fonts) 
  4250.     if (($type != 'core') AND $missing_style) { 
  4251.         // style variations 
  4252.         $styles = array('' => '', 'B' => ', Bold', 'I' => ', Italic', 'BI' => ', BoldItalic'); 
  4253.         $name .= $styles[$bistyle]; 
  4254.         // artificial bold 
  4255.         if (strpos($bistyle, 'B') !== false) { 
  4256.             if (isset($desc['StemV'])) { 
  4257.                 // from normal to bold 
  4258.                 $desc['StemV'] = round($desc['StemV'] * 1.75); 
  4259.             } else { 
  4260.                 // bold 
  4261.                 $desc['StemV'] = 123; 
  4262.             } 
  4263.         } 
  4264.         // artificial italic 
  4265.         if (strpos($bistyle, 'I') !== false) { 
  4266.             if (isset($desc['ItalicAngle'])) { 
  4267.                 $desc['ItalicAngle'] -= 11; 
  4268.             } else { 
  4269.                 $desc['ItalicAngle'] = -11; 
  4270.             } 
  4271.             if (isset($desc['Flags'])) { 
  4272.                 $desc['Flags'] |= 64; //bit 7 
  4273.             } else { 
  4274.                 $desc['Flags'] = 64; 
  4275.             } 
  4276.         } 
  4277.     } 
  4278.     // check if the array of characters bounding boxes is defined 
  4279.     if (!isset($cbbox)) { 
  4280.         $cbbox = array(); 
  4281.     } 
  4282.     // initialize subsetchars 
  4283.     $subsetchars = array_fill(0, 255, true); 
  4284.     $this->setFontBuffer($fontkey, array('fontkey' => $fontkey, 'i' => $this->numfonts, 'type' => $type, 'name' => $name, 'desc' => $desc, 'up' => $up, 'ut' => $ut, 'cw' => $cw, 'cbbox' => $cbbox, 'dw' => $dw, 'enc' => $enc, 'cidinfo' => $cidinfo, 'file' => $file, 'ctg' => $ctg, 'subset' => $subset, 'subsetchars' => $subsetchars)); 
  4285.     if ($this->inxobj) { 
  4286.         // we are inside an XObject template 
  4287.         $this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['fonts'][$fontkey] = $this->numfonts; 
  4288.     } 
  4289.     if (isset($diff) AND (!empty($diff))) { 
  4290.         //Search existing encodings 
  4291.         $d = 0; 
  4292.         $nb = count($this->diffs); 
  4293.         for ($i=1; $i <= $nb; ++$i) { 
  4294.             if ($this->diffs[$i] == $diff) { 
  4295.                 $d = $i; 
  4296.                 break; 
  4297.             } 
  4298.         } 
  4299.         if ($d == 0) { 
  4300.             $d = $nb + 1; 
  4301.             $this->diffs[$d] = $diff; 
  4302.         } 
  4303.         $this->setFontSubBuffer($fontkey, 'diff', $d); 
  4304.     } 
  4305.     if (!TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($file)) { 
  4306.         if (!isset($this->FontFiles[$file])) { 
  4307.             if ((strcasecmp($type, 'TrueType') == 0) OR (strcasecmp($type, 'TrueTypeUnicode') == 0)) { 
  4308.                 $this->FontFiles[$file] = array('length1' => $originalsize, 'fontdir' => $fontdir, 'subset' => $subset, 'fontkeys' => array($fontkey)); 
  4309.             } elseif ($type != 'core') { 
  4310.                 $this->FontFiles[$file] = array('length1' => $size1, 'length2' => $size2, 'fontdir' => $fontdir, 'subset' => $subset, 'fontkeys' => array($fontkey)); 
  4311.             } 
  4312.         } else { 
  4313.             // update fontkeys that are sharing this font file 
  4314.             $this->FontFiles[$file]['subset'] = ($this->FontFiles[$file]['subset'] AND $subset); 
  4315.             if (!in_array($fontkey, $this->FontFiles[$file]['fontkeys'])) { 
  4316.                 $this->FontFiles[$file]['fontkeys'][] = $fontkey; 
  4317.             } 
  4318.         } 
  4319.     } 
  4320.     return $fontdata; 
  4321. } 
  4322.  
  4323. /** 
  4324.  * Sets the font used to print character strings. 
  4325.  * The font can be either a standard one or a font added via the AddFont() method. Standard fonts use Windows encoding cp1252 (Western Europe). 
  4326.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the font is retained from page to page. 
  4327.  * If you just wish to change the current font size, it is simpler to call SetFontSize(). 
  4328.  * Note: for the standard fonts, the font metric files must be accessible. There are three possibilities for this:<ul><li>They are in the current directory (the one where the running script lies)</li><li>They are in one of the directories defined by the include_path parameter</li><li>They are in the directory defined by the K_PATH_FONTS constant</li></ul><br /> 
  4329.  * @param $family (string) Family font. It can be either a name defined by AddFont() or one of the standard Type1 families (case insensitive):<ul><li>times (Times-Roman)</li><li>timesb (Times-Bold)</li><li>timesi (Times-Italic)</li><li>timesbi (Times-BoldItalic)</li><li>helvetica (Helvetica)</li><li>helveticab (Helvetica-Bold)</li><li>helveticai (Helvetica-Oblique)</li><li>helveticabi (Helvetica-BoldOblique)</li><li>courier (Courier)</li><li>courierb (Courier-Bold)</li><li>courieri (Courier-Oblique)</li><li>courierbi (Courier-BoldOblique)</li><li>symbol (Symbol)</li><li>zapfdingbats (ZapfDingbats)</li></ul> It is also possible to pass an empty string. In that case, the current family is retained. 
  4330.  * @param $style (string) Font style. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>empty string: regular</li><li>B: bold</li><li>I: italic</li><li>U: underline</li><li>D: line through</li><li>O: overline</li></ul> or any combination. The default value is regular. Bold and italic styles do not apply to Symbol and ZapfDingbats basic fonts or other fonts when not defined. 
  4331.  * @param $size (float) Font size in points. The default value is the current size. If no size has been specified since the beginning of the document, the value taken is 12 
  4332.  * @param $fontfile (string) The font definition file. By default, the name is built from the family and style, in lower case with no spaces. 
  4333.  * @param $subset (mixed) if true embedd only a subset of the font (stores only the information related to the used characters); if false embedd full font; if 'default' uses the default value set using setFontSubsetting(). This option is valid only for TrueTypeUnicode fonts. If you want to enable users to change the document, set this parameter to false. If you subset the font, the person who receives your PDF would need to have your same font in order to make changes to your PDF. The file size of the PDF would also be smaller because you are embedding only part of a font. 
  4334.  * @param $out (boolean) if true output the font size command, otherwise only set the font properties. 
  4335.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  4336.  * @public 
  4337.  * @since 1.0 
  4338.  * @see AddFont(), SetFontSize() 
  4339.  */ 
  4340. public function SetFont($family, $style='', $size=null, $fontfile='', $subset='default', $out=true) { 
  4341.     //Select a font; size given in points 
  4342.     if ($size === null) { 
  4343.         $size = $this->FontSizePt; 
  4344.     } 
  4345.     if ($size < 0) { 
  4346.         $size = 0; 
  4347.     } 
  4348.     // try to add font (if not already added) 
  4349.     $fontdata = $this->AddFont($family, $style, $fontfile, $subset); 
  4350.     $this->FontFamily = $fontdata['family']; 
  4351.     $this->FontStyle = $fontdata['style']; 
  4352.     if (isset($this->CurrentFont['fontkey']) AND isset($this->CurrentFont['subsetchars'])) { 
  4353.         // save subset chars of the previous font 
  4354.         $this->setFontSubBuffer($this->CurrentFont['fontkey'], 'subsetchars', $this->CurrentFont['subsetchars']); 
  4355.     } 
  4356.     $this->CurrentFont = $this->getFontBuffer($fontdata['fontkey']); 
  4357.     $this->SetFontSize($size, $out); 
  4358. } 
  4359.  
  4360. /** 
  4361.  * Defines the size of the current font. 
  4362.  * @param $size (float) The font size in points. 
  4363.  * @param $out (boolean) if true output the font size command, otherwise only set the font properties. 
  4364.  * @public 
  4365.  * @since 1.0 
  4366.  * @see SetFont() 
  4367.  */ 
  4368. public function SetFontSize($size, $out=true) { 
  4369.     // font size in points 
  4370.     $this->FontSizePt = $size; 
  4371.     // font size in user units 
  4372.     $this->FontSize = $size / $this->k; 
  4373.     // calculate some font metrics 
  4374.     if (isset($this->CurrentFont['desc']['FontBBox'])) { 
  4375.         $bbox = explode(' ', substr($this->CurrentFont['desc']['FontBBox'], 1, -1)); 
  4376.         $font_height = ((intval($bbox[3]) - intval($bbox[1])) * $size / 1000); 
  4377.     } else { 
  4378.         $font_height = $size * 1.219; 
  4379.     } 
  4380.     if (isset($this->CurrentFont['desc']['Ascent']) AND ($this->CurrentFont['desc']['Ascent'] > 0)) { 
  4381.         $font_ascent = ($this->CurrentFont['desc']['Ascent'] * $size / 1000); 
  4382.     } 
  4383.     if (isset($this->CurrentFont['desc']['Descent']) AND ($this->CurrentFont['desc']['Descent'] <= 0)) { 
  4384.         $font_descent = (- $this->CurrentFont['desc']['Descent'] * $size / 1000); 
  4385.     } 
  4386.     if (!isset($font_ascent) AND !isset($font_descent)) { 
  4387.         // core font 
  4388.         $font_ascent = 0.76 * $font_height; 
  4389.         $font_descent = $font_height - $font_ascent; 
  4390.     } elseif (!isset($font_descent)) { 
  4391.         $font_descent = $font_height - $font_ascent; 
  4392.     } elseif (!isset($font_ascent)) { 
  4393.         $font_ascent = $font_height - $font_descent; 
  4394.     } 
  4395.     $this->FontAscent = ($font_ascent / $this->k); 
  4396.     $this->FontDescent = ($font_descent / $this->k); 
  4397.     if ($out AND ($this->page > 0) AND (isset($this->CurrentFont['i'])) AND ($this->state == 2)) { 
  4398.         $this->_out(sprintf('BT /F%d %F Tf ET', $this->CurrentFont['i'], $this->FontSizePt)); 
  4399.     } 
  4400. } 
  4401.  
  4402. /** 
  4403.  * Returns the bounding box of the current font in user units. 
  4404.  * @return array 
  4405.  * @public 
  4406.  * @since 5.9.152 (2012-03-23) 
  4407.  */ 
  4408. public function getFontBBox() { 
  4409.     $fbbox = array(); 
  4410.     if (isset($this->CurrentFont['desc']['FontBBox'])) { 
  4411.         $tmpbbox = explode(' ', substr($this->CurrentFont['desc']['FontBBox'], 1, -1)); 
  4412.         $fbbox = array_map(array($this, 'getAbsFontMeasure'), $tmpbbox); 
  4413.     } else { 
  4414.         // Find max width 
  4415.         if (isset($this->CurrentFont['desc']['MaxWidth'])) { 
  4416.             $maxw = $this->getAbsFontMeasure(intval($this->CurrentFont['desc']['MaxWidth'])); 
  4417.         } else { 
  4418.             $maxw = 0; 
  4419.             if (isset($this->CurrentFont['desc']['MissingWidth'])) { 
  4420.                 $maxw = max($maxw, $this->CurrentFont['desc']['MissingWidth']); 
  4421.             } 
  4422.             if (isset($this->CurrentFont['desc']['AvgWidth'])) { 
  4423.                 $maxw = max($maxw, $this->CurrentFont['desc']['AvgWidth']); 
  4424.             } 
  4425.             if (isset($this->CurrentFont['dw'])) { 
  4426.                 $maxw = max($maxw, $this->CurrentFont['dw']); 
  4427.             } 
  4428.             foreach ($this->CurrentFont['cw'] as $char => $w) { 
  4429.                 $maxw = max($maxw, $w); 
  4430.             } 
  4431.             if ($maxw == 0) { 
  4432.                 $maxw = 600; 
  4433.             } 
  4434.             $maxw = $this->getAbsFontMeasure($maxw); 
  4435.         } 
  4436.         $fbbox = array(0, (0 - $this->FontDescent), $maxw, $this->FontAscent); 
  4437.     } 
  4438.     return $fbbox; 
  4439. } 
  4440.  
  4441. /** 
  4442.  * Convert a relative font measure into absolute value. 
  4443.  * @param $s (int) Font measure. 
  4444.  * @return float Absolute measure. 
  4445.  * @since 5.9.186 (2012-09-13) 
  4446.  */ 
  4447. public function getAbsFontMeasure($s) { 
  4448.     return ($s * $this->FontSize / 1000); 
  4449. } 
  4450.  
  4451. /** 
  4452.  * Returns the glyph bounding box of the specified character in the current font in user units. 
  4453.  * @param $char (int) Input character code. 
  4454.  * @return mixed array(xMin, yMin, xMax, yMax) or FALSE if not defined. 
  4455.  * @since 5.9.186 (2012-09-13) 
  4456.  */ 
  4457. public function getCharBBox($char) { 
  4458.     if (isset($this->CurrentFont['cbbox'][$char])) { 
  4459.         return array_map(array($this, 'getAbsFontMeasure'), $this->CurrentFont['cbbox'][intval($char)]); 
  4460.     } 
  4461.     return false; 
  4462. } 
  4463.  
  4464. /** 
  4465.  * Return the font descent value 
  4466.  * @param $font (string) font name 
  4467.  * @param $style (string) font style 
  4468.  * @param $size (float) The size (in points) 
  4469.  * @return int font descent 
  4470.  * @public 
  4471.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  4472.  * @since 4.9.003 (2010-03-30) 
  4473.  */ 
  4474. public function getFontDescent($font, $style='', $size=0) { 
  4475.     $fontdata = $this->AddFont($font, $style); 
  4476.     $fontinfo = $this->getFontBuffer($fontdata['fontkey']); 
  4477.     if (isset($fontinfo['desc']['Descent']) AND ($fontinfo['desc']['Descent'] <= 0)) { 
  4478.         $descent = (- $fontinfo['desc']['Descent'] * $size / 1000); 
  4479.     } else { 
  4480.         $descent = (1.219 * 0.24 * $size); 
  4481.     } 
  4482.     return ($descent / $this->k); 
  4483. } 
  4484.  
  4485. /** 
  4486.  * Return the font ascent value. 
  4487.  * @param $font (string) font name 
  4488.  * @param $style (string) font style 
  4489.  * @param $size (float) The size (in points) 
  4490.  * @return int font ascent 
  4491.  * @public 
  4492.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  4493.  * @since 4.9.003 (2010-03-30) 
  4494.  */ 
  4495. public function getFontAscent($font, $style='', $size=0) { 
  4496.     $fontdata = $this->AddFont($font, $style); 
  4497.     $fontinfo = $this->getFontBuffer($fontdata['fontkey']); 
  4498.     if (isset($fontinfo['desc']['Ascent']) AND ($fontinfo['desc']['Ascent'] > 0)) { 
  4499.         $ascent = ($fontinfo['desc']['Ascent'] * $size / 1000); 
  4500.     } else { 
  4501.         $ascent = 1.219 * 0.76 * $size; 
  4502.     } 
  4503.     return ($ascent / $this->k); 
  4504. } 
  4505.  
  4506. /** 
  4507.  * Return true in the character is present in the specified font. 
  4508.  * @param $char (mixed) Character to check (integer value or string) 
  4509.  * @param $font (string) Font name (family name). 
  4510.  * @param $style (string) Font style. 
  4511.  * @return (boolean) true if the char is defined, false otherwise. 
  4512.  * @public 
  4513.  * @since 5.9.153 (2012-03-28) 
  4514.  */ 
  4515. public function isCharDefined($char, $font='', $style='') { 
  4516.     if (is_string($char)) { 
  4517.         // get character code 
  4518.         $char = TCPDF_FONTS::UTF8StringToArray($char, $this->isunicode, $this->CurrentFont); 
  4519.         $char = $char[0]; 
  4520.     } 
  4521.     if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($font)) { 
  4522.         if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($style)) { 
  4523.             return (isset($this->CurrentFont['cw'][intval($char)])); 
  4524.         } 
  4525.         $font = $this->FontFamily; 
  4526.     } 
  4527.     $fontdata = $this->AddFont($font, $style); 
  4528.     $fontinfo = $this->getFontBuffer($fontdata['fontkey']); 
  4529.     return (isset($fontinfo['cw'][intval($char)])); 
  4530. } 
  4531.  
  4532. /** 
  4533.  * Replace missing font characters on selected font with specified substitutions. 
  4534.  * @param $text (string) Text to process. 
  4535.  * @param $font (string) Font name (family name). 
  4536.  * @param $style (string) Font style. 
  4537.  * @param $subs (array) Array of possible character substitutions. The key is the character to check (integer value) and the value is a single intege value or an array of possible substitutes. 
  4538.  * @return (string) Processed text. 
  4539.  * @public 
  4540.  * @since 5.9.153 (2012-03-28) 
  4541.  */ 
  4542. public function replaceMissingChars($text, $font='', $style='', $subs=array()) { 
  4543.     if (empty($subs)) { 
  4544.         return $text; 
  4545.     } 
  4546.     if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($font)) { 
  4547.         $font = $this->FontFamily; 
  4548.     } 
  4549.     $fontdata = $this->AddFont($font, $style); 
  4550.     $fontinfo = $this->getFontBuffer($fontdata['fontkey']); 
  4551.     $uniarr = TCPDF_FONTS::UTF8StringToArray($text, $this->isunicode, $this->CurrentFont); 
  4552.     foreach ($uniarr as $k => $chr) { 
  4553.         if (!isset($fontinfo['cw'][$chr])) { 
  4554.             // this character is missing on the selected font 
  4555.             if (isset($subs[$chr])) { 
  4556.                 // we have available substitutions 
  4557.                 if (is_array($subs[$chr])) { 
  4558.                     foreach($subs[$chr] as $s) { 
  4559.                         if (isset($fontinfo['cw'][$s])) { 
  4560.                             $uniarr[$k] = $s; 
  4561.                             break; 
  4562.                         } 
  4563.                     } 
  4564.                 } elseif (isset($fontinfo['cw'][$subs[$chr]])) { 
  4565.                     $uniarr[$k] = $subs[$chr]; 
  4566.                 } 
  4567.             } 
  4568.         } 
  4569.     } 
  4570.     return TCPDF_FONTS::UniArrSubString(TCPDF_FONTS::UTF8ArrayToUniArray($uniarr, $this->isunicode)); 
  4571. } 
  4572.  
  4573. /** 
  4574.  * Defines the default monospaced font. 
  4575.  * @param $font (string) Font name. 
  4576.  * @public 
  4577.  * @since 4.5.025 
  4578.  */ 
  4579. public function SetDefaultMonospacedFont($font) { 
  4580.     $this->default_monospaced_font = $font; 
  4581. } 
  4582.  
  4583. /** 
  4584.  * Creates a new internal link and returns its identifier. An internal link is a clickable area which directs to another place within the document.<br /> 
  4585.  * The identifier can then be passed to Cell(), Write(), Image() or Link(). The destination is defined with SetLink(). 
  4586.  * @public 
  4587.  * @since 1.5 
  4588.  * @see Cell(), Write(), Image(), Link(), SetLink() 
  4589.  */ 
  4590. public function AddLink() { 
  4591.     // create a new internal link 
  4592.     $n = count($this->links) + 1; 
  4593.     $this->links[$n] = array('p' => 0, 'y' => 0, 'f' => false); 
  4594.     return $n; 
  4595. } 
  4596.  
  4597. /** 
  4598.  * Defines the page and position a link points to. 
  4599.  * @param $link (int) The link identifier returned by AddLink() 
  4600.  * @param $y (float) Ordinate of target position; -1 indicates the current position. The default value is 0 (top of page) 
  4601.  * @param $page (int) Number of target page; -1 indicates the current page (default value). If you prefix a page number with the * character, then this page will not be changed when adding/deleting/moving pages.  
  4602.  * @public 
  4603.  * @since 1.5 
  4604.  * @see AddLink() 
  4605.  */
