  10629.  * Compute O value (used for encryption) 
  10630.  * @return string O value 
  10631.  * @protected 
  10632.  * @since 2.0.000 (2008-01-02) 
  10633.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  10634.  */ 
  10635. protected function _Ovalue() { 
  10636.     if ($this->encryptdata['mode'] < 3) { // RC4-40, RC4-128, AES-128 
  10637.         $tmp = TCPDF_STATIC::_md5_16($this->encryptdata['owner_password']); 
  10638.         if ($this->encryptdata['mode'] > 0) { 
  10639.             for ($i = 0; $i < 50; ++$i) { 
  10640.                 $tmp = TCPDF_STATIC::_md5_16($tmp); 
  10641.             } 
  10642.         } 
  10643.         $owner_key = substr($tmp, 0, ($this->encryptdata['Length'] / 8)); 
  10644.         $enc = TCPDF_STATIC::_RC4($owner_key, $this->encryptdata['user_password'], $this->last_enc_key, $this->last_enc_key_c); 
  10645.         if ($this->encryptdata['mode'] > 0) { 
  10646.             $len = strlen($owner_key); 
  10647.             for ($i = 1; $i <= 19; ++$i) { 
  10648.                 $ek = ''; 
  10649.                 for ($j = 0; $j < $len; ++$j) { 
  10650.                     $ek .= chr(ord($owner_key[$j]) ^ $i); 
  10651.                 } 
  10652.                 $enc = TCPDF_STATIC::_RC4($ek, $enc, $this->last_enc_key, $this->last_enc_key_c); 
  10653.             } 
  10654.         } 
  10655.         return $enc; 
  10656.     } elseif ($this->encryptdata['mode'] == 3) { // AES-256 
  10657.         $seed = TCPDF_STATIC::_md5_16(TCPDF_STATIC::getRandomSeed()); 
  10658.         // Owner Validation Salt 
  10659.         $this->encryptdata['OVS'] = substr($seed, 0, 8); 
  10660.         // Owner Key Salt 
  10661.         $this->encryptdata['OKS'] = substr($seed, 8, 16); 
  10662.         return hash('sha256', $this->encryptdata['owner_password'].$this->encryptdata['OVS'].$this->encryptdata['U'], true).$this->encryptdata['OVS'].$this->encryptdata['OKS']; 
  10663.     } 
  10664. } 
  10665.  
  10666. /** 
  10667.  * Compute OE value (used for encryption) 
  10668.  * @return string OE value 
  10669.  * @protected 
  10670.  * @since 5.9.006 (2010-10-19) 
  10671.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  10672.  */ 
  10673. protected function _OEvalue() { 
  10674.     $hashkey = hash('sha256', $this->encryptdata['owner_password'].$this->encryptdata['OKS'].$this->encryptdata['U'], true); 
  10675.     $iv = str_repeat("\x00", mcrypt_get_iv_size(MCRYPT_RIJNDAEL_128, MCRYPT_MODE_CBC)); 
  10676.     return mcrypt_encrypt(MCRYPT_RIJNDAEL_128, $hashkey, $this->encryptdata['key'], MCRYPT_MODE_CBC, $iv); 
  10677. } 
  10678.  
  10679. /** 
  10680.  * Convert password for AES-256 encryption mode 
  10681.  * @param $password (string) password 
  10682.  * @return string password 
  10683.  * @protected 
  10684.  * @since 5.9.006 (2010-10-19) 
  10685.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  10686.  */ 
  10687. protected function _fixAES256Password($password) { 
  10688.     $psw = ''; // password to be returned 
  10689.     $psw_array = TCPDF_FONTS::utf8Bidi(TCPDF_FONTS::UTF8StringToArray($password, $this->isunicode, $this->CurrentFont), $password, $this->rtl, $this->isunicode, $this->CurrentFont); 
  10690.     foreach ($psw_array as $c) { 
  10691.         $psw .= TCPDF_FONTS::unichr($c, $this->isunicode); 
  10692.     } 
  10693.     return substr($psw, 0, 127); 
  10694. } 
  10695.  
  10696. /** 
  10697.  * Compute encryption key 
  10698.  * @protected 
  10699.  * @since 2.0.000 (2008-01-02) 
  10700.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  10701.  */ 
  10702. protected function _generateencryptionkey() { 
  10703.     $keybytelen = ($this->encryptdata['Length'] / 8); 
  10704.     if (!$this->encryptdata['pubkey']) { // standard mode 
  10705.         if ($this->encryptdata['mode'] == 3) { // AES-256 
  10706.             // generate 256 bit random key 
  10707.             $this->encryptdata['key'] = substr(hash('sha256', TCPDF_STATIC::getRandomSeed(), true), 0, $keybytelen); 
  10708.             // truncate passwords 
  10709.             $this->encryptdata['user_password'] = $this->_fixAES256Password($this->encryptdata['user_password']); 
  10710.             $this->encryptdata['owner_password'] = $this->_fixAES256Password($this->encryptdata['owner_password']); 
  10711.             // Compute U value 
  10712.             $this->encryptdata['U'] = $this->_Uvalue(); 
  10713.             // Compute UE value 
  10714.             $this->encryptdata['UE'] = $this->_UEvalue(); 
  10715.             // Compute O value 
  10716.             $this->encryptdata['O'] = $this->_Ovalue(); 
  10717.             // Compute OE value 
  10718.             $this->encryptdata['OE'] = $this->_OEvalue(); 
  10719.             // Compute P value 
  10720.             $this->encryptdata['P'] = $this->encryptdata['protection']; 
  10721.             // Computing the encryption dictionary's Perms (permissions) value 
  10722.             $perms = TCPDF_STATIC::getEncPermissionsString($this->encryptdata['protection']); // bytes 0-3 
  10723.             $perms .= chr(255).chr(255).chr(255).chr(255); // bytes 4-7 
  10724.             if (isset($this->encryptdata['CF']['EncryptMetadata']) AND (!$this->encryptdata['CF']['EncryptMetadata'])) { // byte 8 
  10725.                 $perms .= 'F'; 
  10726.             } else { 
  10727.                 $perms .= 'T'; 
  10728.             } 
  10729.             $perms .= 'adb'; // bytes 9-11 
  10730.             $perms .= 'nick'; // bytes 12-15 
  10731.             $iv = str_repeat("\x00", mcrypt_get_iv_size(MCRYPT_RIJNDAEL_128, MCRYPT_MODE_ECB)); 
  10732.             $this->encryptdata['perms'] = mcrypt_encrypt(MCRYPT_RIJNDAEL_128, $this->encryptdata['key'], $perms, MCRYPT_MODE_ECB, $iv); 
  10733.         } else { // RC4-40, RC4-128, AES-128 
  10734.             // Pad passwords 
  10735.             $this->encryptdata['user_password'] = substr($this->encryptdata['user_password'].TCPDF_STATIC::$enc_padding, 0, 32); 
  10736.             $this->encryptdata['owner_password'] = substr($this->encryptdata['owner_password'].TCPDF_STATIC::$enc_padding, 0, 32); 
  10737.             // Compute O value 
  10738.             $this->encryptdata['O'] = $this->_Ovalue(); 
  10739.             // get default permissions (reverse byte order) 
  10740.             $permissions = TCPDF_STATIC::getEncPermissionsString($this->encryptdata['protection']); 
  10741.             // Compute encryption key 
  10742.             $tmp = TCPDF_STATIC::_md5_16($this->encryptdata['user_password'].$this->encryptdata['O'].$permissions.$this->encryptdata['fileid']); 
  10743.             if ($this->encryptdata['mode'] > 0) { 
  10744.                 for ($i = 0; $i < 50; ++$i) { 
  10745.                     $tmp = TCPDF_STATIC::_md5_16(substr($tmp, 0, $keybytelen)); 
  10746.                 } 
  10747.             } 
  10748.             $this->encryptdata['key'] = substr($tmp, 0, $keybytelen); 
  10749.             // Compute U value 
  10750.             $this->encryptdata['U'] = $this->_Uvalue(); 
  10751.             // Compute P value 
  10752.             $this->encryptdata['P'] = $this->encryptdata['protection']; 
  10753.         } 
  10754.     } else { // Public-Key mode 
  10755.         // random 20-byte seed 
  10756.         $seed = sha1(TCPDF_STATIC::getRandomSeed(), true); 
  10757.         $recipient_bytes = ''; 
  10758.         foreach ($this->encryptdata['pubkeys'] as $pubkey) { 
  10759.             // for each public certificate 
  10760.             if (isset($pubkey['p'])) { 
  10761.                 $pkprotection = TCPDF_STATIC::getUserPermissionCode($pubkey['p'], $this->encryptdata['mode']); 
  10762.             } else { 
  10763.                 $pkprotection = $this->encryptdata['protection']; 
  10764.             } 
  10765.             // get default permissions (reverse byte order) 
  10766.             $pkpermissions = TCPDF_STATIC::getEncPermissionsString($pkprotection); 
  10767.             // envelope data 
  10768.             $envelope = $seed.$pkpermissions; 
  10769.             // write the envelope data to a temporary file 
  10770.             $tempkeyfile = TCPDF_STATIC::getObjFilename('key'); 
  10771.             $f = fopen($tempkeyfile, 'wb'); 
  10772.             if (!$f) { 
  10773.                 $this->Error('Unable to create temporary key file: '.$tempkeyfile); 
  10774.             } 
  10775.             $envelope_length = strlen($envelope); 
  10776.             fwrite($f, $envelope, $envelope_length); 
  10777.             fclose($f); 
  10778.             $tempencfile = TCPDF_STATIC::getObjFilename('enc'); 
  10779.             if (!openssl_pkcs7_encrypt($tempkeyfile, $tempencfile, $pubkey['c'], array(), PKCS7_BINARY | PKCS7_DETACHED)) { 
  10780.                 $this->Error('Unable to encrypt the file: '.$tempkeyfile); 
  10781.             } 
  10782.             unlink($tempkeyfile); 
  10783.             // read encryption signature 
  10784.             $signature = file_get_contents($tempencfile, false, null, $envelope_length); 
  10785.             unlink($tempencfile); 
  10786.             // extract signature 
  10787.             $signature = substr($signature, strpos($signature, 'Content-Disposition')); 
  10788.             $tmparr = explode("\n\n", $signature); 
  10789.             $signature = trim($tmparr[1]); 
  10790.             unset($tmparr); 
  10791.             // decode signature 
  10792.             $signature = base64_decode($signature); 
  10793.             // convert signature to hex 
  10794.             $hexsignature = current(unpack('H*', $signature)); 
  10795.             // store signature on recipients array 
  10796.             $this->encryptdata['Recipients'][] = $hexsignature; 
  10797.             // The bytes of each item in the Recipients array of PKCS#7 objects in the order in which they appear in the array 
  10798.             $recipient_bytes .= $signature; 
  10799.         } 
  10800.         // calculate encryption key 
  10801.         if ($this->encryptdata['mode'] == 3) { // AES-256 
  10802.             $this->encryptdata['key'] = substr(hash('sha256', $seed.$recipient_bytes, true), 0, $keybytelen); 
  10803.         } else { // RC4-40, RC4-128, AES-128 
  10804.             $this->encryptdata['key'] = substr(sha1($seed.$recipient_bytes, true), 0, $keybytelen); 
  10805.         } 
  10806.     } 
  10807. } 
  10808.  
  10809. /** 
  10810.  * Set document protection 
  10811.  * Remark: the protection against modification is for people who have the full Acrobat product. 
  10812.  * If you don't set any password, the document will open as usual. If you set a user password, the PDF viewer will ask for it before displaying the document. The master password, if different from the user one, can be used to get full access. 
  10813.  * Note: protecting a document requires to encrypt it, which increases the processing time a lot. This can cause a PHP time-out in some cases, especially if the document contains images or fonts. 
  10814.  * @param $permissions (Array) the set of permissions (specify the ones you want to block):<ul><li>print : Print the document;</li><li>modify : Modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by 'fill-forms', 'extract' and 'assemble';</li><li>copy : Copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document;</li><li>annot-forms : Add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive form fields, and, if 'modify' is also set, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields);</li><li>fill-forms : Fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), even if 'annot-forms' is not specified;</li><li>extract : Extract text and graphics (in support of accessibility to users with disabilities or for other purposes);</li><li>assemble : Assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), even if 'modify' is not set;</li><li>print-high : Print the document to a representation from which a faithful digital copy of the PDF content could be generated. When this is not set, printing is limited to a low-level representation of the appearance, possibly of degraded quality.</li><li>owner : (inverted logic - only for public-key) when set permits change of encryption and enables all other permissions.</li></ul> 
  10815.  * @param $user_pass (String) user password. Empty by default. 
  10816.  * @param $owner_pass (String) owner password. If not specified, a random value is used. 
  10817.  * @param $mode (int) encryption strength: 0 = RC4 40 bit; 1 = RC4 128 bit; 2 = AES 128 bit; 3 = AES 256 bit. 
  10818.  * @param $pubkeys (String) array of recipients containing public-key certificates ('c') and permissions ('p'). For example: array(array('c' => 'file://../examples/data/cert/tcpdf.crt', 'p' => array('print'))) 
  10819.  * @public 
  10820.  * @since 2.0.000 (2008-01-02) 
  10821.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  10822.  */ 
  10823. public function SetProtection($permissions=array('print', 'modify', 'copy', 'annot-forms', 'fill-forms', 'extract', 'assemble', 'print-high'), $user_pass='', $owner_pass=null, $mode=0, $pubkeys=null) { 
  10824.     if ($this->pdfa_mode) { 
  10825.         // encryption is not allowed in PDF/A mode 
  10826.         return; 
  10827.     } 
  10828.     $this->encryptdata['protection'] = TCPDF_STATIC::getUserPermissionCode($permissions, $mode); 
  10829.     if (($pubkeys !== null) AND (is_array($pubkeys))) { 
  10830.         // public-key mode 
  10831.         $this->encryptdata['pubkeys'] = $pubkeys; 
  10832.         if ($mode == 0) { 
  10833.             // public-Key Security requires at least 128 bit 
  10834.             $mode = 1; 
  10835.         } 
  10836.         if (!function_exists('openssl_pkcs7_encrypt')) { 
  10837.             $this->Error('Public-Key Security requires openssl library.'); 
  10838.         } 
  10839.         // Set Public-Key filter (availabe are: Entrust.PPKEF, Adobe.PPKLite, Adobe.PubSec) 
  10840.         $this->encryptdata['pubkey'] = true; 
  10841.         $this->encryptdata['Filter'] = 'Adobe.PubSec'; 
  10842.         $this->encryptdata['StmF'] = 'DefaultCryptFilter'; 
  10843.         $this->encryptdata['StrF'] = 'DefaultCryptFilter'; 
  10844.     } else { 
  10845.         // standard mode (password mode) 
  10846.         $this->encryptdata['pubkey'] = false; 
  10847.         $this->encryptdata['Filter'] = 'Standard'; 
  10848.         $this->encryptdata['StmF'] = 'StdCF'; 
  10849.         $this->encryptdata['StrF'] = 'StdCF'; 
  10850.     } 
  10851.     if ($mode > 1) { // AES 
  10852.         if (!extension_loaded('mcrypt')) { 
  10853.             $this->Error('AES encryption requires mcrypt library (http://www.php.net/manual/en/mcrypt.requirements.php).'); 
  10854.         } 
  10855.         if (mcrypt_get_cipher_name(MCRYPT_RIJNDAEL_128) === false) { 
  10856.             $this->Error('AES encryption requires MCRYPT_RIJNDAEL_128 cypher.'); 
  10857.         } 
  10858.         if (($mode == 3) AND !function_exists('hash')) { 
  10859.             // the Hash extension requires no external libraries and is enabled by default as of PHP 5.1.2. 
  10860.             $this->Error('AES 256 encryption requires HASH Message Digest Framework (http://www.php.net/manual/en/book.hash.php).'); 
  10861.         } 
  10862.     } 
  10863.     if ($owner_pass === null) { 
  10864.         $owner_pass = md5(TCPDF_STATIC::getRandomSeed()); 
  10865.     } 
  10866.     $this->encryptdata['user_password'] = $user_pass; 
  10867.     $this->encryptdata['owner_password'] = $owner_pass; 
  10868.     $this->encryptdata['mode'] = $mode; 
  10869.     switch ($mode) { 
  10870.         case 0: { // RC4 40 bit 
  10871.             $this->encryptdata['V'] = 1; 
  10872.             $this->encryptdata['Length'] = 40; 
  10873.             $this->encryptdata['CF']['CFM'] = 'V2'; 
  10874.             break; 
  10875.         } 
  10876.         case 1: { // RC4 128 bit 
  10877.             $this->encryptdata['V'] = 2; 
  10878.             $this->encryptdata['Length'] = 128; 
  10879.             $this->encryptdata['CF']['CFM'] = 'V2'; 
  10880.             if ($this->encryptdata['pubkey']) { 
  10881.                 $this->encryptdata['SubFilter'] = 'adbe.pkcs7.s4'; 
  10882.                 $this->encryptdata['Recipients'] = array(); 
  10883.             } 
  10884.             break; 
  10885.         } 
  10886.         case 2: { // AES 128 bit 
  10887.             $this->encryptdata['V'] = 4; 
  10888.             $this->encryptdata['Length'] = 128; 
  10889.             $this->encryptdata['CF']['CFM'] = 'AESV2'; 
  10890.             $this->encryptdata['CF']['Length'] = 128; 
  10891.             if ($this->encryptdata['pubkey']) { 
  10892.                 $this->encryptdata['SubFilter'] = 'adbe.pkcs7.s5'; 
  10893.                 $this->encryptdata['Recipients'] = array(); 
  10894.             } 
  10895.             break; 
  10896.         } 
  10897.         case 3: { // AES 256 bit 
  10898.             $this->encryptdata['V'] = 5; 
  10899.             $this->encryptdata['Length'] = 256; 
  10900.             $this->encryptdata['CF']['CFM'] = 'AESV3'; 
  10901.             $this->encryptdata['CF']['Length'] = 256; 
  10902.             if ($this->encryptdata['pubkey']) { 
  10903.                 $this->encryptdata['SubFilter'] = 'adbe.pkcs7.s5'; 
  10904.                 $this->encryptdata['Recipients'] = array(); 
  10905.             } 
  10906.             break; 
  10907.         } 
  10908.     } 
  10909.     $this->encrypted = true; 
  10910.     $this->encryptdata['fileid'] = TCPDF_STATIC::convertHexStringToString($this->file_id); 
  10911.     $this->_generateencryptionkey(); 
  10912. } 
  10913.  
  10914. // END OF ENCRYPTION FUNCTIONS ------------------------- 
  10915.  
  10916. // START TRANSFORMATIONS SECTION ----------------------- 
  10917.  
  10918. /** 
  10919.  * Starts a 2D tranformation saving current graphic state. 
  10920.  * This function must be called before scaling, mirroring, translation, rotation and skewing. 
  10921.  * Use StartTransform() before, and StopTransform() after the transformations to restore the normal behavior. 
  10922.  * @public 
  10923.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  10924.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  10925.  */ 
  10926. public function StartTransform() { 
  10927.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  10928.         return; 
  10929.     } 
  10930.     $this->_outSaveGraphicsState(); 
  10931.     if ($this->inxobj) { 
  10932.         // we are inside an XObject template 
  10933.         $this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['transfmrk'][] = strlen($this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['outdata']); 
  10934.     } else { 
  10935.         $this->transfmrk[$this->page][] = $this->pagelen[$this->page]; 
  10936.     } 
  10937.     ++$this->transfmatrix_key; 
  10938.     $this->transfmatrix[$this->transfmatrix_key] = array(); 
  10939. } 
  10940.  
  10941. /** 
  10942.  * Stops a 2D tranformation restoring previous graphic state. 
  10943.  * This function must be called after scaling, mirroring, translation, rotation and skewing. 
  10944.  * Use StartTransform() before, and StopTransform() after the transformations to restore the normal behavior. 
  10945.  * @public 
  10946.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  10947.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  10948.  */ 
  10949. public function StopTransform() { 
  10950.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  10951.         return; 
  10952.     } 
  10953.     $this->_outRestoreGraphicsState(); 
  10954.     if (isset($this->transfmatrix[$this->transfmatrix_key])) { 
  10955.         array_pop($this->transfmatrix[$this->transfmatrix_key]); 
  10956.         --$this->transfmatrix_key; 
  10957.     } 
  10958.     if ($this->inxobj) { 
  10959.         // we are inside an XObject template 
  10960.         array_pop($this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['transfmrk']); 
  10961.     } else { 
  10962.         array_pop($this->transfmrk[$this->page]); 
  10963.     } 
  10964. } 
  10965. /** 
  10966.  * Horizontal Scaling. 
  10967.  * @param $s_x (float) scaling factor for width as percent. 0 is not allowed. 
  10968.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the scaling center. Default is current x position 
  10969.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the scaling center. Default is current y position 
  10970.  * @public 
  10971.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  10972.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  10973.  */ 
  10974. public function ScaleX($s_x, $x='', $y='') { 
  10975.     $this->Scale($s_x, 100, $x, $y); 
  10976. } 
  10977.  
  10978. /** 
  10979.  * Vertical Scaling. 
  10980.  * @param $s_y (float) scaling factor for height as percent. 0 is not allowed. 
  10981.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the scaling center. Default is current x position 
  10982.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the scaling center. Default is current y position 
  10983.  * @public 
  10984.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  10985.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  10986.  */ 
  10987. public function ScaleY($s_y, $x='', $y='') { 
  10988.     $this->Scale(100, $s_y, $x, $y); 
  10989. } 
  10990.  
  10991. /** 
  10992.  * Vertical and horizontal proportional Scaling. 
  10993.  * @param $s (float) scaling factor for width and height as percent. 0 is not allowed. 
  10994.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the scaling center. Default is current x position 
  10995.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the scaling center. Default is current y position 
  10996.  * @public 
  10997.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  10998.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  10999.  */ 
  11000. public function ScaleXY($s, $x='', $y='') { 
  11001.     $this->Scale($s, $s, $x, $y); 
  11002. } 
  11003.  
  11004. /** 
  11005.  * Vertical and horizontal non-proportional Scaling. 
  11006.  * @param $s_x (float) scaling factor for width as percent. 0 is not allowed. 
  11007.  * @param $s_y (float) scaling factor for height as percent. 0 is not allowed. 
  11008.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the scaling center. Default is current x position 
  11009.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the scaling center. Default is current y position 
  11010.  * @public 
  11011.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11012.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11013.  */ 
  11014. public function Scale($s_x, $s_y, $x='', $y='') { 
  11015.     if ($x === '') { 
  11016.         $x = $this->x; 
  11017.     } 
  11018.     if ($y === '') { 
  11019.         $y = $this->y; 
  11020.     } 
  11021.     if (($s_x == 0) OR ($s_y == 0)) { 
  11022.         $this->Error('Please do not use values equal to zero for scaling'); 
  11023.     } 
  11024.     $y = ($this->h - $y) * $this->k; 
  11025.     $x *= $this->k; 
  11026.     //calculate elements of transformation matrix 
  11027.     $s_x /= 100; 
  11028.     $s_y /= 100; 
  11029.     $tm = array(); 
  11030.     $tm[0] = $s_x; 
  11031.     $tm[1] = 0; 
  11032.     $tm[2] = 0; 
  11033.     $tm[3] = $s_y; 
  11034.     $tm[4] = $x * (1 - $s_x); 
  11035.     $tm[5] = $y * (1 - $s_y); 
  11036.     //scale the coordinate system 
  11037.     $this->Transform($tm); 
  11038. } 
  11039.  
  11040. /** 
  11041.  * Horizontal Mirroring. 
  11042.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the point. Default is current x position 
  11043.  * @public 
  11044.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11045.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11046.  */ 
  11047. public function MirrorH($x='') { 
  11048.     $this->Scale(-100, 100, $x); 
  11049. } 
  11050.  
  11051. /** 
  11052.  * Verical Mirroring. 
  11053.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the point. Default is current y position 
  11054.  * @public 
  11055.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11056.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11057.  */ 
  11058. public function MirrorV($y='') { 
  11059.     $this->Scale(100, -100, '', $y); 
  11060. } 
  11061.  
  11062. /** 
  11063.  * Point reflection mirroring. 
  11064.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the point. Default is current x position 
  11065.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the point. Default is current y position 
  11066.  * @public 
  11067.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11068.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11069.  */ 
  11070. public function MirrorP($x='', $y='') { 
  11071.     $this->Scale(-100, -100, $x, $y); 
  11072. } 
  11073.  
  11074. /** 
  11075.  * Reflection against a straight line through point (x, y) with the gradient angle (angle). 
  11076.  * @param $angle (float) gradient angle of the straight line. Default is 0 (horizontal line). 
  11077.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the point. Default is current x position 
  11078.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the point. Default is current y position 
  11079.  * @public 
  11080.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11081.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11082.  */ 
  11083. public function MirrorL($angle=0, $x='', $y='') { 
  11084.     $this->Scale(-100, 100, $x, $y); 
  11085.     $this->Rotate(-2*($angle-90), $x, $y); 
  11086. } 
  11087.  
  11088. /** 
  11089.  * Translate graphic object horizontally. 
  11090.  * @param $t_x (int) movement to the right (or left for RTL) 
  11091.  * @public 
  11092.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11093.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11094.  */ 
  11095. public function TranslateX($t_x) { 
  11096.     $this->Translate($t_x, 0); 
  11097. } 
  11098.  
  11099. /** 
  11100.  * Translate graphic object vertically. 
  11101.  * @param $t_y (int) movement to the bottom 
  11102.  * @public 
  11103.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11104.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11105.  */ 
  11106. public function TranslateY($t_y) { 
  11107.     $this->Translate(0, $t_y); 
  11108. } 
  11109.  
  11110. /** 
  11111.  * Translate graphic object horizontally and vertically. 
  11112.  * @param $t_x (int) movement to the right 
  11113.  * @param $t_y (int) movement to the bottom 
  11114.  * @public 
  11115.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11116.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11117.  */ 
  11118. public function Translate($t_x, $t_y) { 
  11119.     //calculate elements of transformation matrix 
  11120.     $tm = array(); 
  11121.     $tm[0] = 1; 
  11122.     $tm[1] = 0; 
  11123.     $tm[2] = 0; 
  11124.     $tm[3] = 1; 
  11125.     $tm[4] = $t_x * $this->k; 
  11126.     $tm[5] = -$t_y * $this->k; 
  11127.     //translate the coordinate system 
  11128.     $this->Transform($tm); 
  11129. } 
  11130.  
  11131. /** 
  11132.  * Rotate object. 
  11133.  * @param $angle (float) angle in degrees for counter-clockwise rotation 
  11134.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the rotation center. Default is current x position 
  11135.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the rotation center. Default is current y position 
  11136.  * @public 
  11137.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11138.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11139.  */ 
  11140. public function Rotate($angle, $x='', $y='') { 
  11141.     if ($x === '') { 
  11142.         $x = $this->x; 
  11143.     } 
  11144.     if ($y === '') { 
  11145.         $y = $this->y; 
  11146.     } 
  11147.     $y = ($this->h - $y) * $this->k; 
  11148.     $x *= $this->k; 
  11149.     //calculate elements of transformation matrix 
  11150.     $tm = array(); 
  11151.     $tm[0] = cos(deg2rad($angle)); 
  11152.     $tm[1] = sin(deg2rad($angle)); 
  11153.     $tm[2] = -$tm[1]; 
  11154.     $tm[3] = $tm[0]; 
  11155.     $tm[4] = $x + ($tm[1] * $y) - ($tm[0] * $x); 
  11156.     $tm[5] = $y - ($tm[0] * $y) - ($tm[1] * $x); 
  11157.     //rotate the coordinate system around ($x, $y) 
  11158.     $this->Transform($tm); 
  11159. } 
  11160.  
  11161. /** 
  11162.  * Skew horizontally. 
  11163.  * @param $angle_x (float) angle in degrees between -90 (skew to the left) and 90 (skew to the right) 
  11164.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the skewing center. default is current x position 
  11165.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the skewing center. default is current y position 
  11166.  * @public 
  11167.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11168.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11169.  */ 
  11170. public function SkewX($angle_x, $x='', $y='') { 
  11171.     $this->Skew($angle_x, 0, $x, $y); 
  11172. } 
  11173.  
  11174. /** 
  11175.  * Skew vertically. 
  11176.  * @param $angle_y (float) angle in degrees between -90 (skew to the bottom) and 90 (skew to the top) 
  11177.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the skewing center. default is current x position 
  11178.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the skewing center. default is current y position 
  11179.  * @public 
  11180.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11181.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11182.  */ 
  11183. public function SkewY($angle_y, $x='', $y='') { 
  11184.     $this->Skew(0, $angle_y, $x, $y); 
  11185. } 
  11186.  
  11187. /** 
  11188.  * Skew. 
  11189.  * @param $angle_x (float) angle in degrees between -90 (skew to the left) and 90 (skew to the right) 
  11190.  * @param $angle_y (float) angle in degrees between -90 (skew to the bottom) and 90 (skew to the top) 
  11191.  * @param $x (int) abscissa of the skewing center. default is current x position 
  11192.  * @param $y (int) ordinate of the skewing center. default is current y position 
  11193.  * @public 
  11194.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11195.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11196.  */ 
  11197. public function Skew($angle_x, $angle_y, $x='', $y='') { 
  11198.     if ($x === '') { 
  11199.         $x = $this->x; 
  11200.     } 
  11201.     if ($y === '') { 
  11202.         $y = $this->y; 
  11203.     } 
  11204.     if (($angle_x <= -90) OR ($angle_x >= 90) OR ($angle_y <= -90) OR ($angle_y >= 90)) { 
  11205.         $this->Error('Please use values between -90 and +90 degrees for Skewing.'); 
  11206.     } 
  11207.     $x *= $this->k; 
  11208.     $y = ($this->h - $y) * $this->k; 
  11209.     //calculate elements of transformation matrix 
  11210.     $tm = array(); 
  11211.     $tm[0] = 1; 
  11212.     $tm[1] = tan(deg2rad($angle_y)); 
  11213.     $tm[2] = tan(deg2rad($angle_x)); 
  11214.     $tm[3] = 1; 
  11215.     $tm[4] = -$tm[2] * $y; 
  11216.     $tm[5] = -$tm[1] * $x; 
  11217.     //skew the coordinate system 
  11218.     $this->Transform($tm); 
  11219. } 
  11220.  
  11221. /** 
  11222.  * Apply graphic transformations. 
  11223.  * @param $tm (array) transformation matrix 
  11224.  * @protected 
  11225.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11226.  * @see StartTransform(), StopTransform() 
  11227.  */ 
  11228. protected function Transform($tm) { 
  11229.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  11230.         return; 
  11231.     } 
  11232.     $this->_out(sprintf('%F %F %F %F %F %F cm', $tm[0], $tm[1], $tm[2], $tm[3], $tm[4], $tm[5])); 
  11233.     // add tranformation matrix 
  11234.     $this->transfmatrix[$this->transfmatrix_key][] = array('a' => $tm[0], 'b' => $tm[1], 'c' => $tm[2], 'd' => $tm[3], 'e' => $tm[4], 'f' => $tm[5]); 
  11235.     // update transformation mark 
  11236.     if ($this->inxobj) { 
  11237.         // we are inside an XObject template 
  11238.         if (end($this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['transfmrk']) !== false) { 
  11239.             $key = key($this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['transfmrk']); 
  11240.             $this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['transfmrk'][$key] = strlen($this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['outdata']); 
  11241.         } 
  11242.     } elseif (end($this->transfmrk[$this->page]) !== false) { 
  11243.         $key = key($this->transfmrk[$this->page]); 
  11244.         $this->transfmrk[$this->page][$key] = $this->pagelen[$this->page]; 
  11245.     } 
  11246. } 
  11247.  
  11248. // END TRANSFORMATIONS SECTION ------------------------- 
  11249.  
  11250. // START GRAPHIC FUNCTIONS SECTION --------------------- 
  11251. // The following section is based on the code provided by David Hernandez Sanz 
  11252.  
  11253. /** 
  11254.  * Defines the line width. By default, the value equals 0.2 mm. The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  11255.  * @param $width (float) The width. 
  11256.  * @public 
  11257.  * @since 1.0 
  11258.  * @see Line(), Rect(), Cell(), MultiCell() 
  11259.  */ 
  11260. public function SetLineWidth($width) { 
  11261.     //Set line width 
  11262.     $this->LineWidth = $width; 
  11263.     $this->linestyleWidth = sprintf('%F w', ($width * $this->k)); 
  11264.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  11265.         $this->_out($this->linestyleWidth); 
  11266.     } 
  11267. } 
  11268.  
  11269. /** 
  11270.  * Returns the current the line width. 
  11271.  * @return int Line width 
  11272.  * @public 
  11273.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  11274.  * @see Line(), SetLineWidth() 
  11275.  */ 
  11276. public function GetLineWidth() { 
  11277.     return $this->LineWidth; 
  11278. } 
  11279.  
  11280. /** 
  11281.  * Set line style. 
  11282.  * @param $style (array) Line style. Array with keys among the following: 
  11283.  * <ul> 
  11284.  *     <li>width (float): Width of the line in user units.</li> 
  11285.  *     <li>cap (string): Type of cap to put on the line. Possible values are: 
  11286.  * butt, round, square. The difference between "square" and "butt" is that 
  11287.  * "square" projects a flat end past the end of the line.</li> 
  11288.  *     <li>join (string): Type of join. Possible values are: miter, round,  
  11289.  * bevel.</li> 
  11290.  *     <li>dash (mixed): Dash pattern. Is 0 (without dash) or string with 
  11291.  * series of length values, which are the lengths of the on and off dashes. 
  11292.  * For example: "2" represents 2 on, 2 off, 2 on, 2 off, ...; "2, 1" is 2 on,  
  11293.  * 1 off, 2 on, 1 off, ...</li> 
  11294.  *     <li>phase (integer): Modifier on the dash pattern which is used to shift 
  11295.  * the point at which the pattern starts.</li> 
  11296.  *     <li>color (array): Draw color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName).</li> 
  11297.  * </ul> 
  11298.  * @param $ret (boolean) if true do not send the command. 
  11299.  * @return string the PDF command 
  11300.  * @public 
  11301.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11302.  */ 
  11303. public function SetLineStyle($style, $ret=false) { 
  11304.     $s = ''; // string to be returned 
  11305.     if (!is_array($style)) { 
  11306.         return; 
  11307.     } 
  11308.     if (isset($style['width'])) { 
  11309.         $this->LineWidth = $style['width']; 
  11310.         $this->linestyleWidth = sprintf('%F w', ($style['width'] * $this->k)); 
  11311.         $s .= $this->linestyleWidth.' '; 
  11312.     } 
  11313.     if (isset($style['cap'])) { 
  11314.         $ca = array('butt' => 0, 'round'=> 1, 'square' => 2); 
  11315.         if (isset($ca[$style['cap']])) { 
  11316.             $this->linestyleCap = $ca[$style['cap']].' J'; 
  11317.             $s .= $this->linestyleCap.' '; 
  11318.         } 
  11319.     } 
  11320.     if (isset($style['join'])) { 
  11321.         $ja = array('miter' => 0, 'round' => 1, 'bevel' => 2); 
  11322.         if (isset($ja[$style['join']])) { 
  11323.             $this->linestyleJoin = $ja[$style['join']].' j'; 
  11324.             $s .= $this->linestyleJoin.' '; 
  11325.         } 
  11326.     } 
  11327.     if (isset($style['dash'])) { 
  11328.         $dash_string = ''; 
  11329.         if ($style['dash']) { 
  11330.             if (preg_match('/^.+, /', $style['dash']) > 0) { 
  11331.                 $tab = explode(', ', $style['dash']); 
  11332.             } else { 
  11333.                 $tab = array($style['dash']); 
  11334.             } 
  11335.             $dash_string = ''; 
  11336.             foreach ($tab as $i => $v) { 
  11337.                 if ($i) { 
  11338.                     $dash_string .= ' '; 
  11339.                 } 
  11340.                 $dash_string .= sprintf('%F', $v); 
  11341.             } 
  11342.         } 
  11343.         if (!isset($style['phase']) OR !$style['dash']) { 
  11344.             $style['phase'] = 0; 
  11345.         } 
  11346.         $this->linestyleDash = sprintf('[%s] %F d', $dash_string, $style['phase']); 
  11347.         $s .= $this->linestyleDash.' '; 
  11348.     } 
  11349.     if (isset($style['color'])) { 
  11350.         $s .= $this->SetDrawColorArray($style['color'], true).' '; 
  11351.     } 
  11352.     if (!$ret AND ($this->state == 2)) { 
  11353.         $this->_out($s); 
  11354.     } 
  11355.     return $s; 
  11356. } 
  11357.  
  11358. /** 
  11359.  * Begin a new subpath by moving the current point to coordinates (x, y), omitting any connecting line segment. 
  11360.  * @param $x (float) Abscissa of point. 
  11361.  * @param $y (float) Ordinate of point. 
  11362.  * @protected 
  11363.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11364.  */ 
  11365. protected function _outPoint($x, $y) { 
  11366.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  11367.         $this->_out(sprintf('%F %F m', ($x * $this->k), (($this->h - $y) * $this->k))); 
  11368.     } 
  11369. } 
  11370.  
  11371. /** 
  11372.  * Append a straight line segment from the current point to the point (x, y). 
  11373.  * The new current point shall be (x, y). 
  11374.  * @param $x (float) Abscissa of end point. 
  11375.  * @param $y (float) Ordinate of end point. 
  11376.  * @protected 
  11377.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11378.  */ 
  11379. protected function _outLine($x, $y) { 
  11380.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  11381.         $this->_out(sprintf('%F %F l', ($x * $this->k), (($this->h - $y) * $this->k))); 
  11382.     } 
  11383. } 
  11384.  
  11385. /** 
  11386.  * Append a rectangle to the current path as a complete subpath, with lower-left corner (x, y) and dimensions widthand height in user space. 
  11387.  * @param $x (float) Abscissa of upper-left corner. 
  11388.  * @param $y (float) Ordinate of upper-left corner. 
  11389.  * @param $w (float) Width. 
  11390.  * @param $h (float) Height. 
  11391.  * @param $op (string) options 
  11392.  * @protected 
  11393.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11394.  */ 
  11395. protected function _outRect($x, $y, $w, $h, $op) { 
  11396.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  11397.         $this->_out(sprintf('%F %F %F %F re %s', ($x * $this->k), (($this->h - $y) * $this->k), ($w * $this->k), (-$h * $this->k), $op)); 
  11398.     } 
  11399. } 
  11400.  
  11401. /** 
  11402.  * Append a cubic Bezier curve to the current path. The curve shall extend from the current point to the point (x3, y3), using (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) as the Bezier control points. 
  11403.  * The new current point shall be (x3, y3). 
  11404.  * @param $x1 (float) Abscissa of control point 1. 
  11405.  * @param $y1 (float) Ordinate of control point 1. 
  11406.  * @param $x2 (float) Abscissa of control point 2. 
  11407.  * @param $y2 (float) Ordinate of control point 2. 
  11408.  * @param $x3 (float) Abscissa of end point. 
  11409.  * @param $y3 (float) Ordinate of end point. 
  11410.  * @protected 
  11411.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11412.  */ 
  11413. protected function _outCurve($x1, $y1, $x2, $y2, $x3, $y3) { 
  11414.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  11415.         $this->_out(sprintf('%F %F %F %F %F %F c', ($x1 * $this->k), (($this->h - $y1) * $this->k), ($x2 * $this->k), (($this->h - $y2) * $this->k), ($x3 * $this->k), (($this->h - $y3) * $this->k))); 
  11416.     } 
  11417. } 
  11418.  
  11419. /** 
  11420.  * Append a cubic Bezier curve to the current path. The curve shall extend from the current point to the point (x3, y3), using the current point and (x2, y2) as the Bezier control points. 
  11421.  * The new current point shall be (x3, y3). 
  11422.  * @param $x2 (float) Abscissa of control point 2. 
  11423.  * @param $y2 (float) Ordinate of control point 2. 
  11424.  * @param $x3 (float) Abscissa of end point. 
  11425.  * @param $y3 (float) Ordinate of end point. 
  11426.  * @protected 
  11427.  * @since 4.9.019 (2010-04-26) 
  11428.  */ 
  11429. protected function _outCurveV($x2, $y2, $x3, $y3) { 
  11430.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  11431.         $this->_out(sprintf('%F %F %F %F v', ($x2 * $this->k), (($this->h - $y2) * $this->k), ($x3 * $this->k), (($this->h - $y3) * $this->k))); 
  11432.     } 
  11433. } 
  11434.  
  11435. /** 
  11436.  * Append a cubic Bezier curve to the current path. The curve shall extend from the current point to the point (x3, y3), using (x1, y1) and (x3, y3) as the Bezier control points. 
  11437.  * The new current point shall be (x3, y3). 
  11438.  * @param $x1 (float) Abscissa of control point 1. 
  11439.  * @param $y1 (float) Ordinate of control point 1. 
  11440.  * @param $x3 (float) Abscissa of end point. 
  11441.  * @param $y3 (float) Ordinate of end point. 
  11442.  * @protected 
  11443.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11444.  */ 
  11445. protected function _outCurveY($x1, $y1, $x3, $y3) { 
  11446.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  11447.         $this->_out(sprintf('%F %F %F %F y', ($x1 * $this->k), (($this->h - $y1) * $this->k), ($x3 * $this->k), (($this->h - $y3) * $this->k))); 
  11448.     } 
  11449. } 
  11450.  
  11451. /** 
  11452.  * Draws a line between two points. 
  11453.  * @param $x1 (float) Abscissa of first point. 
  11454.  * @param $y1 (float) Ordinate of first point. 
  11455.  * @param $x2 (float) Abscissa of second point. 
  11456.  * @param $y2 (float) Ordinate of second point. 
  11457.  * @param $style (array) Line style. Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  11458.  * @public 
  11459.  * @since 1.0 
  11460.  * @see SetLineWidth(), SetDrawColor(), SetLineStyle() 
  11461.  */ 
  11462. public function Line($x1, $y1, $x2, $y2, $style=array()) { 
  11463.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  11464.         return; 
  11465.     } 
  11466.     if (is_array($style)) { 
  11467.         $this->SetLineStyle($style); 
  11468.     } 
  11469.     $this->_outPoint($x1, $y1); 
  11470.     $this->_outLine($x2, $y2); 
  11471.     $this->_out('S'); 
  11472. } 
  11473.  
  11474. /** 
  11475.  * Draws a rectangle. 
  11476.  * @param $x (float) Abscissa of upper-left corner. 
  11477.  * @param $y (float) Ordinate of upper-left corner. 
  11478.  * @param $w (float) Width. 
  11479.  * @param $h (float) Height. 
  11480.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11481.  * @param $border_style (array) Border style of rectangle. Array with keys among the following: 
  11482.  * <ul> 
  11483.  *     <li>all: Line style of all borders. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11484.  *     <li>L, T, R, B or combinations: Line style of left, top, right or bottom border. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11485.  * </ul> 
  11486.  * If a key is not present or is null, the correspondent border is not drawn. Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  11487.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11488.  * @public 
  11489.  * @since 1.0 
  11490.  * @see SetLineStyle() 
  11491.  */ 
  11492. public function Rect($x, $y, $w, $h, $style='', $border_style=array(), $fill_color=array()) { 
  11493.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  11494.         return; 
  11495.     } 
  11496.     if (empty($style)) { 
  11497.         $style = 'S'; 
  11498.     } 
  11499.     if (!(strpos($style, 'F') === false) AND !empty($fill_color)) { 
  11500.         // set background color 
  11501.         $this->SetFillColorArray($fill_color); 
  11502.     } 
  11503.     if (!empty($border_style)) { 
  11504.         if (isset($border_style['all']) AND !empty($border_style['all'])) { 
  11505.             //set global style for border 
  11506.             $this->SetLineStyle($border_style['all']); 
  11507.             $border_style = array(); 
  11508.         } else { 
  11509.             // remove stroke operator from style 
  11510.             $opnostroke = array('S' => '', 'D' => '', 's' => '', 'd' => '', 'B' => 'F', 'FD' => 'F', 'DF' => 'F', 'B*' => 'F*', 'F*D' => 'F*', 'DF*' => 'F*', 'b' => 'f', 'fd' => 'f', 'df' => 'f', 'b*' => 'f*', 'f*d' => 'f*', 'df*' => 'f*' ); 
  11511.             if (isset($opnostroke[$style])) { 
  11512.                 $style = $opnostroke[$style]; 
  11513.             } 
  11514.         } 
  11515.     } 
  11516.     if (!empty($style)) { 
  11517.         $op = TCPDF_STATIC::getPathPaintOperator($style); 
  11518.         $this->_outRect($x, $y, $w, $h, $op); 
  11519.     } 
  11520.     if (!empty($border_style)) { 
  11521.         $border_style2 = array(); 
  11522.         foreach ($border_style as $line => $value) { 
  11523.             $length = strlen($line); 
  11524.             for ($i = 0; $i < $length; ++$i) { 
  11525.                 $border_style2[$line[$i]] = $value; 
  11526.             } 
  11527.         } 
  11528.         $border_style = $border_style2; 
  11529.         if (isset($border_style['L']) AND $border_style['L']) { 
  11530.             $this->Line($x, $y, $x, $y + $h, $border_style['L']); 
  11531.         } 
  11532.         if (isset($border_style['T']) AND $border_style['T']) { 
  11533.             $this->Line($x, $y, $x + $w, $y, $border_style['T']); 
  11534.         } 
  11535.         if (isset($border_style['R']) AND $border_style['R']) { 
  11536.             $this->Line($x + $w, $y, $x + $w, $y + $h, $border_style['R']); 
  11537.         } 
  11538.         if (isset($border_style['B']) AND $border_style['B']) { 
  11539.             $this->Line($x, $y + $h, $x + $w, $y + $h, $border_style['B']); 
  11540.         } 
  11541.     } 
  11542. } 
  11543.  
  11544. /** 
  11545.  * Draws a Bezier curve. 
  11546.  * The Bezier curve is a tangent to the line between the control points at 
  11547.  * either end of the curve. 
  11548.  * @param $x0 (float) Abscissa of start point. 
  11549.  * @param $y0 (float) Ordinate of start point. 
  11550.  * @param $x1 (float) Abscissa of control point 1. 
  11551.  * @param $y1 (float) Ordinate of control point 1. 
  11552.  * @param $x2 (float) Abscissa of control point 2. 
  11553.  * @param $y2 (float) Ordinate of control point 2. 
  11554.  * @param $x3 (float) Abscissa of end point. 
  11555.  * @param $y3 (float) Ordinate of end point. 
  11556.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11557.  * @param $line_style (array) Line style of curve. Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  11558.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11559.  * @public 
  11560.  * @see SetLineStyle() 
  11561.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11562.  */ 
  11563. public function Curve($x0, $y0, $x1, $y1, $x2, $y2, $x3, $y3, $style='', $line_style=array(), $fill_color=array()) { 
  11564.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  11565.         return; 
  11566.     } 
  11567.     if (!(false === strpos($style, 'F')) AND isset($fill_color)) { 
  11568.         $this->SetFillColorArray($fill_color); 
  11569.     } 
  11570.     $op = TCPDF_STATIC::getPathPaintOperator($style); 
  11571.     if ($line_style) { 
  11572.         $this->SetLineStyle($line_style); 
  11573.     } 
  11574.     $this->_outPoint($x0, $y0); 
  11575.     $this->_outCurve($x1, $y1, $x2, $y2, $x3, $y3); 
  11576.     $this->_out($op); 
  11577. } 
  11578.  
  11579. /** 
  11580.  * Draws a poly-Bezier curve. 
  11581.  * Each Bezier curve segment is a tangent to the line between the control points at 
  11582.  * either end of the curve. 
  11583.  * @param $x0 (float) Abscissa of start point. 
  11584.  * @param $y0 (float) Ordinate of start point. 
  11585.  * @param $segments (float) An array of bezier descriptions. Format: array(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3). 
  11586.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11587.  * @param $line_style (array) Line style of curve. Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  11588.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11589.  * @public 
  11590.  * @see SetLineStyle() 
  11591.  * @since 3.0008 (2008-05-12) 
  11592.  */ 
  11593. public function Polycurve($x0, $y0, $segments, $style='', $line_style=array(), $fill_color=array()) { 
  11594.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  11595.         return; 
  11596.     } 
  11597.     if (!(false === strpos($style, 'F')) AND isset($fill_color)) { 
  11598.         $this->SetFillColorArray($fill_color); 
  11599.     } 
  11600.     $op = TCPDF_STATIC::getPathPaintOperator($style); 
  11601.     if ($op == 'f') { 
  11602.         $line_style = array(); 
  11603.     } 
  11604.     if ($line_style) { 
  11605.         $this->SetLineStyle($line_style); 
  11606.     } 
  11607.     $this->_outPoint($x0, $y0); 
  11608.     foreach ($segments as $segment) { 
  11609.         list($x1, $y1, $x2, $y2, $x3, $y3) = $segment; 
  11610.         $this->_outCurve($x1, $y1, $x2, $y2, $x3, $y3); 
  11611.     } 
  11612.     $this->_out($op); 
  11613. } 
  11614.  
  11615. /** 
  11616.  * Draws an ellipse. 
  11617.  * An ellipse is formed from n Bezier curves. 
  11618.  * @param $x0 (float) Abscissa of center point. 
  11619.  * @param $y0 (float) Ordinate of center point. 
  11620.  * @param $rx (float) Horizontal radius. 
  11621.  * @param $ry (float) Vertical radius (if ry = 0 then is a circle, see Circle()). Default value: 0. 
  11622.  * @param $angle: (float) Angle oriented (anti-clockwise). Default value: 0. 
  11623.  * @param $astart: (float) Angle start of draw line. Default value: 0. 
  11624.  * @param $afinish: (float) Angle finish of draw line. Default value: 360. 
  11625.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11626.  * @param $line_style (array) Line style of ellipse. Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  11627.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11628.  * @param $nc (integer) Number of curves used to draw a 90 degrees portion of ellipse. 
  11629.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  11630.  * @public 
  11631.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11632.  */ 
  11633. public function Ellipse($x0, $y0, $rx, $ry='', $angle=0, $astart=0, $afinish=360, $style='', $line_style=array(), $fill_color=array(), $nc=2) { 
  11634.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  11635.         return; 
  11636.     } 
  11637.     if (TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($ry) OR ($ry == 0)) { 
  11638.         $ry = $rx; 
  11639.     } 
  11640.     if (!(false === strpos($style, 'F')) AND isset($fill_color)) { 
  11641.         $this->SetFillColorArray($fill_color); 
  11642.     } 
  11643.     $op = TCPDF_STATIC::getPathPaintOperator($style); 
  11644.     if ($op == 'f') { 
  11645.         $line_style = array(); 
  11646.     } 
  11647.     if ($line_style) { 
  11648.         $this->SetLineStyle($line_style); 
  11649.     } 
  11650.     $this->_outellipticalarc($x0, $y0, $rx, $ry, $angle, $astart, $afinish, false, $nc, true, true, false); 
  11651.     $this->_out($op); 
  11652. } 
  11653.  
  11654. /** 
  11655.  * Append an elliptical arc to the current path. 
  11656.  * An ellipse is formed from n Bezier curves. 
  11657.  * @param $xc (float) Abscissa of center point. 
  11658.  * @param $yc (float) Ordinate of center point. 
  11659.  * @param $rx (float) Horizontal radius. 
  11660.  * @param $ry (float) Vertical radius (if ry = 0 then is a circle, see Circle()). Default value: 0. 
  11661.  * @param $xang: (float) Angle between the X-axis and the major axis of the ellipse. Default value: 0. 
  11662.  * @param $angs: (float) Angle start of draw line. Default value: 0. 
  11663.  * @param $angf: (float) Angle finish of draw line. Default value: 360. 
  11664.  * @param $pie (boolean) if true do not mark the border point (used to draw pie sectors). 
  11665.  * @param $nc (integer) Number of curves used to draw a 90 degrees portion of ellipse. 
  11666.  * @param $startpoint (boolean) if true output a starting point. 
  11667.  * @param $ccw (boolean) if true draws in counter-clockwise. 
  11668.  * @param $svg (boolean) if true the angles are in svg mode (already calculated). 
  11669.  * @return array bounding box coordinates (x min, y min, x max, y max) 
  11670.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  11671.  * @protected 
  11672.  * @since 4.9.019 (2010-04-26) 
  11673.  */ 
  11674. protected function _outellipticalarc($xc, $yc, $rx, $ry, $xang=0, $angs=0, $angf=360, $pie=false, $nc=2, $startpoint=true, $ccw=true, $svg=false) { 
  11675.     if (($rx <= 0) OR ($ry < 0)) { 
  11676.         return; 
  11677.     } 
  11678.     $k = $this->k; 
  11679.     if ($nc < 2) { 
  11680.         $nc = 2; 
  11681.     } 
  11682.     $xmin = 2147483647; 
  11683.     $ymin = 2147483647; 
  11684.     $xmax = 0; 
  11685.     $ymax = 0; 
  11686.     if ($pie) { 
  11687.         // center of the arc 
  11688.         $this->_outPoint($xc, $yc); 
  11689.     } 
  11690.     $xang = deg2rad((float) $xang); 
  11691.     $angs = deg2rad((float) $angs); 
  11692.     $angf = deg2rad((float) $angf); 
  11693.     if ($svg) { 
  11694.         $as = $angs; 
  11695.         $af = $angf; 
  11696.     } else { 
  11697.         $as = atan2((sin($angs) / $ry), (cos($angs) / $rx)); 
  11698.         $af = atan2((sin($angf) / $ry), (cos($angf) / $rx)); 
  11699.     } 
  11700.     if ($as < 0) { 
  11701.         $as += (2 * M_PI); 
  11702.     } 
  11703.     if ($af < 0) { 
  11704.         $af += (2 * M_PI); 
  11705.     } 
  11706.     if ($ccw AND ($as > $af)) { 
  11707.         // reverse rotation 
  11708.         $as -= (2 * M_PI); 
  11709.     } elseif (!$ccw AND ($as < $af)) { 
  11710.         // reverse rotation 
  11711.         $af -= (2 * M_PI); 
  11712.     } 
  11713.     $total_angle = ($af - $as); 
  11714.     if ($nc < 2) { 
  11715.         $nc = 2; 
  11716.     } 
  11717.     // total arcs to draw 
  11718.     $nc *= (2 * abs($total_angle) / M_PI); 
  11719.     $nc = round($nc) + 1; 
  11720.     // angle of each arc 
  11721.     $arcang = ($total_angle / $nc); 
  11722.     // center point in PDF coordinates 
  11723.     $x0 = $xc; 
  11724.     $y0 = ($this->h - $yc); 
  11725.     // starting angle 
  11726.     $ang = $as; 
  11727.     $alpha = sin($arcang) * ((sqrt(4 + (3 * pow(tan(($arcang) / 2), 2))) - 1) / 3); 
  11728.     $cos_xang = cos($xang); 
  11729.     $sin_xang = sin($xang); 
  11730.     $cos_ang = cos($ang); 
  11731.     $sin_ang = sin($ang); 
  11732.     // first arc point 
  11733.     $px1 = $x0 + ($rx * $cos_xang * $cos_ang) - ($ry * $sin_xang * $sin_ang); 
  11734.     $py1 = $y0 + ($rx * $sin_xang * $cos_ang) + ($ry * $cos_xang * $sin_ang); 
  11735.     // first Bezier control point 
  11736.     $qx1 = ($alpha * ((-$rx * $cos_xang * $sin_ang) - ($ry * $sin_xang * $cos_ang))); 
  11737.     $qy1 = ($alpha * ((-$rx * $sin_xang * $sin_ang) + ($ry * $cos_xang * $cos_ang))); 
  11738.     if ($pie) { 
  11739.         // line from center to arc starting point 
  11740.         $this->_outLine($px1, $this->h - $py1); 
  11741.     } elseif ($startpoint) { 
  11742.         // arc starting point 
  11743.         $this->_outPoint($px1, $this->h - $py1); 
  11744.     } 
  11745.     // draw arcs 
  11746.     for ($i = 1; $i <= $nc; ++$i) { 
  11747.         // starting angle 
  11748.         $ang = $as + ($i * $arcang); 
  11749.         if ($i == $nc) { 
  11750.             $ang = $af; 
  11751.         } 
  11752.         $cos_ang = cos($ang); 
  11753.         $sin_ang = sin($ang); 
  11754.         // second arc point 
  11755.         $px2 = $x0 + ($rx * $cos_xang * $cos_ang) - ($ry * $sin_xang * $sin_ang); 
  11756.         $py2 = $y0 + ($rx * $sin_xang * $cos_ang) + ($ry * $cos_xang * $sin_ang); 
  11757.         // second Bezier control point 
  11758.         $qx2 = ($alpha * ((-$rx * $cos_xang * $sin_ang) - ($ry * $sin_xang * $cos_ang))); 
  11759.         $qy2 = ($alpha * ((-$rx * $sin_xang * $sin_ang) + ($ry * $cos_xang * $cos_ang))); 
  11760.         // draw arc 
  11761.         $cx1 = ($px1 + $qx1); 
  11762.         $cy1 = ($this->h - ($py1 + $qy1)); 
  11763.         $cx2 = ($px2 - $qx2); 
  11764.         $cy2 = ($this->h - ($py2 - $qy2)); 
  11765.         $cx3 = $px2; 
  11766.         $cy3 = ($this->h - $py2); 
  11767.         $this->_outCurve($cx1, $cy1, $cx2, $cy2, $cx3, $cy3); 
  11768.         // get bounding box coordinates 
  11769.         $xmin = min($xmin, $cx1, $cx2, $cx3); 
  11770.         $ymin = min($ymin, $cy1, $cy2, $cy3); 
  11771.         $xmax = max($xmax, $cx1, $cx2, $cx3); 
  11772.         $ymax = max($ymax, $cy1, $cy2, $cy3); 
  11773.         // move to next point 
  11774.         $px1 = $px2; 
  11775.         $py1 = $py2; 
  11776.         $qx1 = $qx2; 
  11777.         $qy1 = $qy2; 
  11778.     } 
  11779.     if ($pie) { 
  11780.         $this->_outLine($xc, $yc); 
  11781.         // get bounding box coordinates 
  11782.         $xmin = min($xmin, $xc); 
  11783.         $ymin = min($ymin, $yc); 
  11784.         $xmax = max($xmax, $xc); 
  11785.         $ymax = max($ymax, $yc); 
  11786.     } 
  11787.     return array($xmin, $ymin, $xmax, $ymax); 
  11788. } 
  11789.  
  11790. /** 
  11791.  * Draws a circle. 
  11792.  * A circle is formed from n Bezier curves. 
  11793.  * @param $x0 (float) Abscissa of center point. 
  11794.  * @param $y0 (float) Ordinate of center point. 
  11795.  * @param $r (float) Radius. 
  11796.  * @param $angstr: (float) Angle start of draw line. Default value: 0. 
  11797.  * @param $angend: (float) Angle finish of draw line. Default value: 360. 
  11798.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11799.  * @param $line_style (array) Line style of circle. Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  11800.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(red, green, blue). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11801.  * @param $nc (integer) Number of curves used to draw a 90 degrees portion of circle. 
  11802.  * @public 
  11803.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11804.  */ 
  11805. public function Circle($x0, $y0, $r, $angstr=0, $angend=360, $style='', $line_style=array(), $fill_color=array(), $nc=2) { 
  11806.     $this->Ellipse($x0, $y0, $r, $r, 0, $angstr, $angend, $style, $line_style, $fill_color, $nc); 
  11807. } 
  11808.  
  11809. /** 
  11810.  * Draws a polygonal line 
  11811.  * @param $p (array) Points 0 to ($np - 1). Array with values (x0, y0, x1, y1, ..., x(np-1), y(np - 1)) 
  11812.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11813.  * @param $line_style (array) Line style of polygon. Array with keys among the following: 
  11814.  * <ul> 
  11815.  *     <li>all: Line style of all lines. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11816.  *     <li>0 to ($np - 1): Line style of each line. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11817.  * </ul> 
  11818.  * If a key is not present or is null, not draws the line. Default value is default line style (empty array). 
  11819.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11820.  * @since 4.8.003 (2009-09-15) 
  11821.  * @public 
  11822.  */ 
  11823. public function PolyLine($p, $style='', $line_style=array(), $fill_color=array()) { 
  11824.     $this->Polygon($p, $style, $line_style, $fill_color, false); 
  11825. } 
  11826.  
  11827. /** 
  11828.  * Draws a polygon. 
  11829.  * @param $p (array) Points 0 to ($np - 1). Array with values (x0, y0, x1, y1, ..., x(np-1), y(np - 1)) 
  11830.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11831.  * @param $line_style (array) Line style of polygon. Array with keys among the following: 
  11832.  * <ul> 
  11833.  *     <li>all: Line style of all lines. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11834.  *     <li>0 to ($np - 1): Line style of each line. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11835.  * </ul> 
  11836.  * If a key is not present or is null, not draws the line. Default value is default line style (empty array). 
  11837.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11838.  * @param $closed (boolean) if true the polygon is closes, otherwise will remain open 
  11839.  * @public 
  11840.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11841.  */ 
  11842. public function Polygon($p, $style='', $line_style=array(), $fill_color=array(), $closed=true) { 
  11843.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  11844.         return; 
  11845.     } 
  11846.     $nc = count($p); // number of coordinates 
  11847.     $np = $nc / 2; // number of points 
  11848.     if ($closed) { 
  11849.         // close polygon by adding the first 2 points at the end (one line) 
  11850.         for ($i = 0; $i < 4; ++$i) { 
  11851.             $p[$nc + $i] = $p[$i]; 
  11852.         } 
  11853.         // copy style for the last added line 
  11854.         if (isset($line_style[0])) { 
  11855.             $line_style[$np] = $line_style[0]; 
  11856.         } 
  11857.         $nc += 4; 
  11858.     } 
  11859.     if (!(false === strpos($style, 'F')) AND isset($fill_color)) { 
  11860.         $this->SetFillColorArray($fill_color); 
  11861.     } 
  11862.     $op = TCPDF_STATIC::getPathPaintOperator($style); 
  11863.     if ($op == 'f') { 
  11864.         $line_style = array(); 
  11865.     } 
  11866.     $draw = true; 
  11867.     if ($line_style) { 
  11868.         if (isset($line_style['all'])) { 
  11869.             $this->SetLineStyle($line_style['all']); 
  11870.         } else { 
  11871.             $draw = false; 
  11872.             if ($op == 'B') { 
  11873.                 // draw fill 
  11874.                 $op = 'f'; 
  11875.                 $this->_outPoint($p[0], $p[1]); 
  11876.                 for ($i = 2; $i < $nc; $i = $i + 2) { 
  11877.                     $this->_outLine($p[$i], $p[$i + 1]); 
  11878.                 } 
  11879.                 $this->_out($op); 
  11880.             } 
  11881.             // draw outline 
  11882.             $this->_outPoint($p[0], $p[1]); 
  11883.             for ($i = 2; $i < $nc; $i = $i + 2) { 
  11884.                 $line_num = ($i / 2) - 1; 
  11885.                 if (isset($line_style[$line_num])) { 
  11886.                     if ($line_style[$line_num] != 0) { 
  11887.                         if (is_array($line_style[$line_num])) { 
  11888.                             $this->_out('S'); 
  11889.                             $this->SetLineStyle($line_style[$line_num]); 
  11890.                             $this->_outPoint($p[$i - 2], $p[$i - 1]); 
  11891.                             $this->_outLine($p[$i], $p[$i + 1]); 
  11892.                             $this->_out('S'); 
  11893.                             $this->_outPoint($p[$i], $p[$i + 1]); 
  11894.                         } else { 
  11895.                             $this->_outLine($p[$i], $p[$i + 1]); 
  11896.                         } 
  11897.                     } 
  11898.                 } else { 
  11899.                     $this->_outLine($p[$i], $p[$i + 1]); 
  11900.                 } 
  11901.             } 
  11902.             $this->_out($op); 
  11903.         } 
  11904.     } 
  11905.     if ($draw) { 
  11906.         $this->_outPoint($p[0], $p[1]); 
  11907.         for ($i = 2; $i < $nc; $i = $i + 2) { 
  11908.             $this->_outLine($p[$i], $p[$i + 1]); 
  11909.         } 
  11910.         $this->_out($op); 
  11911.     } 
  11912. } 
  11913.  
  11914. /** 
  11915.  * Draws a regular polygon. 
  11916.  * @param $x0 (float) Abscissa of center point. 
  11917.  * @param $y0 (float) Ordinate of center point. 
  11918.  * @param $r: (float) Radius of inscribed circle. 
  11919.  * @param $ns (integer) Number of sides. 
  11920.  * @param $angle (float) Angle oriented (anti-clockwise). Default value: 0. 
  11921.  * @param $draw_circle (boolean) Draw inscribed circle or not. Default value: false. 
  11922.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11923.  * @param $line_style (array) Line style of polygon sides. Array with keys among the following: 
  11924.  * <ul> 
  11925.  *     <li>all: Line style of all sides. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11926.  *     <li>0 to ($ns - 1): Line style of each side. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11927.  * </ul> 
  11928.  * If a key is not present or is null, not draws the side. Default value is default line style (empty array). 
  11929.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(red, green, blue). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11930.  * @param $circle_style (string) Style of rendering of inscribed circle (if draws). Possible values are: 
  11931.  * <ul> 
  11932.  *     <li>D or empty string: Draw (default).</li> 
  11933.  *     <li>F: Fill.</li> 
  11934.  *     <li>DF or FD: Draw and fill.</li> 
  11935.  *     <li>CNZ: Clipping mode (using the even-odd rule to determine which regions lie inside the clipping path).</li> 
  11936.  *     <li>CEO: Clipping mode (using the nonzero winding number rule to determine which regions lie inside the clipping path).</li> 
  11937.  * </ul> 
  11938.  * @param $circle_outLine_style (array) Line style of inscribed circle (if draws). Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  11939.  * @param $circle_fill_color (array) Fill color of inscribed circle (if draws). Format: array(red, green, blue). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11940.  * @public 
  11941.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11942.  */ 
  11943. public function RegularPolygon($x0, $y0, $r, $ns, $angle=0, $draw_circle=false, $style='', $line_style=array(), $fill_color=array(), $circle_style='', $circle_outLine_style=array(), $circle_fill_color=array()) { 
  11944.     if (3 > $ns) { 
  11945.         $ns = 3; 
  11946.     } 
  11947.     if ($draw_circle) { 
  11948.         $this->Circle($x0, $y0, $r, 0, 360, $circle_style, $circle_outLine_style, $circle_fill_color); 
  11949.     } 
  11950.     $p = array(); 
  11951.     for ($i = 0; $i < $ns; ++$i) { 
  11952.         $a = $angle + ($i * 360 / $ns); 
  11953.         $a_rad = deg2rad((float) $a); 
  11954.         $p[] = $x0 + ($r * sin($a_rad)); 
  11955.         $p[] = $y0 + ($r * cos($a_rad)); 
  11956.     } 
  11957.     $this->Polygon($p, $style, $line_style, $fill_color); 
  11958. } 
  11959.  
  11960. /** 
  11961.  * Draws a star polygon 
  11962.  * @param $x0 (float) Abscissa of center point. 
  11963.  * @param $y0 (float) Ordinate of center point. 
  11964.  * @param $r (float) Radius of inscribed circle. 
  11965.  * @param $nv (integer) Number of vertices. 
  11966.  * @param $ng (integer) Number of gap (if ($ng % $nv = 1) then is a regular polygon). 
  11967.  * @param $angle: (float) Angle oriented (anti-clockwise). Default value: 0. 
  11968.  * @param $draw_circle: (boolean) Draw inscribed circle or not. Default value is false. 
  11969.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  11970.  * @param $line_style (array) Line style of polygon sides. Array with keys among the following: 
  11971.  * <ul> 
  11972.  *     <li>all: Line style of all sides. Array like for 
  11973.  * SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11974.  *     <li>0 to (n - 1): Line style of each side. Array like for SetLineStyle().</li> 
  11975.  * </ul> 
  11976.  * If a key is not present or is null, not draws the side. Default value is default line style (empty array). 
  11977.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(red, green, blue). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11978.  * @param $circle_style (string) Style of rendering of inscribed circle (if draws). Possible values are: 
  11979.  * <ul> 
  11980.  *     <li>D or empty string: Draw (default).</li> 
  11981.  *     <li>F: Fill.</li> 
  11982.  *     <li>DF or FD: Draw and fill.</li> 
  11983.  *     <li>CNZ: Clipping mode (using the even-odd rule to determine which regions lie inside the clipping path).</li> 
  11984.  *     <li>CEO: Clipping mode (using the nonzero winding number rule to determine which regions lie inside the clipping path).</li> 
  11985.  * </ul> 
  11986.  * @param $circle_outLine_style (array) Line style of inscribed circle (if draws). Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  11987.  * @param $circle_fill_color (array) Fill color of inscribed circle (if draws). Format: array(red, green, blue). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  11988.  * @public 
  11989.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  11990.  */ 
  11991. public function StarPolygon($x0, $y0, $r, $nv, $ng, $angle=0, $draw_circle=false, $style='', $line_style=array(), $fill_color=array(), $circle_style='', $circle_outLine_style=array(), $circle_fill_color=array()) { 
  11992.     if ($nv < 2) { 
  11993.         $nv = 2; 
  11994.     } 
  11995.     if ($draw_circle) { 
  11996.         $this->Circle($x0, $y0, $r, 0, 360, $circle_style, $circle_outLine_style, $circle_fill_color); 
  11997.     } 
  11998.     $p2 = array(); 
  11999.     $visited = array(); 
  12000.     for ($i = 0; $i < $nv; ++$i) { 
  12001.         $a = $angle + ($i * 360 / $nv); 
  12002.         $a_rad = deg2rad((float) $a); 
  12003.         $p2[] = $x0 + ($r * sin($a_rad)); 
  12004.         $p2[] = $y0 + ($r * cos($a_rad)); 
  12005.         $visited[] = false; 
  12006.     } 
  12007.     $p = array(); 
  12008.     $i = 0; 
  12009.     do { 
  12010.         $p[] = $p2[$i * 2]; 
  12011.         $p[] = $p2[($i * 2) + 1]; 
  12012.         $visited[$i] = true; 
  12013.         $i += $ng; 
  12014.         $i %= $nv; 
  12015.     } while (!$visited[$i]); 
  12016.     $this->Polygon($p, $style, $line_style, $fill_color); 
  12017. } 
  12018.  
  12019. /** 
  12020.  * Draws a rounded rectangle. 
  12021.  * @param $x (float) Abscissa of upper-left corner. 
  12022.  * @param $y (float) Ordinate of upper-left corner. 
  12023.  * @param $w (float) Width. 
  12024.  * @param $h (float) Height. 
  12025.  * @param $r (float) the radius of the circle used to round off the corners of the rectangle. 
  12026.  * @param $round_corner (string) Draws rounded corner or not. String with a 0 (not rounded i-corner) or 1 (rounded i-corner) in i-position. Positions are, in order and begin to 0: top right, bottom right, bottom left and top left. Default value: all rounded corner ("1111"). 
  12027.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  12028.  * @param $border_style (array) Border style of rectangle. Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  12029.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  12030.  * @public 
  12031.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-08) 
  12032.  */ 
  12033. public function RoundedRect($x, $y, $w, $h, $r, $round_corner='1111', $style='', $border_style=array(), $fill_color=array()) { 
  12034.     $this->RoundedRectXY($x, $y, $w, $h, $r, $r, $round_corner, $style, $border_style, $fill_color); 
  12035. } 
  12036.  
  12037. /** 
  12038.  * Draws a rounded rectangle. 
  12039.  * @param $x (float) Abscissa of upper-left corner. 
  12040.  * @param $y (float) Ordinate of upper-left corner. 
  12041.  * @param $w (float) Width. 
  12042.  * @param $h (float) Height. 
  12043.  * @param $rx (float) the x-axis radius of the ellipse used to round off the corners of the rectangle. 
  12044.  * @param $ry (float) the y-axis radius of the ellipse used to round off the corners of the rectangle. 
  12045.  * @param $round_corner (string) Draws rounded corner or not. String with a 0 (not rounded i-corner) or 1 (rounded i-corner) in i-position. Positions are, in order and begin to 0: top right, bottom right, bottom left and top left. Default value: all rounded corner ("1111"). 
  12046.  * @param $style (string) Style of rendering. See the getPathPaintOperator() function for more information. 
  12047.  * @param $border_style (array) Border style of rectangle. Array like for SetLineStyle(). Default value: default line style (empty array). 
  12048.  * @param $fill_color (array) Fill color. Format: array(GREY) or array(R, G, B) or array(C, M, Y, K) or array(C, M, Y, K, SpotColorName). Default value: default color (empty array). 
  12049.  * @public 
  12050.  * @since 4.9.019 (2010-04-22) 
  12051.  */ 
  12052. public function RoundedRectXY($x, $y, $w, $h, $rx, $ry, $round_corner='1111', $style='', $border_style=array(), $fill_color=array()) { 
  12053.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  12054.         return; 
  12055.     } 
  12056.     if (($round_corner == '0000') OR (($rx == $ry) AND ($rx == 0))) { 
  12057.         // Not rounded 
  12058.         $this->Rect($x, $y, $w, $h, $style, $border_style, $fill_color); 
  12059.         return; 
  12060.     } 
  12061.     // Rounded 
  12062.     if (!(false === strpos($style, 'F')) AND isset($fill_color)) { 
  12063.         $this->SetFillColorArray($fill_color); 
  12064.     } 
  12065.     $op = TCPDF_STATIC::getPathPaintOperator($style); 
  12066.     if ($op == 'f') { 
  12067.         $border_style = array(); 
  12068.     } 
  12069.     if ($border_style) { 
  12070.         $this->SetLineStyle($border_style); 
  12071.     } 
  12072.     $MyArc = 4 / 3 * (sqrt(2) - 1); 
  12073.     $this->_outPoint($x + $rx, $y); 
  12074.     $xc = $x + $w - $rx; 
  12075.     $yc = $y + $ry; 
  12076.     $this->_outLine($xc, $y); 
  12077.     if ($round_corner[0]) { 
  12078.         $this->_outCurve($xc + ($rx * $MyArc), $yc - $ry, $xc + $rx, $yc - ($ry * $MyArc), $xc + $rx, $yc); 
  12079.     } else { 
  12080.         $this->_outLine($x + $w, $y); 
  12081.     } 
  12082.     $xc = $x + $w - $rx; 
  12083.     $yc = $y + $h - $ry; 
  12084.     $this->_outLine($x + $w, $yc); 
  12085.     if ($round_corner[1]) { 
  12086.         $this->_outCurve($xc + $rx, $yc + ($ry * $MyArc), $xc + ($rx * $MyArc), $yc + $ry, $xc, $yc + $ry); 
  12087.     } else { 
  12088.         $this->_outLine($x + $w, $y + $h); 
  12089.     } 
  12090.     $xc = $x + $rx; 
  12091.     $yc = $y + $h - $ry; 
  12092.     $this->_outLine($xc, $y + $h); 
  12093.     if ($round_corner[2]) { 
  12094.         $this->_outCurve($xc - ($rx * $MyArc), $yc + $ry, $xc - $rx, $yc + ($ry * $MyArc), $xc - $rx, $yc); 
  12095.     } else { 
  12096.         $this->_outLine($x, $y + $h); 
  12097.     } 
  12098.     $xc = $x + $rx; 
  12099.     $yc = $y + $ry; 
  12100.     $this->_outLine($x, $yc); 
  12101.     if ($round_corner[3]) { 
  12102.         $this->_outCurve($xc - $rx, $yc - ($ry * $MyArc), $xc - ($rx * $MyArc), $yc - $ry, $xc, $yc - $ry); 
  12103.     } else { 
  12104.         $this->_outLine($x, $y); 
  12105.         $this->_outLine($x + $rx, $y); 
  12106.     } 
  12107.     $this->_out($op); 
  12108. } 
  12109.  
  12110. /** 
  12111.  * Draws a grahic arrow. 
  12112.  * @param $x0 (float) Abscissa of first point. 
  12113.  * @param $y0 (float) Ordinate of first point. 
  12114.  * @param $x1 (float) Abscissa of second point. 
  12115.  * @param $y1 (float) Ordinate of second point. 
  12116.  * @param $head_style (int) (0 = draw only arrowhead arms, 1 = draw closed arrowhead, but no fill, 2 = closed and filled arrowhead, 3 = filled arrowhead) 
  12117.  * @param $arm_size (float) length of arrowhead arms 
  12118.  * @param $arm_angle (int) angle between an arm and the shaft 
  12119.  * @author Piotr Galecki, Nicola Asuni, Andy Meier 
  12120.  * @since 4.6.018 (2009-07-10) 
  12121.  */ 
  12122. public function Arrow($x0, $y0, $x1, $y1, $head_style=0, $arm_size=5, $arm_angle=15) { 
  12123.     // getting arrow direction angle 
  12124.     // 0 deg angle is when both arms go along X axis. angle grows clockwise. 
  12125.     $dir_angle = atan2(($y0 - $y1), ($x0 - $x1)); 
  12126.     if ($dir_angle < 0) { 
  12127.         $dir_angle += (2 * M_PI); 
  12128.     } 
  12129.     $arm_angle = deg2rad($arm_angle); 
  12130.     $sx1 = $x1; 
  12131.     $sy1 = $y1; 
  12132.     if ($head_style > 0) { 
  12133.         // calculate the stopping point for the arrow shaft 
  12134.         $sx1 = $x1 + (($arm_size - $this->LineWidth) * cos($dir_angle)); 
  12135.         $sy1 = $y1 + (($arm_size - $this->LineWidth) * sin($dir_angle)); 
  12136.     } 
  12137.     // main arrow line / shaft 
  12138.     $this->Line($x0, $y0, $sx1, $sy1); 
  12139.     // left arrowhead arm tip 
  12140.     $x2L = $x1 + ($arm_size * cos($dir_angle + $arm_angle)); 
  12141.     $y2L = $y1 + ($arm_size * sin($dir_angle + $arm_angle)); 
  12142.     // right arrowhead arm tip 
  12143.     $x2R = $x1 + ($arm_size * cos($dir_angle - $arm_angle)); 
  12144.     $y2R = $y1 + ($arm_size * sin($dir_angle - $arm_angle)); 
  12145.     $mode = 'D'; 
  12146.     $style = array(); 
  12147.     switch ($head_style) { 
  12148.         case 0: { 
  12149.             // draw only arrowhead arms 
  12150.             $mode = 'D'; 
  12151.             $style = array(1, 1, 0); 
  12152.             break; 
  12153.         } 
  12154.         case 1: { 
  12155.             // draw closed arrowhead, but no fill 
  12156.             $mode = 'D'; 
  12157.             break; 
  12158.         } 
  12159.         case 2: { 
  12160.             // closed and filled arrowhead 
  12161.             $mode = 'DF'; 
  12162.             break; 
  12163.         } 
  12164.         case 3: { 
  12165.             // filled arrowhead 
  12166.             $mode = 'F'; 
  12167.             break; 
  12168.         } 
  12169.     } 
  12170.     $this->Polygon(array($x2L, $y2L, $x1, $y1, $x2R, $y2R), $mode, $style, array()); 
  12171. } 
  12172.  
  12173. // END GRAPHIC FUNCTIONS SECTION ----------------------- 
  12174.  
  12175. /** 
  12176.  * Add a Named Destination. 
  12177.  * NOTE: destination names are unique, so only last entry will be saved.
