  2182.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] = $this->original_lMargin; 
  2183.     $this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm'] = $this->original_rMargin; 
  2184. } 
  2185.  
  2186. /** 
  2187.  * Set regular expression to detect withespaces or word separators. 
  2188.  * The pattern delimiter must be the forward-slash character "/". 
  2189.  * Some example patterns are: 
  2190.  * <pre> 
  2191.  * Non-Unicode or missing PCRE unicode support: "/[^\S\xa0]/" 
  2192.  * Unicode and PCRE unicode support: "/(?!\xa0)[\s\p{Z}]/u" 
  2193.  * Unicode and PCRE unicode support in Chinese mode: "/(?!\xa0)[\s\p{Z}\p{Lo}]/u" 
  2194.  * if PCRE unicode support is turned ON ("\P" is the negate class of "\p"): 
  2195.  *      \s     : any whitespace character 
  2196.  *      \p{Z}  : any separator 
  2197.  *      \p{Lo} : Unicode letter or ideograph that does not have lowercase and uppercase variants. Is used to chunk chinese words. 
  2198.  *      \xa0   : Unicode Character 'NO-BREAK SPACE' (U+00A0) 
  2199.  * </pre> 
  2200.  * @param $re (string) regular expression (leave empty for default). 
  2201.  * @public 
  2202.  * @since 4.6.016 (2009-06-15) 
  2203.  */ 
  2204. public function setSpacesRE($re='/[^\S\xa0]/') { 
  2205.     $this->re_spaces = $re; 
  2206.     $re_parts = explode('/', $re); 
  2207.     // get pattern parts 
  2208.     $this->re_space = array(); 
  2209.     if (isset($re_parts[1]) AND !empty($re_parts[1])) { 
  2210.         $this->re_space['p'] = $re_parts[1]; 
  2211.     } else { 
  2212.         $this->re_space['p'] = '[\s]'; 
  2213.     } 
  2214.     // set pattern modifiers 
  2215.     if (isset($re_parts[2]) AND !empty($re_parts[2])) { 
  2216.         $this->re_space['m'] = $re_parts[2]; 
  2217.     } else { 
  2218.         $this->re_space['m'] = ''; 
  2219.     } 
  2220. } 
  2221.  
  2222. /** 
  2223.  * Enable or disable Right-To-Left language mode 
  2224.  * @param $enable (Boolean) if true enable Right-To-Left language mode. 
  2225.  * @param $resetx (Boolean) if true reset the X position on direction change. 
  2226.  * @public 
  2227.  * @since 2.0.000 (2008-01-03) 
  2228.  */ 
  2229. public function setRTL($enable, $resetx=true) { 
  2230.     $enable = $enable ? true : false; 
  2231.     $resetx = ($resetx AND ($enable != $this->rtl)); 
  2232.     $this->rtl = $enable; 
  2233.     $this->tmprtl = false; 
  2234.     if ($resetx) { 
  2235.         $this->Ln(0); 
  2236.     } 
  2237. } 
  2238.  
  2239. /** 
  2240.  * Return the RTL status 
  2241.  * @return boolean 
  2242.  * @public 
  2243.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  2244.  */ 
  2245. public function getRTL() { 
  2246.     return $this->rtl; 
  2247. } 
  2248.  
  2249. /** 
  2250.  * Force temporary RTL language direction 
  2251.  * @param $mode (mixed) can be false, 'L' for LTR or 'R' for RTL 
  2252.  * @public 
  2253.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-09) 
  2254.  */ 
  2255. public function setTempRTL($mode) { 
  2256.     $newmode = false; 
  2257.     switch (strtoupper($mode)) { 
  2258.         case 'LTR': 
  2259.         case 'L': { 
  2260.             if ($this->rtl) { 
  2261.                 $newmode = 'L'; 
  2262.             } 
  2263.             break; 
  2264.         } 
  2265.         case 'RTL': 
  2266.         case 'R': { 
  2267.             if (!$this->rtl) { 
  2268.                 $newmode = 'R'; 
  2269.             } 
  2270.             break; 
  2271.         } 
  2272.         case false: 
  2273.         default: { 
  2274.             $newmode = false; 
  2275.             break; 
  2276.         } 
  2277.     } 
  2278.     $this->tmprtl = $newmode; 
  2279. } 
  2280.  
  2281. /** 
  2282.  * Return the current temporary RTL status 
  2283.  * @return boolean 
  2284.  * @public 
  2285.  * @since 4.8.014 (2009-11-04) 
  2286.  */ 
  2287. public function isRTLTextDir() { 
  2288.     return ($this->rtl OR ($this->tmprtl == 'R')); 
  2289. } 
  2290.  
  2291. /** 
  2292.  * Set the last cell height. 
  2293.  * @param $h (float) cell height. 
  2294.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2295.  * @public 
  2296.  * @since 1.53.0.TC034 
  2297.  */ 
  2298. public function setLastH($h) { 
  2299.     $this->lasth = $h; 
  2300. } 
  2301.  
  2302. /** 
  2303.  * Return the cell height 
  2304.  * @param $fontsize (int) Font size in internal units 
  2305.  * @param $padding (boolean) If true add cell padding 
  2306.  * @public 
  2307.  */ 
  2308. public function getCellHeight($fontsize, $padding=TRUE) { 
  2309.     $height = ($fontsize * $this->cell_height_ratio); 
  2310.     if ($padding) { 
  2311.         $height += ($this->cell_padding['T'] + $this->cell_padding['B']); 
  2312.     } 
  2313.     return round($height, 6); 
  2314. } 
  2315.  
  2316. /** 
  2317.  * Reset the last cell height. 
  2318.  * @public 
  2319.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2320.  */ 
  2321. public function resetLastH() { 
  2322.     $this->lasth = $this->getCellHeight($this->FontSize); 
  2323. } 
  2324.  
  2325. /** 
  2326.  * Get the last cell height. 
  2327.  * @return last cell height 
  2328.  * @public 
  2329.  * @since 3.0.017 (2008-08-05) 
  2330.  */ 
  2331. public function getLastH() { 
  2332.     return $this->lasth; 
  2333. } 
  2334.  
  2335. /** 
  2336.  * Set the adjusting factor to convert pixels to user units. 
  2337.  * @param $scale (float) adjusting factor to convert pixels to user units. 
  2338.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2339.  * @public 
  2340.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2341.  */ 
  2342. public function setImageScale($scale) { 
  2343.     $this->imgscale = $scale; 
  2344. } 
  2345.  
  2346. /** 
  2347.  * Returns the adjusting factor to convert pixels to user units. 
  2348.  * @return float adjusting factor to convert pixels to user units. 
  2349.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2350.  * @public 
  2351.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2352.  */ 
  2353. public function getImageScale() { 
  2354.     return $this->imgscale; 
  2355. } 
  2356.  
  2357. /** 
  2358.  * Returns an array of page dimensions: 
  2359.  * <ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['w'] = page width in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['h'] = height in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['wk'] = page width in user units</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['hk'] = page height in user units</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm'] = top margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['bm'] = bottom margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['lm'] = left margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['rm'] = right margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['pb'] = auto page break</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['or'] = page orientation</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] = original left margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm'] = original right margin</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['Rotate'] = The number of degrees by which the page shall be rotated clockwise when displayed or printed. The value shall be a multiple of 90.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['PZ'] = The page's preferred zoom (magnification) factor.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans'] : the style and duration of the visual transition to use when moving from another page to the given page during a presentation<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Dur'] = The page's display duration (also called its advance timing): the maximum length of time, in seconds, that the page shall be displayed during presentations before the viewer application shall automatically advance to the next page.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['S'] = transition style : Split, Blinds, Box, Wipe, Dissolve, Glitter, R, Fly, Push, Cover, Uncover, Fade</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['D'] = The duration of the transition effect, in seconds.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Dm'] = (Split and Blinds transition styles only) The dimension in which the specified transition effect shall occur: H = Horizontal, V = Vertical. Default value: H.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['M'] = (Split, Box and Fly transition styles only) The direction of motion for the specified transition effect: I = Inward from the edges of the page, O = Outward from the center of the pageDefault value: I.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['Di'] = (Wipe, Glitter, Fly, Cover, Uncover and Push transition styles only) The direction in which the specified transition effect shall moves, expressed in degrees counterclockwise starting from a left-to-right direction. If the value is a number, it shall be one of: 0 = Left to right, 90 = Bottom to top (Wipe only), 180 = Right to left (Wipe only), 270 = Top to bottom, 315 = Top-left to bottom-right (Glitter only). If the value is a name, it shall be None, which is relevant only for the Fly transition when the value of SS is not 1.0. Default value: 0.</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['SS'] = (Fly transition style only) The starting or ending scale at which the changes shall be drawn. If M specifies an inward transition, the scale of the changes drawn shall progress from SS to 1.0 over the course of the transition. If M specifies an outward transition, the scale of the changes drawn shall progress from 1.0 to SS over the course of the transition. Default: 1.0. </li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['trans']['B'] = (Fly transition style only) If true, the area that shall be flown in is rectangular and opaque. Default: false.</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox'] : the boundaries of the physical medium on which the page shall be displayed or printed<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['MediaBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox'] : the visible region of default user space<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['CropBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox'] : the region to which the contents of the page shall be clipped when output in a production environment<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['BleedBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox'] : the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['TrimBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox'] : the extent of the page's meaningful content<ul><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox']['llx'] = lower-left x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox']['lly'] = lower-left y coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox']['urx'] = upper-right x coordinate in points</li><li>$this->pagedim[$this->page]['ArtBox']['ury'] = upper-right y coordinate in points</li></ul></li></ul> 
  2360.  * @param $pagenum (int) page number (empty = current page) 
  2361.  * @return array of page dimensions. 
  2362.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2363.  * @public 
  2364.  * @since 4.5.027 (2009-03-16) 
  2365.  */ 
  2366. public function getPageDimensions($pagenum='') { 
  2367.     if (empty($pagenum)) { 
  2368.         $pagenum = $this->page; 
  2369.     } 
  2370.     return $this->pagedim[$pagenum]; 
  2371. } 
  2372.  
  2373. /** 
  2374.  * Returns the page width in units. 
  2375.  * @param $pagenum (int) page number (empty = current page) 
  2376.  * @return int page width. 
  2377.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2378.  * @public 
  2379.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2380.  * @see getPageDimensions() 
  2381.  */ 
  2382. public function getPageWidth($pagenum='') { 
  2383.     if (empty($pagenum)) { 
  2384.         return $this->w; 
  2385.     } 
  2386.     return $this->pagedim[$pagenum]['w']; 
  2387. } 
  2388.  
  2389. /** 
  2390.  * Returns the page height in units. 
  2391.  * @param $pagenum (int) page number (empty = current page) 
  2392.  * @return int page height. 
  2393.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2394.  * @public 
  2395.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2396.  * @see getPageDimensions() 
  2397.  */ 
  2398. public function getPageHeight($pagenum='') { 
  2399.     if (empty($pagenum)) { 
  2400.         return $this->h; 
  2401.     } 
  2402.     return $this->pagedim[$pagenum]['h']; 
  2403. } 
  2404.  
  2405. /** 
  2406.  * Returns the page break margin. 
  2407.  * @param $pagenum (int) page number (empty = current page) 
  2408.  * @return int page break margin. 
  2409.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2410.  * @public 
  2411.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2412.  * @see getPageDimensions() 
  2413.  */ 
  2414. public function getBreakMargin($pagenum='') { 
  2415.     if (empty($pagenum)) { 
  2416.         return $this->bMargin; 
  2417.     } 
  2418.     return $this->pagedim[$pagenum]['bm']; 
  2419. } 
  2420.  
  2421. /** 
  2422.  * Returns the scale factor (number of points in user unit). 
  2423.  * @return int scale factor. 
  2424.  * @author Nicola Asuni 
  2425.  * @public 
  2426.  * @since 1.5.2 
  2427.  */ 
  2428. public function getScaleFactor() { 
  2429.     return $this->k; 
  2430. } 
  2431.  
  2432. /** 
  2433.  * Defines the left, top and right margins. 
  2434.  * @param $left (float) Left margin. 
  2435.  * @param $top (float) Top margin. 
  2436.  * @param $right (float) Right margin. Default value is the left one. 
  2437.  * @param $keepmargins (boolean) if true overwrites the default page margins 
  2438.  * @public 
  2439.  * @since 1.0 
  2440.  * @see SetLeftMargin(), SetTopMargin(), SetRightMargin(), SetAutoPageBreak() 
  2441.  */ 
  2442. public function SetMargins($left, $top, $right=-1, $keepmargins=false) { 
  2443.     //Set left, top and right margins 
  2444.     $this->lMargin = $left; 
  2445.     $this->tMargin = $top; 
  2446.     if ($right == -1) { 
  2447.         $right = $left; 
  2448.     } 
  2449.     $this->rMargin = $right; 
  2450.     if ($keepmargins) { 
  2451.         // overwrite original values 
  2452.         $this->original_lMargin = $this->lMargin; 
  2453.         $this->original_rMargin = $this->rMargin; 
  2454.     } 
  2455. } 
  2456.  
  2457. /** 
  2458.  * Defines the left margin. The method can be called before creating the first page. If the current abscissa gets out of page, it is brought back to the margin. 
  2459.  * @param $margin (float) The margin. 
  2460.  * @public 
  2461.  * @since 1.4 
  2462.  * @see SetTopMargin(), SetRightMargin(), SetAutoPageBreak(), SetMargins() 
  2463.  */ 
  2464. public function SetLeftMargin($margin) { 
  2465.     //Set left margin 
  2466.     $this->lMargin = $margin; 
  2467.     if (($this->page > 0) AND ($this->x < $margin)) { 
  2468.         $this->x = $margin; 
  2469.     } 
  2470. } 
  2471.  
  2472. /** 
  2473.  * Defines the top margin. The method can be called before creating the first page. 
  2474.  * @param $margin (float) The margin. 
  2475.  * @public 
  2476.  * @since 1.5 
  2477.  * @see SetLeftMargin(), SetRightMargin(), SetAutoPageBreak(), SetMargins() 
  2478.  */ 
  2479. public function SetTopMargin($margin) { 
  2480.     //Set top margin 
  2481.     $this->tMargin = $margin; 
  2482.     if (($this->page > 0) AND ($this->y < $margin)) { 
  2483.         $this->y = $margin; 
  2484.     } 
  2485. } 
  2486.  
  2487. /** 
  2488.  * Defines the right margin. The method can be called before creating the first page. 
  2489.  * @param $margin (float) The margin. 
  2490.  * @public 
  2491.  * @since 1.5 
  2492.  * @see SetLeftMargin(), SetTopMargin(), SetAutoPageBreak(), SetMargins() 
  2493.  */ 
  2494. public function SetRightMargin($margin) { 
  2495.     $this->rMargin = $margin; 
  2496.     if (($this->page > 0) AND ($this->x > ($this->w - $margin))) { 
  2497.         $this->x = $this->w - $margin; 
  2498.     } 
  2499. } 
  2500.  
  2501. /** 
  2502.  * Set the same internal Cell padding for top, right, bottom, left- 
  2503.  * @param $pad (float) internal padding. 
  2504.  * @public 
  2505.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-09) 
  2506.  * @see getCellPaddings(), setCellPaddings() 
  2507.  */ 
  2508. public function SetCellPadding($pad) { 
  2509.     if ($pad >= 0) { 
  2510.         $this->cell_padding['L'] = $pad; 
  2511.         $this->cell_padding['T'] = $pad; 
  2512.         $this->cell_padding['R'] = $pad; 
  2513.         $this->cell_padding['B'] = $pad; 
  2514.     } 
  2515. } 
  2516.  
  2517. /** 
  2518.  * Set the internal Cell paddings. 
  2519.  * @param $left (float) left padding 
  2520.  * @param $top (float) top padding 
  2521.  * @param $right (float) right padding 
  2522.  * @param $bottom (float) bottom padding 
  2523.  * @public 
  2524.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2525.  * @see getCellPaddings(), SetCellPadding() 
  2526.  */ 
  2527. public function setCellPaddings($left='', $top='', $right='', $bottom='') { 
  2528.     if (($left !== '') AND ($left >= 0)) { 
  2529.         $this->cell_padding['L'] = $left; 
  2530.     } 
  2531.     if (($top !== '') AND ($top >= 0)) { 
  2532.         $this->cell_padding['T'] = $top; 
  2533.     } 
  2534.     if (($right !== '') AND ($right >= 0)) { 
  2535.         $this->cell_padding['R'] = $right; 
  2536.     } 
  2537.     if (($bottom !== '') AND ($bottom >= 0)) { 
  2538.         $this->cell_padding['B'] = $bottom; 
  2539.     } 
  2540. } 
  2541.  
  2542. /** 
  2543.  * Get the internal Cell padding array. 
  2544.  * @return array of padding values 
  2545.  * @public 
  2546.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2547.  * @see setCellPaddings(), SetCellPadding() 
  2548.  */ 
  2549. public function getCellPaddings() { 
  2550.     return $this->cell_padding; 
  2551. } 
  2552.  
  2553. /** 
  2554.  * Set the internal Cell margins. 
  2555.  * @param $left (float) left margin 
  2556.  * @param $top (float) top margin 
  2557.  * @param $right (float) right margin 
  2558.  * @param $bottom (float) bottom margin 
  2559.  * @public 
  2560.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2561.  * @see getCellMargins() 
  2562.  */ 
  2563. public function setCellMargins($left='', $top='', $right='', $bottom='') { 
  2564.     if (($left !== '') AND ($left >= 0)) { 
  2565.         $this->cell_margin['L'] = $left; 
  2566.     } 
  2567.     if (($top !== '') AND ($top >= 0)) { 
  2568.         $this->cell_margin['T'] = $top; 
  2569.     } 
  2570.     if (($right !== '') AND ($right >= 0)) { 
  2571.         $this->cell_margin['R'] = $right; 
  2572.     } 
  2573.     if (($bottom !== '') AND ($bottom >= 0)) { 
  2574.         $this->cell_margin['B'] = $bottom; 
  2575.     } 
  2576. } 
  2577.  
  2578. /** 
  2579.  * Get the internal Cell margin array. 
  2580.  * @return array of margin values 
  2581.  * @public 
  2582.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2583.  * @see setCellMargins() 
  2584.  */ 
  2585. public function getCellMargins() { 
  2586.     return $this->cell_margin; 
  2587. } 
  2588.  
  2589. /** 
  2590.  * Adjust the internal Cell padding array to take account of the line width. 
  2591.  * @param $brd (mixed) Indicates if borders must be drawn around the cell. The value can be a number:<ul><li>0: no border (default)</li><li>1: frame</li></ul> or a string containing some or all of the following characters (in any order):<ul><li>L: left</li><li>T: top</li><li>R: right</li><li>B: bottom</li></ul> or an array of line styles for each border group - for example: array('LTRB' => array('width' => 2, 'cap' => 'butt', 'join' => 'miter', 'dash' => 0, 'color' => array(0, 0, 0))) 
  2592.  * @return array of adjustments 
  2593.  * @public 
  2594.  * @since 5.9.000 (2010-10-03) 
  2595.  */ 
  2596. protected function adjustCellPadding($brd=0) { 
  2597.     if (empty($brd)) { 
  2598.         return; 
  2599.     } 
  2600.     if (is_string($brd)) { 
  2601.         // convert string to array 
  2602.         $slen = strlen($brd); 
  2603.         $newbrd = array(); 
  2604.         for ($i = 0; $i < $slen; ++$i) { 
  2605.             $newbrd[$brd[$i]] = true; 
  2606.         } 
  2607.         $brd = $newbrd; 
  2608.     } elseif (($brd === 1) OR ($brd === true) OR (is_numeric($brd) AND (intval($brd) > 0))) { 
  2609.         $brd = array('LRTB' => true); 
  2610.     } 
  2611.     if (!is_array($brd)) { 
  2612.         return; 
  2613.     } 
  2614.     // store current cell padding 
  2615.     $cp = $this->cell_padding; 
  2616.     // select border mode 
  2617.     if (isset($brd['mode'])) { 
  2618.         $mode = $brd['mode']; 
  2619.         unset($brd['mode']); 
  2620.     } else { 
  2621.         $mode = 'normal'; 
  2622.     } 
  2623.     // process borders 
  2624.     foreach ($brd as $border => $style) { 
  2625.         $line_width = $this->LineWidth; 
  2626.         if (is_array($style) AND isset($style['width'])) { 
  2627.             // get border width 
  2628.             $line_width = $style['width']; 
  2629.         } 
  2630.         $adj = 0; // line width inside the cell 
  2631.         switch ($mode) { 
  2632.             case 'ext': { 
  2633.                 $adj = 0; 
  2634.                 break; 
  2635.             } 
  2636.             case 'int': { 
  2637.                 $adj = $line_width; 
  2638.                 break; 
  2639.             } 
  2640.             case 'normal': 
  2641.             default: { 
  2642.                 $adj = ($line_width / 2); 
  2643.                 break; 
  2644.             } 
  2645.         } 
  2646.         // correct internal cell padding if required to avoid overlap between text and lines 
  2647.         if ((strpos($border, 'T') !== false) AND ($this->cell_padding['T'] < $adj)) { 
  2648.             $this->cell_padding['T'] = $adj; 
  2649.         } 
  2650.         if ((strpos($border, 'R') !== false) AND ($this->cell_padding['R'] < $adj)) { 
  2651.             $this->cell_padding['R'] = $adj; 
  2652.         } 
  2653.         if ((strpos($border, 'B') !== false) AND ($this->cell_padding['B'] < $adj)) { 
  2654.             $this->cell_padding['B'] = $adj; 
  2655.         } 
  2656.         if ((strpos($border, 'L') !== false) AND ($this->cell_padding['L'] < $adj)) { 
  2657.             $this->cell_padding['L'] = $adj; 
  2658.         } 
  2659.     } 
  2660.     return array('T' => ($this->cell_padding['T'] - $cp['T']), 'R' => ($this->cell_padding['R'] - $cp['R']), 'B' => ($this->cell_padding['B'] - $cp['B']), 'L' => ($this->cell_padding['L'] - $cp['L'])); 
  2661. } 
  2662.  
  2663. /** 
  2664.  * Enables or disables the automatic page breaking mode. When enabling, the second parameter is the distance from the bottom of the page that defines the triggering limit. By default, the mode is on and the margin is 2 cm. 
  2665.  * @param $auto (boolean) Boolean indicating if mode should be on or off. 
  2666.  * @param $margin (float) Distance from the bottom of the page. 
  2667.  * @public 
  2668.  * @since 1.0 
  2669.  * @see Cell(), MultiCell(), AcceptPageBreak() 
  2670.  */ 
  2671. public function SetAutoPageBreak($auto, $margin=0) { 
  2672.     $this->AutoPageBreak = $auto ? true : false; 
  2673.     $this->bMargin = $margin; 
  2674.     $this->PageBreakTrigger = $this->h - $margin; 
  2675. } 
  2676.  
  2677. /** 
  2678.  * Return the auto-page-break mode (true or false). 
  2679.  * @return boolean auto-page-break mode 
  2680.  * @public 
  2681.  * @since 5.9.088 
  2682.  */ 
  2683. public function getAutoPageBreak() { 
  2684.     return $this->AutoPageBreak; 
  2685. } 
  2686.  
  2687. /** 
  2688.  * Defines the way the document is to be displayed by the viewer. 
  2689.  * @param $zoom (mixed) The zoom to use. It can be one of the following string values or a number indicating the zooming factor to use. <ul><li>fullpage: displays the entire page on screen </li><li>fullwidth: uses maximum width of window</li><li>real: uses real size (equivalent to 100% zoom)</li><li>default: uses viewer default mode</li></ul> 
  2690.  * @param $layout (string) The page layout. Possible values are:<ul><li>SinglePage Display one page at a time</li><li>OneColumn Display the pages in one column</li><li>TwoColumnLeft Display the pages in two columns, with odd-numbered pages on the left</li><li>TwoColumnRight Display the pages in two columns, with odd-numbered pages on the right</li><li>TwoPageLeft (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the left</li><li>TwoPageRight (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the right</li></ul> 
  2691.  * @param $mode (string) A name object specifying how the document should be displayed when opened:<ul><li>UseNone Neither document outline nor thumbnail images visible</li><li>UseOutlines Document outline visible</li><li>UseThumbs Thumbnail images visible</li><li>FullScreen Full-screen mode, with no menu bar, window controls, or any other window visible</li><li>UseOC (PDF 1.5) Optional content group panel visible</li><li>UseAttachments (PDF 1.6) Attachments panel visible</li></ul> 
  2692.  * @public 
  2693.  * @since 1.2 
  2694.  */ 
  2695. public function SetDisplayMode($zoom, $layout='SinglePage', $mode='UseNone') { 
  2696.     if (($zoom == 'fullpage') OR ($zoom == 'fullwidth') OR ($zoom == 'real') OR ($zoom == 'default') OR (!is_string($zoom))) { 
  2697.         $this->ZoomMode = $zoom; 
  2698.     } else { 
  2699.         $this->Error('Incorrect zoom display mode: '.$zoom); 
  2700.     } 
  2701.     $this->LayoutMode = TCPDF_STATIC::getPageLayoutMode($layout); 
  2702.     $this->PageMode = TCPDF_STATIC::getPageMode($mode); 
  2703. } 
  2704.  
  2705. /** 
  2706.  * Activates or deactivates page compression. When activated, the internal representation of each page is compressed, which leads to a compression ratio of about 2 for the resulting document. Compression is on by default. 
  2707.  * Note: the Zlib extension is required for this feature. If not present, compression will be turned off. 
  2708.  * @param $compress (boolean) Boolean indicating if compression must be enabled. 
  2709.  * @public 
  2710.  * @since 1.4 
  2711.  */ 
  2712. public function SetCompression($compress=true) { 
  2713.     if (function_exists('gzcompress')) { 
  2714.         $this->compress = $compress ? true : false; 
  2715.     } else { 
  2716.         $this->compress = false; 
  2717.     } 
  2718. } 
  2719.  
  2720. /** 
  2721.  * Set flag to force sRGB_IEC61966-2.1 black scaled ICC color profile for the whole document. 
  2722.  * @param $mode (boolean) If true force sRGB output intent. 
  2723.  * @public 
  2724.  * @since 5.9.121 (2011-09-28) 
  2725.  */ 
  2726. public function setSRGBmode($mode=false) { 
  2727.     $this->force_srgb = $mode ? true : false; 
  2728. } 
  2729.  
  2730. /** 
  2731.  * Turn on/off Unicode mode for document information dictionary (meta tags). 
  2732.  * This has effect only when unicode mode is set to false. 
  2733.  * @param $unicode (boolean) if true set the meta information in Unicode 
  2734.  * @since 5.9.027 (2010-12-01) 
  2735.  * @public 
  2736.  */ 
  2737. public function SetDocInfoUnicode($unicode=true) { 
  2738.     $this->docinfounicode = $unicode ? true : false; 
  2739. } 
  2740.  
  2741. /** 
  2742.  * Defines the title of the document. 
  2743.  * @param $title (string) The title. 
  2744.  * @public 
  2745.  * @since 1.2 
  2746.  * @see SetAuthor(), SetCreator(), SetKeywords(), SetSubject() 
  2747.  */ 
  2748. public function SetTitle($title) { 
  2749.     $this->title = $title; 
  2750. } 
  2751.  
  2752. /** 
  2753.  * Defines the subject of the document. 
  2754.  * @param $subject (string) The subject. 
  2755.  * @public 
  2756.  * @since 1.2 
  2757.  * @see SetAuthor(), SetCreator(), SetKeywords(), SetTitle() 
  2758.  */ 
  2759. public function SetSubject($subject) { 
  2760.     $this->subject = $subject; 
  2761. } 
  2762.  
  2763. /** 
  2764.  * Defines the author of the document. 
  2765.  * @param $author (string) The name of the author. 
  2766.  * @public 
  2767.  * @since 1.2 
  2768.  * @see SetCreator(), SetKeywords(), SetSubject(), SetTitle() 
  2769.  */ 
  2770. public function SetAuthor($author) { 
  2771.     $this->author = $author; 
  2772. } 
  2773.  
  2774. /** 
  2775.  * Associates keywords with the document, generally in the form 'keyword1 keyword2 ...'. 
  2776.  * @param $keywords (string) The list of keywords. 
  2777.  * @public 
  2778.  * @since 1.2 
  2779.  * @see SetAuthor(), SetCreator(), SetSubject(), SetTitle() 
  2780.  */ 
  2781. public function SetKeywords($keywords) { 
  2782.     $this->keywords = $keywords; 
  2783. } 
  2784.  
  2785. /** 
  2786.  * Defines the creator of the document. This is typically the name of the application that generates the PDF. 
  2787.  * @param $creator (string) The name of the creator. 
  2788.  * @public 
  2789.  * @since 1.2 
  2790.  * @see SetAuthor(), SetKeywords(), SetSubject(), SetTitle() 
  2791.  */ 
  2792. public function SetCreator($creator) { 
  2793.     $this->creator = $creator; 
  2794. } 
  2795.  
  2796. /** 
  2797.  * Throw an exception or print an error message and die if the K_TCPDF_PARSER_THROW_EXCEPTION_ERROR constant is set to true. 
  2798.  * @param $msg (string) The error message 
  2799.  * @public 
  2800.  * @since 1.0 
  2801.  */ 
  2802. public function Error($msg) { 
  2803.     // unset all class variables 
  2804.     $this->_destroy(true); 
  2805.     if (defined('K_TCPDF_THROW_EXCEPTION_ERROR') AND !K_TCPDF_THROW_EXCEPTION_ERROR) { 
  2806.         die('<strong>TCPDF ERROR: </strong>'.$msg); 
  2807.     } else { 
  2808.         throw new Exception('TCPDF ERROR: '.$msg); 
  2809.     } 
  2810. } 
  2811.  
  2812. /** 
  2813.  * This method begins the generation of the PDF document. 
  2814.  * It is not necessary to call it explicitly because AddPage() does it automatically. 
  2815.  * Note: no page is created by this method 
  2816.  * @public 
  2817.  * @since 1.0 
  2818.  * @see AddPage(), Close() 
  2819.  */ 
  2820. public function Open() { 
  2821.     $this->state = 1; 
  2822. } 
  2823.  
  2824. /** 
  2825.  * Terminates the PDF document. 
  2826.  * It is not necessary to call this method explicitly because Output() does it automatically. 
  2827.  * If the document contains no page, AddPage() is called to prevent from getting an invalid document. 
  2828.  * @public 
  2829.  * @since 1.0 
  2830.  * @see Open(), Output() 
  2831.  */ 
  2832. public function Close() { 
  2833.     if ($this->state == 3) { 
  2834.         return; 
  2835.     } 
  2836.     if ($this->page == 0) { 
  2837.         $this->AddPage(); 
  2838.     } 
  2839.     $this->endLayer(); 
  2840.     if ($this->tcpdflink) { 
  2841.         // save current graphic settings 
  2842.         $gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  2843.         $this->setEqualColumns(); 
  2844.         $this->lastpage(true); 
  2845.         $this->SetAutoPageBreak(false); 
  2846.         $this->x = 0; 
  2847.         $this->y = $this->h - (1 / $this->k); 
  2848.         $this->lMargin = 0; 
  2849.         $this->_outSaveGraphicsState(); 
  2850.         $font = defined('PDF_FONT_NAME_MAIN')?PDF_FONT_NAME_MAIN:'helvetica'; 
  2851.         $this->SetFont($font, '', 1); 
  2852.         $this->setTextRenderingMode(0, false, false); 
  2853.         $msg = "\x50\x6f\x77\x65\x72\x65\x64\x20\x62\x79\x20\x54\x43\x50\x44\x46\x20\x28\x77\x77\x77\x2e\x74\x63\x70\x64\x66\x2e\x6f\x72\x67\x29"; 
  2854.         $lnk = "\x68\x74\x74\x70\x3a\x2f\x2f\x77\x77\x77\x2e\x74\x63\x70\x64\x66\x2e\x6f\x72\x67"; 
  2855.         $this->Cell(0, 0, $msg, 0, 0, 'L', 0, $lnk, 0, false, 'D', 'B'); 
  2856.         $this->_outRestoreGraphicsState(); 
  2857.         // restore graphic settings 
  2858.         $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  2859.     } 
  2860.     // close page 
  2861.     $this->endPage(); 
  2862.     // close document 
  2863.     $this->_enddoc(); 
  2864.     // unset all class variables (except critical ones) 
  2865.     $this->_destroy(false); 
  2866. } 
  2867.  
  2868. /** 
  2869.  * Move pointer at the specified document page and update page dimensions. 
  2870.  * @param $pnum (int) page number (1 ... numpages) 
  2871.  * @param $resetmargins (boolean) if true reset left, right, top margins and Y position. 
  2872.  * @public 
  2873.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  2874.  * @see getPage(), lastpage(), getNumPages() 
  2875.  */ 
  2876. public function setPage($pnum, $resetmargins=false) { 
  2877.     if (($pnum == $this->page) AND ($this->state == 2)) { 
  2878.         return; 
  2879.     } 
  2880.     if (($pnum > 0) AND ($pnum <= $this->numpages)) { 
  2881.         $this->state = 2; 
  2882.         // save current graphic settings 
  2883.         //$gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  2884.         $oldpage = $this->page; 
  2885.         $this->page = $pnum; 
  2886.         $this->wPt = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['w']; 
  2887.         $this->hPt = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['h']; 
  2888.         $this->w = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['wk']; 
  2889.         $this->h = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['hk']; 
  2890.         $this->tMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm']; 
  2891.         $this->bMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['bm']; 
  2892.         $this->original_lMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm']; 
  2893.         $this->original_rMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm']; 
  2894.         $this->AutoPageBreak = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['pb']; 
  2895.         $this->CurOrientation = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['or']; 
  2896.         $this->SetAutoPageBreak($this->AutoPageBreak, $this->bMargin); 
  2897.         // restore graphic settings 
  2898.         //$this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  2899.         if ($resetmargins) { 
  2900.             $this->lMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm']; 
  2901.             $this->rMargin = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm']; 
  2902.             $this->SetY($this->tMargin); 
  2903.         } else { 
  2904.             // account for booklet mode 
  2905.             if ($this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] != $this->pagedim[$oldpage]['olm']) { 
  2906.                 $deltam = $this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] - $this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm']; 
  2907.                 $this->lMargin += $deltam; 
  2908.                 $this->rMargin -= $deltam; 
  2909.             } 
  2910.         } 
  2911.     } else { 
  2912.         $this->Error('Wrong page number on setPage() function: '.$pnum); 
  2913.     } 
  2914. } 
  2915.  
  2916. /** 
  2917.  * Reset pointer to the last document page. 
  2918.  * @param $resetmargins (boolean) if true reset left, right, top margins and Y position. 
  2919.  * @public 
  2920.  * @since 2.0.000 (2008-01-04) 
  2921.  * @see setPage(), getPage(), getNumPages() 
  2922.  */ 
  2923. public function lastPage($resetmargins=false) { 
  2924.     $this->setPage($this->getNumPages(), $resetmargins); 
  2925. } 
  2926.  
  2927. /** 
  2928.  * Get current document page number. 
  2929.  * @return int page number 
  2930.  * @public 
  2931.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  2932.  * @see setPage(), lastpage(), getNumPages() 
  2933.  */ 
  2934. public function getPage() { 
  2935.     return $this->page; 
  2936. } 
  2937.  
  2938. /** 
  2939.  * Get the total number of insered pages. 
  2940.  * @return int number of pages 
  2941.  * @public 
  2942.  * @since 2.1.000 (2008-01-07) 
  2943.  * @see setPage(), getPage(), lastpage() 
  2944.  */ 
  2945. public function getNumPages() { 
  2946.     return $this->numpages; 
  2947. } 
  2948.  
  2949. /** 
  2950.  * Adds a new TOC (Table Of Content) page to the document. 
  2951.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. 
  2952.  * @param $format (mixed) The format used for pages. It can be either: one of the string values specified at getPageSizeFromFormat() or an array of parameters specified at setPageFormat(). 
  2953.  * @param $keepmargins (boolean) if true overwrites the default page margins with the current margins 
  2954.  * @public 
  2955.  * @since 5.0.001 (2010-05-06) 
  2956.  * @see AddPage(), startPage(), endPage(), endTOCPage() 
  2957.  */ 
  2958. public function addTOCPage($orientation='', $format='', $keepmargins=false) { 
  2959.     $this->AddPage($orientation, $format, $keepmargins, true); 
  2960. } 
  2961.  
  2962. /** 
  2963.  * Terminate the current TOC (Table Of Content) page 
  2964.  * @public 
  2965.  * @since 5.0.001 (2010-05-06) 
  2966.  * @see AddPage(), startPage(), endPage(), addTOCPage() 
  2967.  */ 
  2968. public function endTOCPage() { 
  2969.     $this->endPage(true); 
  2970. } 
  2971.  
  2972. /** 
  2973.  * Adds a new page to the document. If a page is already present, the Footer() method is called first to output the footer (if enabled). Then the page is added, the current position set to the top-left corner according to the left and top margins (or top-right if in RTL mode), and Header() is called to display the header (if enabled). 
  2974.  * The origin of the coordinate system is at the top-left corner (or top-right for RTL) and increasing ordinates go downwards. 
  2975.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>P or PORTRAIT (default)</li><li>L or LANDSCAPE</li></ul> 
  2976.  * @param $format (mixed) The format used for pages. It can be either: one of the string values specified at getPageSizeFromFormat() or an array of parameters specified at setPageFormat(). 
  2977.  * @param $keepmargins (boolean) if true overwrites the default page margins with the current margins 
  2978.  * @param $tocpage (boolean) if true set the tocpage state to true (the added page will be used to display Table Of Content). 
  2979.  * @public 
  2980.  * @since 1.0 
  2981.  * @see startPage(), endPage(), addTOCPage(), endTOCPage(), getPageSizeFromFormat(), setPageFormat() 
  2982.  */ 
  2983. public function AddPage($orientation='', $format='', $keepmargins=false, $tocpage=false) { 
  2984.     if ($this->inxobj) { 
  2985.         // we are inside an XObject template 
  2986.         return; 
  2987.     } 
  2988.     if (!isset($this->original_lMargin) OR $keepmargins) { 
  2989.         $this->original_lMargin = $this->lMargin; 
  2990.     } 
  2991.     if (!isset($this->original_rMargin) OR $keepmargins) { 
  2992.         $this->original_rMargin = $this->rMargin; 
  2993.     } 
  2994.     // terminate previous page 
  2995.     $this->endPage(); 
  2996.     // start new page 
  2997.     $this->startPage($orientation, $format, $tocpage); 
  2998. } 
  2999.  
  3000. /** 
  3001.  * Terminate the current page 
  3002.  * @param $tocpage (boolean) if true set the tocpage state to false (end the page used to display Table Of Content). 
  3003.  * @public 
  3004.  * @since 4.2.010 (2008-11-14) 
  3005.  * @see AddPage(), startPage(), addTOCPage(), endTOCPage() 
  3006.  */ 
  3007. public function endPage($tocpage=false) { 
  3008.     // check if page is already closed 
  3009.     if (($this->page == 0) OR ($this->numpages > $this->page) OR (!$this->pageopen[$this->page])) { 
  3010.         return; 
  3011.     } 
  3012.     // print page footer 
  3013.     $this->setFooter(); 
  3014.     // close page 
  3015.     $this->_endpage(); 
  3016.     // mark page as closed 
  3017.     $this->pageopen[$this->page] = false; 
  3018.     if ($tocpage) { 
  3019.         $this->tocpage = false; 
  3020.     } 
  3021. } 
  3022.  
  3023. /** 
  3024.  * Starts a new page to the document. The page must be closed using the endPage() function. 
  3025.  * The origin of the coordinate system is at the top-left corner and increasing ordinates go downwards. 
  3026.  * @param $orientation (string) page orientation. Possible values are (case insensitive):<ul><li>P or PORTRAIT (default)</li><li>L or LANDSCAPE</li></ul> 
  3027.  * @param $format (mixed) The format used for pages. It can be either: one of the string values specified at getPageSizeFromFormat() or an array of parameters specified at setPageFormat(). 
  3028.  * @param $tocpage (boolean) if true the page is designated to contain the Table-Of-Content. 
  3029.  * @since 4.2.010 (2008-11-14) 
  3030.  * @see AddPage(), endPage(), addTOCPage(), endTOCPage(), getPageSizeFromFormat(), setPageFormat() 
  3031.  * @public 
  3032.  */ 
  3033. public function startPage($orientation='', $format='', $tocpage=false) { 
  3034.     if ($tocpage) { 
  3035.         $this->tocpage = true; 
  3036.     } 
  3037.     // move page numbers of documents to be attached 
  3038.     if ($this->tocpage) { 
  3039.         // move reference to unexistent pages (used for page attachments) 
  3040.         // adjust outlines 
  3041.         $tmpoutlines = $this->outlines; 
  3042.         foreach ($tmpoutlines as $key => $outline) { 
  3043.             if (!$outline['f'] AND ($outline['p'] > $this->numpages)) { 
  3044.                 $this->outlines[$key]['p'] = ($outline['p'] + 1); 
  3045.             } 
  3046.         } 
  3047.         // adjust dests 
  3048.         $tmpdests = $this->dests; 
  3049.         foreach ($tmpdests as $key => $dest) { 
  3050.             if (!$dest['f'] AND ($dest['p'] > $this->numpages)) { 
  3051.                 $this->dests[$key]['p'] = ($dest['p'] + 1); 
  3052.             } 
  3053.         } 
  3054.         // adjust links 
  3055.         $tmplinks = $this->links; 
  3056.         foreach ($tmplinks as $key => $link) { 
  3057.             if (!$link['f'] AND ($link['p'] > $this->numpages)) { 
  3058.                 $this->links[$key]['p'] = ($link['p'] + 1); 
  3059.             } 
  3060.         } 
  3061.     } 
  3062.     if ($this->numpages > $this->page) { 
  3063.         // this page has been already added 
  3064.         $this->setPage($this->page + 1); 
  3065.         $this->SetY($this->tMargin); 
  3066.         return; 
  3067.     } 
  3068.     // start a new page 
  3069.     if ($this->state == 0) { 
  3070.         $this->Open(); 
  3071.     } 
  3072.     ++$this->numpages; 
  3073.     $this->swapMargins($this->booklet); 
  3074.     // save current graphic settings 
  3075.     $gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  3076.     // start new page 
  3077.     $this->_beginpage($orientation, $format); 
  3078.     // mark page as open 
  3079.     $this->pageopen[$this->page] = true; 
  3080.     // restore graphic settings 
  3081.     $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  3082.     // mark this point 
  3083.     $this->setPageMark(); 
  3084.     // print page header 
  3085.     $this->setHeader(); 
  3086.     // restore graphic settings 
  3087.     $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  3088.     // mark this point 
  3089.     $this->setPageMark(); 
  3090.     // print table header (if any) 
  3091.     $this->setTableHeader(); 
  3092.     // set mark for empty page check 
  3093.     $this->emptypagemrk[$this->page]= $this->pagelen[$this->page]; 
  3094. } 
  3095.  
  3096. /** 
  3097.  * Set start-writing mark on current page stream used to put borders and fills. 
  3098.  * Borders and fills are always created after content and inserted on the position marked by this method. 
  3099.  * This function must be called after calling Image() function for a background image. 
  3100.  * Background images must be always inserted before calling Multicell() or WriteHTMLCell() or WriteHTML() functions. 
  3101.  * @public 
  3102.  * @since 3.0.016 (2008-07-30) 
  3103.  */ 
  3104. public function setPageMark() { 
  3105.     $this->intmrk[$this->page] = $this->pagelen[$this->page]; 
  3106.     $this->bordermrk[$this->page] = $this->intmrk[$this->page]; 
  3107.     $this->setContentMark(); 
  3108. } 
  3109.  
  3110. /** 
  3111.  * Set start-writing mark on selected page. 
  3112.  * Borders and fills are always created after content and inserted on the position marked by this method. 
  3113.  * @param $page (int) page number (default is the current page) 
  3114.  * @protected 
  3115.  * @since 4.6.021 (2009-07-20) 
  3116.  */ 
  3117. protected function setContentMark($page=0) { 
  3118.     if ($page <= 0) { 
  3119.         $page = $this->page; 
  3120.     } 
  3121.     if (isset($this->footerlen[$page])) { 
  3122.         $this->cntmrk[$page] = $this->pagelen[$page] - $this->footerlen[$page]; 
  3123.     } else { 
  3124.         $this->cntmrk[$page] = $this->pagelen[$page]; 
  3125.     } 
  3126. } 
  3127.  
  3128. /** 
  3129.  * Set header data. 
  3130.  * @param $ln (string) header image logo 
  3131.  * @param $lw (string) header image logo width in mm 
  3132.  * @param $ht (string) string to print as title on document header 
  3133.  * @param $hs (string) string to print on document header 
  3134.  * @param $tc (array) RGB array color for text. 
  3135.  * @param $lc (array) RGB array color for line. 
  3136.  * @public 
  3137.  */ 
  3138. public function setHeaderData($ln='', $lw=0, $ht='', $hs='', $tc=array(0, 0, 0), $lc=array(0, 0, 0)) { 
  3139.     $this->header_logo = $ln; 
  3140.     $this->header_logo_width = $lw; 
  3141.     $this->header_title = $ht; 
  3142.     $this->header_string = $hs; 
  3143.     $this->header_text_color = $tc; 
  3144.     $this->header_line_color = $lc; 
  3145. } 
  3146.  
  3147. /** 
  3148.  * Set footer data. 
  3149.  * @param $tc (array) RGB array color for text. 
  3150.  * @param $lc (array) RGB array color for line. 
  3151.  * @public 
  3152.  */ 
  3153. public function setFooterData($tc=array(0, 0, 0), $lc=array(0, 0, 0)) { 
  3154.     $this->footer_text_color = $tc; 
  3155.     $this->footer_line_color = $lc; 
  3156. } 
  3157.  
  3158. /** 
  3159.  * Returns header data: 
  3160.  * <ul><li>$ret['logo'] = logo image</li><li>$ret['logo_width'] = width of the image logo in user units</li><li>$ret['title'] = header title</li><li>$ret['string'] = header description string</li></ul> 
  3161.  * @return array() 
  3162.  * @public 
  3163.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3164.  */ 
  3165. public function getHeaderData() { 
  3166.     $ret = array(); 
  3167.     $ret['logo'] = $this->header_logo; 
  3168.     $ret['logo_width'] = $this->header_logo_width; 
  3169.     $ret['title'] = $this->header_title; 
  3170.     $ret['string'] = $this->header_string; 
  3171.     $ret['text_color'] = $this->header_text_color; 
  3172.     $ret['line_color'] = $this->header_line_color; 
  3173.     return $ret; 
  3174. } 
  3175.  
  3176. /** 
  3177.  * Set header margin. 
  3178.  * (minimum distance between header and top page margin) 
  3179.  * @param $hm (int) distance in user units 
  3180.  * @public 
  3181.  */ 
  3182. public function setHeaderMargin($hm=10) { 
  3183.     $this->header_margin = $hm; 
  3184. } 
  3185.  
  3186. /** 
  3187.  * Returns header margin in user units. 
  3188.  * @return float 
  3189.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3190.  * @public 
  3191.  */ 
  3192. public function getHeaderMargin() { 
  3193.     return $this->header_margin; 
  3194. } 
  3195.  
  3196. /** 
  3197.  * Set footer margin. 
  3198.  * (minimum distance between footer and bottom page margin) 
  3199.  * @param $fm (int) distance in user units 
  3200.  * @public 
  3201.  */ 
  3202. public function setFooterMargin($fm=10) { 
  3203.     $this->footer_margin = $fm; 
  3204. } 
  3205.  
  3206. /** 
  3207.  * Returns footer margin in user units. 
  3208.  * @return float 
  3209.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3210.  * @public 
  3211.  */ 
  3212. public function getFooterMargin() { 
  3213.     return $this->footer_margin; 
  3214. } 
  3215. /** 
  3216.  * Set a flag to print page header. 
  3217.  * @param $val (boolean) set to true to print the page header (default), false otherwise. 
  3218.  * @public 
  3219.  */ 
  3220. public function setPrintHeader($val=true) { 
  3221.     $this->print_header = $val ? true : false; 
  3222. } 
  3223.  
  3224. /** 
  3225.  * Set a flag to print page footer. 
  3226.  * @param $val (boolean) set to true to print the page footer (default), false otherwise. 
  3227.  * @public 
  3228.  */ 
  3229. public function setPrintFooter($val=true) { 
  3230.     $this->print_footer = $val ? true : false; 
  3231. } 
  3232.  
  3233. /** 
  3234.  * Return the right-bottom (or left-bottom for RTL) corner X coordinate of last inserted image 
  3235.  * @return float 
  3236.  * @public 
  3237.  */ 
  3238. public function getImageRBX() { 
  3239.     return $this->img_rb_x; 
  3240. } 
  3241.  
  3242. /** 
  3243.  * Return the right-bottom (or left-bottom for RTL) corner Y coordinate of last inserted image 
  3244.  * @return float 
  3245.  * @public 
  3246.  */ 
  3247. public function getImageRBY() { 
  3248.     return $this->img_rb_y; 
  3249. } 
  3250.  
  3251. /** 
  3252.  * Reset the xobject template used by Header() method. 
  3253.  * @public 
  3254.  */ 
  3255. public function resetHeaderTemplate() { 
  3256.     $this->header_xobjid = false; 
  3257. } 
  3258.  
  3259. /** 
  3260.  * Set a flag to automatically reset the xobject template used by Header() method at each page. 
  3261.  * @param $val (boolean) set to true to reset Header xobject template at each page, false otherwise. 
  3262.  * @public 
  3263.  */ 
  3264. public function setHeaderTemplateAutoreset($val=true) { 
  3265.     $this->header_xobj_autoreset = $val ? true : false; 
  3266. } 
  3267.  
  3268. /** 
  3269.  * This method is used to render the page header. 
  3270.  * It is automatically called by AddPage() and could be overwritten in your own inherited class. 
  3271.  * @public 
  3272.  */ 
  3273. public function Header() { 
  3274.     if ($this->header_xobjid === false) { 
  3275.         // start a new XObject Template 
  3276.         $this->header_xobjid = $this->startTemplate($this->w, $this->tMargin); 
  3277.         $headerfont = $this->getHeaderFont(); 
  3278.         $headerdata = $this->getHeaderData(); 
  3279.         $this->y = $this->header_margin; 
  3280.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3281.             $this->x = $this->w - $this->original_rMargin; 
  3282.         } else { 
  3283.             $this->x = $this->original_lMargin; 
  3284.         } 
  3285.         if (($headerdata['logo']) AND ($headerdata['logo'] != K_BLANK_IMAGE)) { 
  3286.             $imgtype = TCPDF_IMAGES::getImageFileType(K_PATH_IMAGES.$headerdata['logo']); 
  3287.             if (($imgtype == 'eps') OR ($imgtype == 'ai')) { 
  3288.                 $this->ImageEps(K_PATH_IMAGES.$headerdata['logo'], '', '', $headerdata['logo_width']); 
  3289.             } elseif ($imgtype == 'svg') { 
  3290.                 $this->ImageSVG(K_PATH_IMAGES.$headerdata['logo'], '', '', $headerdata['logo_width']); 
  3291.             } else { 
  3292.                 $this->Image(K_PATH_IMAGES.$headerdata['logo'], '', '', $headerdata['logo_width']); 
  3293.             } 
  3294.             $imgy = $this->getImageRBY(); 
  3295.         } else { 
  3296.             $imgy = $this->y; 
  3297.         } 
  3298.         $cell_height = $this->getCellHeight($headerfont[2] / $this->k); 
  3299.         // set starting margin for text data cell 
  3300.         if ($this->getRTL()) { 
  3301.             $header_x = $this->original_rMargin + ($headerdata['logo_width'] * 1.1); 
  3302.         } else { 
  3303.             $header_x = $this->original_lMargin + ($headerdata['logo_width'] * 1.1); 
  3304.         } 
  3305.         $cw = $this->w - $this->original_lMargin - $this->original_rMargin - ($headerdata['logo_width'] * 1.1); 
  3306.         $this->SetTextColorArray($this->header_text_color); 
  3307.         // header title 
  3308.         $this->SetFont($headerfont[0], 'B', $headerfont[2] + 1); 
  3309.         $this->SetX($header_x); 
  3310.         $this->Cell($cw, $cell_height, $headerdata['title'], 0, 1, '', 0, '', 0); 
  3311.         // header string 
  3312.         $this->SetFont($headerfont[0], $headerfont[1], $headerfont[2]); 
  3313.         $this->SetX($header_x); 
  3314.         $this->MultiCell($cw, $cell_height, $headerdata['string'], 0, '', 0, 1, '', '', true, 0, false, true, 0, 'T', false); 
  3315.         // print an ending header line 
  3316.         $this->SetLineStyle(array('width' => 0.85 / $this->k, 'cap' => 'butt', 'join' => 'miter', 'dash' => 0, 'color' => $headerdata['line_color'])); 
  3317.         $this->SetY((2.835 / $this->k) + max($imgy, $this->y)); 
  3318.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3319.             $this->SetX($this->original_rMargin); 
  3320.         } else { 
  3321.             $this->SetX($this->original_lMargin); 
  3322.         } 
  3323.         $this->Cell(($this->w - $this->original_lMargin - $this->original_rMargin), 0, '', 'T', 0, 'C'); 
  3324.         $this->endTemplate(); 
  3325.     } 
  3326.     // print header template 
  3327.     $x = 0; 
  3328.     $dx = 0; 
  3329.     if (!$this->header_xobj_autoreset AND $this->booklet AND (($this->page % 2) == 0)) { 
  3330.         // adjust margins for booklet mode 
  3331.         $dx = ($this->original_lMargin - $this->original_rMargin); 
  3332.     } 
  3333.     if ($this->rtl) { 
  3334.         $x = $this->w + $dx; 
  3335.     } else { 
  3336.         $x = 0 + $dx; 
  3337.     } 
  3338.     $this->printTemplate($this->header_xobjid, $x, 0, 0, 0, '', '', false); 
  3339.     if ($this->header_xobj_autoreset) { 
  3340.         // reset header xobject template at each page 
  3341.         $this->header_xobjid = false; 
  3342.     } 
  3343. } 
  3344.  
  3345. /** 
  3346.  * This method is used to render the page footer. 
  3347.  * It is automatically called by AddPage() and could be overwritten in your own inherited class. 
  3348.  * @public 
  3349.  */ 
  3350. public function Footer() { 
  3351.     $cur_y = $this->y; 
  3352.     $this->SetTextColorArray($this->footer_text_color); 
  3353.     //set style for cell border 
  3354.     $line_width = (0.85 / $this->k); 
  3355.     $this->SetLineStyle(array('width' => $line_width, 'cap' => 'butt', 'join' => 'miter', 'dash' => 0, 'color' => $this->footer_line_color)); 
  3356.     //print document barcode 
  3357.     $barcode = $this->getBarcode(); 
  3358.     if (!empty($barcode)) { 
  3359.         $this->Ln($line_width); 
  3360.         $barcode_width = round(($this->w - $this->original_lMargin - $this->original_rMargin) / 3); 
  3361.         $style = array( 
  3362.             'position' => $this->rtl?'R':'L',  
  3363.             'align' => $this->rtl?'R':'L',  
  3364.             'stretch' => false,  
  3365.             'fitwidth' => true,  
  3366.             'cellfitalign' => '',  
  3367.             'border' => false,  
  3368.             'padding' => 0,  
  3369.             'fgcolor' => array(0, 0, 0),  
  3370.             'bgcolor' => false,  
  3371.             'text' => false 
  3372.  ); 
  3373.         $this->write1DBarcode($barcode, 'C128', '', $cur_y + $line_width, '', (($this->footer_margin / 3) - $line_width), 0.3, $style, ''); 
  3374.     } 
  3375.     $w_page = isset($this->l['w_page']) ? $this->l['w_page'].' ' : ''; 
  3376.     if (empty($this->pagegroups)) { 
  3377.         $pagenumtxt = $w_page.$this->getAliasNumPage().' / '.$this->getAliasNbPages(); 
  3378.     } else { 
  3379.         $pagenumtxt = $w_page.$this->getPageNumGroupAlias().' / '.$this->getPageGroupAlias(); 
  3380.     } 
  3381.     $this->SetY($cur_y); 
  3382.     //Print page number 
  3383.     if ($this->getRTL()) { 
  3384.         $this->SetX($this->original_rMargin); 
  3385.         $this->Cell(0, 0, $pagenumtxt, 'T', 0, 'L'); 
  3386.     } else { 
  3387.         $this->SetX($this->original_lMargin); 
  3388.         $this->Cell(0, 0, $this->getAliasRightShift().$pagenumtxt, 'T', 0, 'R'); 
  3389.     } 
  3390. } 
  3391.  
  3392. /** 
  3393.  * This method is used to render the page header. 
  3394.  * @protected 
  3395.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3396.  */ 
  3397. protected function setHeader() { 
  3398.     if (!$this->print_header OR ($this->state != 2)) { 
  3399.         return; 
  3400.     } 
  3401.     $this->InHeader = true; 
  3402.     $this->setGraphicVars($this->default_graphic_vars); 
  3403.     $temp_thead = $this->thead; 
  3404.     $temp_theadMargins = $this->theadMargins; 
  3405.     $lasth = $this->lasth; 
  3406.     $newline = $this->newline; 
  3407.     $this->_outSaveGraphicsState(); 
  3408.     $this->rMargin = $this->original_rMargin; 
  3409.     $this->lMargin = $this->original_lMargin; 
  3410.     $this->SetCellPadding(0); 
  3411.     //set current position 
  3412.     if ($this->rtl) { 
  3413.         $this->SetXY($this->original_rMargin, $this->header_margin); 
  3414.     } else { 
  3415.         $this->SetXY($this->original_lMargin, $this->header_margin); 
  3416.     } 
  3417.     $this->SetFont($this->header_font[0], $this->header_font[1], $this->header_font[2]); 
  3418.     $this->Header(); 
  3419.     //restore position 
  3420.     if ($this->rtl) { 
  3421.         $this->SetXY($this->original_rMargin, $this->tMargin); 
  3422.     } else { 
  3423.         $this->SetXY($this->original_lMargin, $this->tMargin); 
  3424.     } 
  3425.     $this->_outRestoreGraphicsState(); 
  3426.     $this->lasth = $lasth; 
  3427.     $this->thead = $temp_thead; 
  3428.     $this->theadMargins = $temp_theadMargins; 
  3429.     $this->newline = $newline; 
  3430.     $this->InHeader = false; 
  3431. } 
  3432.  
  3433. /** 
  3434.  * This method is used to render the page footer. 
  3435.  * @protected 
  3436.  * @since 3.0.012 (2008-07-24) 
  3437.  */ 
  3438. protected function setFooter() { 
  3439.     if ($this->state != 2) { 
  3440.         return; 
  3441.     } 
  3442.     $this->InFooter = true; 
  3443.     // save current graphic settings 
  3444.     $gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  3445.     // mark this point 
  3446.     $this->footerpos[$this->page] = $this->pagelen[$this->page]; 
  3447.     $this->_out("\n"); 
  3448.     if ($this->print_footer) { 
  3449.         $this->setGraphicVars($this->default_graphic_vars); 
  3450.         $this->current_column = 0; 
  3451.         $this->num_columns = 1; 
  3452.         $temp_thead = $this->thead; 
  3453.         $temp_theadMargins = $this->theadMargins; 
  3454.         $lasth = $this->lasth; 
  3455.         $this->_outSaveGraphicsState(); 
  3456.         $this->rMargin = $this->original_rMargin; 
  3457.         $this->lMargin = $this->original_lMargin; 
  3458.         $this->SetCellPadding(0); 
  3459.         //set current position 
  3460.         $footer_y = $this->h - $this->footer_margin; 
  3461.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3462.             $this->SetXY($this->original_rMargin, $footer_y); 
  3463.         } else { 
  3464.             $this->SetXY($this->original_lMargin, $footer_y); 
  3465.         } 
  3466.         $this->SetFont($this->footer_font[0], $this->footer_font[1], $this->footer_font[2]); 
  3467.         $this->Footer(); 
  3468.         //restore position 
  3469.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3470.             $this->SetXY($this->original_rMargin, $this->tMargin); 
  3471.         } else { 
  3472.             $this->SetXY($this->original_lMargin, $this->tMargin); 
  3473.         } 
  3474.         $this->_outRestoreGraphicsState(); 
  3475.         $this->lasth = $lasth; 
  3476.         $this->thead = $temp_thead; 
  3477.         $this->theadMargins = $temp_theadMargins; 
  3478.     } 
  3479.     // restore graphic settings 
  3480.     $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  3481.     $this->current_column = $gvars['current_column']; 
  3482.     $this->num_columns = $gvars['num_columns']; 
  3483.     // calculate footer length 
  3484.     $this->footerlen[$this->page] = $this->pagelen[$this->page] - $this->footerpos[$this->page] + 1; 
  3485.     $this->InFooter = false; 
  3486. } 
  3487.  
  3488. /** 
  3489.  * Check if we are on the page body (excluding page header and footer). 
  3490.  * @return true if we are not in page header nor in page footer, false otherwise. 
  3491.  * @protected 
  3492.  * @since 5.9.091 (2011-06-15) 
  3493.  */ 
  3494. protected function inPageBody() { 
  3495.     return (($this->InHeader === false) AND ($this->InFooter === false)); 
  3496. } 
  3497.  
  3498. /** 
  3499.  * This method is used to render the table header on new page (if any). 
  3500.  * @protected 
  3501.  * @since 4.5.030 (2009-03-25) 
  3502.  */ 
  3503. protected function setTableHeader() { 
  3504.     if ($this->num_columns > 1) { 
  3505.         // multi column mode 
  3506.         return; 
  3507.     } 
  3508.     if (isset($this->theadMargins['top'])) { 
  3509.         // restore the original top-margin 
  3510.         $this->tMargin = $this->theadMargins['top']; 
  3511.         $this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm'] = $this->tMargin; 
  3512.         $this->y = $this->tMargin; 
  3513.     } 
  3514.     if (!TCPDF_STATIC::empty_string($this->thead) AND (!$this->inthead)) { 
  3515.         // set margins 
  3516.         $prev_lMargin = $this->lMargin; 
  3517.         $prev_rMargin = $this->rMargin; 
  3518.         $prev_cell_padding = $this->cell_padding; 
  3519.         $this->lMargin = $this->theadMargins['lmargin'] + ($this->pagedim[$this->page]['olm'] - $this->pagedim[$this->theadMargins['page']]['olm']); 
  3520.         $this->rMargin = $this->theadMargins['rmargin'] + ($this->pagedim[$this->page]['orm'] - $this->pagedim[$this->theadMargins['page']]['orm']); 
  3521.         $this->cell_padding = $this->theadMargins['cell_padding']; 
  3522.         if ($this->rtl) { 
  3523.             $this->x = $this->w - $this->rMargin; 
  3524.         } else { 
  3525.             $this->x = $this->lMargin; 
  3526.         } 
  3527.         // account for special "cell" mode 
  3528.         if ($this->theadMargins['cell']) { 
  3529.             if ($this->rtl) { 
  3530.                 $this->x -= $this->cell_padding['R']; 
  3531.             } else { 
  3532.                 $this->x += $this->cell_padding['L']; 
  3533.             } 
  3534.         } 
  3535.         $gvars = $this->getGraphicVars(); 
  3536.         if (!empty($this->theadMargins['gvars'])) { 
  3537.             // set the correct graphic style 
  3538.             $this->setGraphicVars($this->theadMargins['gvars']); 
  3539.             $this->rMargin = $gvars['rMargin']; 
  3540.             $this->lMargin = $gvars['lMargin']; 
  3541.         } 
  3542.         // print table header 
  3543.         $this->writeHTML($this->thead, false, false, false, false, ''); 
  3544.         $this->setGraphicVars($gvars); 
  3545.         // set new top margin to skip the table headers 
  3546.         if (!isset($this->theadMargins['top'])) { 
  3547.             $this->theadMargins['top'] = $this->tMargin; 
  3548.         } 
  3549.         // store end of header position 
  3550.         if (!isset($this->columns[0]['th'])) { 
  3551.             $this->columns[0]['th'] = array(); 
  3552.         } 
  3553.         $this->columns[0]['th']['\''.$this->page.'\''] = $this->y; 
  3554.         $this->tMargin = $this->y; 
  3555.         $this->pagedim[$this->page]['tm'] = $this->tMargin; 
  3556.         $this->lasth = 0; 
  3557.         $this->lMargin = $prev_lMargin; 
  3558.         $this->rMargin = $prev_rMargin; 
  3559.         $this->cell_padding = $prev_cell_padding; 
  3560.     } 
  3561. } 
  3562.  
  3563. /** 
  3564.  * Returns the current page number. 
  3565.  * @return int page number 
  3566.  * @public 
  3567.  * @since 1.0 
  3568.  * @see getAliasNbPages() 
  3569.  */ 
  3570. public function PageNo() { 
  3571.     return $this->page; 
  3572. } 
  3573.  
  3574. /** 
  3575.  * Returns the array of spot colors. 
  3576.  * @return (array) Spot colors array. 
  3577.  * @public 
  3578.  * @since 6.0.038 (2013-09-30) 
  3579.  */ 
  3580. public function getAllSpotColors() { 
  3581.     return $this->spot_colors; 
  3582. } 
  3583.  
  3584. /** 
  3585.  * Defines a new spot color. 
  3586.  * It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. 
  3587.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3588.  * @param $name (string) Full name of the spot color. 
  3589.  * @param $c (float) Cyan color for CMYK. Value between 0 and 100. 
  3590.  * @param $m (float) Magenta color for CMYK. Value between 0 and 100. 
  3591.  * @param $y (float) Yellow color for CMYK. Value between 0 and 100. 
  3592.  * @param $k (float) Key (Black) color for CMYK. Value between 0 and 100. 
  3593.  * @public 
  3594.  * @since 3.0.024 (2008-09-12) 
  3595.  * @see SetDrawSpotColor(), SetFillSpotColor(), SetTextSpotColor() 
  3596.  */ 
  3597. public function AddSpotColor($name, $c, $m, $y, $k) { 
  3598.     if (!isset($this->spot_colors[$name])) { 
  3599.         $i = (1 + count($this->spot_colors)); 
  3600.         $this->spot_colors[$name] = array('C' => $c, 'M' => $m, 'Y' => $y, 'K' => $k, 'name' => $name, 'i' => $i); 
  3601.     } 
  3602. } 
  3603.  
  3604. /** 
  3605.  * Set the spot color for the specified type ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3606.  * @param $type (string) Type of object affected by this color: ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3607.  * @param $name (string) Name of the spot color. 
  3608.  * @param $tint (float) Intensity of the color (from 0 to 100 ; 100 = full intensity by default). 
  3609.  * @return (string) PDF color command. 
  3610.  * @public 
  3611.  * @since 5.9.125 (2011-10-03) 
  3612.  */ 
  3613. public function setSpotColor($type, $name, $tint=100) { 
  3614.     $spotcolor = TCPDF_COLORS::getSpotColor($name, $this->spot_colors); 
  3615.     if ($spotcolor === false) { 
  3616.         $this->Error('Undefined spot color: '.$name.', you must add it using the AddSpotColor() method.'); 
  3617.     } 
  3618.     $tint = (max(0, min(100, $tint)) / 100); 
  3619.     $pdfcolor = sprintf('/CS%d ', $this->spot_colors[$name]['i']); 
  3620.     switch ($type) { 
  3621.         case 'draw': { 
  3622.             $pdfcolor .= sprintf('CS %F SCN', $tint); 
  3623.             $this->DrawColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3624.             $this->strokecolor = $spotcolor; 
  3625.             break; 
  3626.         } 
  3627.         case 'fill': { 
  3628.             $pdfcolor .= sprintf('cs %F scn', $tint); 
  3629.             $this->FillColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3630.             $this->bgcolor = $spotcolor; 
  3631.             break; 
  3632.         } 
  3633.         case 'text': { 
  3634.             $pdfcolor .= sprintf('cs %F scn', $tint); 
  3635.             $this->TextColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3636.             $this->fgcolor = $spotcolor; 
  3637.             break; 
  3638.         } 
  3639.     } 
  3640.     $this->ColorFlag = ($this->FillColor != $this->TextColor); 
  3641.     if ($this->state == 2) { 
  3642.         $this->_out($pdfcolor); 
  3643.     } 
  3644.     if ($this->inxobj) { 
  3645.         // we are inside an XObject template 
  3646.         $this->xobjects[$this->xobjid]['spot_colors'][$name] = $this->spot_colors[$name]; 
  3647.     } 
  3648.     return $pdfcolor; 
  3649. } 
  3650.  
  3651. /** 
  3652.  * Defines the spot color used for all drawing operations (lines, rectangles and cell borders). 
  3653.  * @param $name (string) Name of the spot color. 
  3654.  * @param $tint (float) Intensity of the color (from 0 to 100 ; 100 = full intensity by default). 
  3655.  * @public 
  3656.  * @since 3.0.024 (2008-09-12) 
  3657.  * @see AddSpotColor(), SetFillSpotColor(), SetTextSpotColor() 
  3658.  */ 
  3659. public function SetDrawSpotColor($name, $tint=100) { 
  3660.     $this->setSpotColor('draw', $name, $tint); 
  3661. } 
  3662.  
  3663. /** 
  3664.  * Defines the spot color used for all filling operations (filled rectangles and cell backgrounds). 
  3665.  * @param $name (string) Name of the spot color. 
  3666.  * @param $tint (float) Intensity of the color (from 0 to 100 ; 100 = full intensity by default). 
  3667.  * @public 
  3668.  * @since 3.0.024 (2008-09-12) 
  3669.  * @see AddSpotColor(), SetDrawSpotColor(), SetTextSpotColor() 
  3670.  */ 
  3671. public function SetFillSpotColor($name, $tint=100) { 
  3672.     $this->setSpotColor('fill', $name, $tint); 
  3673. } 
  3674.  
  3675. /** 
  3676.  * Defines the spot color used for text. 
  3677.  * @param $name (string) Name of the spot color. 
  3678.  * @param $tint (int) Intensity of the color (from 0 to 100 ; 100 = full intensity by default). 
  3679.  * @public 
  3680.  * @since 3.0.024 (2008-09-12) 
  3681.  * @see AddSpotColor(), SetDrawSpotColor(), SetFillSpotColor() 
  3682.  */ 
  3683. public function SetTextSpotColor($name, $tint=100) { 
  3684.     $this->setSpotColor('text', $name, $tint); 
  3685. } 
  3686.  
  3687. /** 
  3688.  * Set the color array for the specified type ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3689.  * It can be expressed in RGB, CMYK or GRAY SCALE components. 
  3690.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3691.  * @param $type (string) Type of object affected by this color: ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3692.  * @param $color (array) Array of colors (1=gray, 3=RGB, 4=CMYK or 5=spotcolor=CMYK+name values). 
  3693.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the PDF command. 
  3694.  * @return (string) The PDF command or empty string. 
  3695.  * @public 
  3696.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-06-11) 
  3697.  */ 
  3698. public function setColorArray($type, $color, $ret=false) { 
  3699.     if (is_array($color)) { 
  3700.         $color = array_values($color); 
  3701.         // component: grey, RGB red or CMYK cyan 
  3702.         $c = isset($color[0]) ? $color[0] : -1; 
  3703.         // component: RGB green or CMYK magenta 
  3704.         $m = isset($color[1]) ? $color[1] : -1; 
  3705.         // component: RGB blue or CMYK yellow 
  3706.         $y = isset($color[2]) ? $color[2] : -1; 
  3707.         // component: CMYK black 
  3708.         $k = isset($color[3]) ? $color[3] : -1; 
  3709.         // color name 
  3710.         $name = isset($color[4]) ? $color[4] : ''; 
  3711.         if ($c >= 0) { 
  3712.             return $this->setColor($type, $c, $m, $y, $k, $ret, $name); 
  3713.         } 
  3714.     } 
  3715.     return ''; 
  3716. } 
  3717.  
  3718. /** 
  3719.  * Defines the color used for all drawing operations (lines, rectangles and cell borders). 
  3720.  * It can be expressed in RGB, CMYK or GRAY SCALE components. 
  3721.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3722.  * @param $color (array) Array of colors (1, 3 or 4 values). 
  3723.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the PDF command. 
  3724.  * @return string the PDF command 
  3725.  * @public 
  3726.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-06-11) 
  3727.  * @see SetDrawColor() 
  3728.  */ 
  3729. public function SetDrawColorArray($color, $ret=false) { 
  3730.     return $this->setColorArray('draw', $color, $ret); 
  3731. } 
  3732.  
  3733. /** 
  3734.  * Defines the color used for all filling operations (filled rectangles and cell backgrounds). 
  3735.  * It can be expressed in RGB, CMYK or GRAY SCALE components. 
  3736.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3737.  * @param $color (array) Array of colors (1, 3 or 4 values). 
  3738.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the PDF command. 
  3739.  * @public 
  3740.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-6-11) 
  3741.  * @see SetFillColor() 
  3742.  */ 
  3743. public function SetFillColorArray($color, $ret=false) { 
  3744.     return $this->setColorArray('fill', $color, $ret); 
  3745. } 
  3746.  
  3747. /** 
  3748.  * Defines the color used for text. It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. 
  3749.  * The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3750.  * @param $color (array) Array of colors (1, 3 or 4 values). 
  3751.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the PDF command. 
  3752.  * @public 
  3753.  * @since 3.1.000 (2008-6-11) 
  3754.  * @see SetFillColor() 
  3755.  */ 
  3756. public function SetTextColorArray($color, $ret=false) { 
  3757.     return $this->setColorArray('text', $color, $ret); 
  3758. } 
  3759.  
  3760. /** 
  3761.  * Defines the color used by the specified type ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3762.  * @param $type (string) Type of object affected by this color: ('draw', 'fill', 'text'). 
  3763.  * @param $col1 (float) GRAY level for single color, or Red color for RGB (0-255), or CYAN color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3764.  * @param $col2 (float) GREEN color for RGB (0-255), or MAGENTA color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3765.  * @param $col3 (float) BLUE color for RGB (0-255), or YELLOW color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3766.  * @param $col4 (float) KEY (BLACK) color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3767.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the command. 
  3768.  * @param $name (string) spot color name (if any) 
  3769.  * @return (string) The PDF command or empty string. 
  3770.  * @public 
  3771.  * @since 5.9.125 (2011-10-03) 
  3772.  */ 
  3773. public function setColor($type, $col1=0, $col2=-1, $col3=-1, $col4=-1, $ret=false, $name='') { 
  3774.     // set default values 
  3775.     if (!is_numeric($col1)) { 
  3776.         $col1 = 0; 
  3777.     } 
  3778.     if (!is_numeric($col2)) { 
  3779.         $col2 = -1; 
  3780.     } 
  3781.     if (!is_numeric($col3)) { 
  3782.         $col3 = -1; 
  3783.     } 
  3784.     if (!is_numeric($col4)) { 
  3785.         $col4 = -1; 
  3786.     } 
  3787.     // set color by case 
  3788.     $suffix = ''; 
  3789.     if (($col2 == -1) AND ($col3 == -1) AND ($col4 == -1)) { 
  3790.         // Grey scale 
  3791.         $col1 = max(0, min(255, $col1)); 
  3792.         $intcolor = array('G' => $col1); 
  3793.         $pdfcolor = sprintf('%F ', ($col1 / 255)); 
  3794.         $suffix = 'g'; 
  3795.     } elseif ($col4 == -1) { 
  3796.         // RGB 
  3797.         $col1 = max(0, min(255, $col1)); 
  3798.         $col2 = max(0, min(255, $col2)); 
  3799.         $col3 = max(0, min(255, $col3)); 
  3800.         $intcolor = array('R' => $col1, 'G' => $col2, 'B' => $col3); 
  3801.         $pdfcolor = sprintf('%F %F %F ', ($col1 / 255), ($col2 / 255), ($col3 / 255)); 
  3802.         $suffix = 'rg'; 
  3803.     } else { 
  3804.         $col1 = max(0, min(100, $col1)); 
  3805.         $col2 = max(0, min(100, $col2)); 
  3806.         $col3 = max(0, min(100, $col3)); 
  3807.         $col4 = max(0, min(100, $col4)); 
  3808.         if (empty($name)) { 
  3809.             // CMYK 
  3810.             $intcolor = array('C' => $col1, 'M' => $col2, 'Y' => $col3, 'K' => $col4); 
  3811.             $pdfcolor = sprintf('%F %F %F %F ', ($col1 / 100), ($col2 / 100), ($col3 / 100), ($col4 / 100)); 
  3812.             $suffix = 'k'; 
  3813.         } else { 
  3814.             // SPOT COLOR 
  3815.             $intcolor = array('C' => $col1, 'M' => $col2, 'Y' => $col3, 'K' => $col4, 'name' => $name); 
  3816.             $this->AddSpotColor($name, $col1, $col2, $col3, $col4); 
  3817.             $pdfcolor = $this->setSpotColor($type, $name, 100); 
  3818.         } 
  3819.     } 
  3820.     switch ($type) { 
  3821.         case 'draw': { 
  3822.             $pdfcolor .= strtoupper($suffix); 
  3823.             $this->DrawColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3824.             $this->strokecolor = $intcolor; 
  3825.             break; 
  3826.         } 
  3827.         case 'fill': { 
  3828.             $pdfcolor .= $suffix; 
  3829.             $this->FillColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3830.             $this->bgcolor = $intcolor; 
  3831.             break; 
  3832.         } 
  3833.         case 'text': { 
  3834.             $pdfcolor .= $suffix; 
  3835.             $this->TextColor = $pdfcolor; 
  3836.             $this->fgcolor = $intcolor; 
  3837.             break; 
  3838.         } 
  3839.     } 
  3840.     $this->ColorFlag = ($this->FillColor != $this->TextColor); 
  3841.     if (($type != 'text') AND ($this->state == 2)) { 
  3842.         if (!$ret) { 
  3843.             $this->_out($pdfcolor); 
  3844.         } 
  3845.         return $pdfcolor; 
  3846.     } 
  3847.     return ''; 
  3848. } 
  3849.  
  3850. /** 
  3851.  * Defines the color used for all drawing operations (lines, rectangles and cell borders). It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3852.  * @param $col1 (float) GRAY level for single color, or Red color for RGB (0-255), or CYAN color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3853.  * @param $col2 (float) GREEN color for RGB (0-255), or MAGENTA color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3854.  * @param $col3 (float) BLUE color for RGB (0-255), or YELLOW color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3855.  * @param $col4 (float) KEY (BLACK) color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3856.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the command. 
  3857.  * @param $name (string) spot color name (if any) 
  3858.  * @return string the PDF command 
  3859.  * @public 
  3860.  * @since 1.3 
  3861.  * @see SetDrawColorArray(), SetFillColor(), SetTextColor(), Line(), Rect(), Cell(), MultiCell() 
  3862.  */ 
  3863. public function SetDrawColor($col1=0, $col2=-1, $col3=-1, $col4=-1, $ret=false, $name='') { 
  3864.     return $this->setColor('draw', $col1, $col2, $col3, $col4, $ret, $name); 
  3865. } 
  3866.  
  3867. /** 
  3868.  * Defines the color used for all filling operations (filled rectangles and cell backgrounds). It can be expressed in RGB components or gray scale. The method can be called before the first page is created and the value is retained from page to page. 
  3869.  * @param $col1 (float) GRAY level for single color, or Red color for RGB (0-255), or CYAN color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3870.  * @param $col2 (float) GREEN color for RGB (0-255), or MAGENTA color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3871.  * @param $col3 (float) BLUE color for RGB (0-255), or YELLOW color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3872.  * @param $col4 (float) KEY (BLACK) color for CMYK (0-100). 
  3873.  * @param $ret (boolean) If true do not send the command. 
  3874.  * @param $name (string) Spot color name (if any).
